loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana has earned a living through her sari-sari, or variety store, for several years now. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her area. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Valeriana is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, bread and snack foods, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries and other items for her store.  With this loan, she will be able to increase her inventory and attract more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, bread and snack foods, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries and other items for her store.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is from Iraq. This 22-year-old youth client is single and lives with six family members, of whom four are employed.

Yaser has a small shop for selling mobile phones and accessories. He established  with an excellent reputation.his business in 2011. He has built a good reputation among his neighbors for his business's quality. 

He is requesting a $2,400 youth loan to pay his shop's yearly rent. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide  better life conditions for himself.

loans.use: to pay his shop's yearly rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat for her shop.

loans.name: Nika

texts.en:
Nika is 25 years old and is a farmer from the village of Chumlaki in East Georgia. He lives with his family, including his wife and two children. Nika is the only income provider in the family. His wife is a housewife. 

Nika grows peaches on the family-owned land and sells the fruit seasonally. He also owns a tractor and rents it at tiling season.  The total average monthly income of the family is 350 GEL, which is hardly enough for a four-member family. According to Credo estimations, Nika’s family belongs in the "vulnerable poor" category. 

Nika has decided to start an agricultural business. He has requested credit from Kiva so he can buy calves. He will grow calves and sell them in the summer for a higher price. This will provide additional income to the family, and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Trai

texts.en:
Trai was born in 1975. She has two children: her daughter is a worker and her son is learning in the 10th grade. Her husband and she are building workers to earn a living. They have done this job for 10 years. She gets 3,000,000 VND a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,600,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy construction tools. Her dream is to be able to let her children have good careers and save more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction tools to do her job.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda, She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family. She also has a food stall for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help fund her family’s daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Luzviminda hopes to have a mini grocery store and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Magreth, who is in her late 30s, is married with three school-going children. She has been running a charcoal business for eight years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to earn a very good monthly profit.

This will be Magreth's eleventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a plot, TV set, radio, fridge and sofa set as well as to cover household expenses and increase her charcoal stock. She has paid all her loans successfully. She is requesting a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Magreth will share this loan with her loan group, "COMPRESSOR," which has a total of 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 45 years old. She lives in the Tkibuli district with her son and mother, who has a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a pig and a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Additionally, they have .3 hectares of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. 

Marina is a very hardworking woman who does her best to ensure she produces a good harvest. She has requested a loan to purchase a milk cow and for repairing her shed. After purchasing an additional milk cow, she will be able to produce more dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Marina awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and to repair her shed.

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en:
Nyamaa is 36 years old, married, and has one child who attends school.  They live in a ger in Darhan province of Mongolia. Her husband works at local private company as a welder. Nyamaa is half disabled and never worked before. She has started growing organic vegetables in their plot of land and is now planning to make it a business and increase the volume of organic vegetable she grows. 

Nyamaa is requesting a loan for 5,000,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase large amount of seeds and soils to grow organic vegetables which she will sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, optimistic, and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase lseeds and soils to grow organic vegetable.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna: 45, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Emelito, a tricycle driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling individually. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an increase of her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Edna hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and, there, she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1986. She has two sons who are in 1st grade and 3rd grade. Her husband and she are carpenters. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 14,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy carpentry tools such as chisels and saws. She wants to raise her children well and enlarge her wood workshop.

loans.use: to buy carpentry tools such as chisels and saws.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 48, is from Nyandarua South and is married with five children who are all in school.

Stephen is a farmer. He has been in this business for the past three years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds to use on his farm.

He hopes to be the leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan was born in 1964. She has a son who is studying at college. Her husband is dead. She raises chickens and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has done this job for 20 years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 4,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle, she borrowed 6,048,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy food for her chickens and fertilizer for her vegetables. She always wants to raise her son well and upgrade her farm.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens and fertilizer for her vegetables.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
This is Belen, age 47, who is a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, in the Philippines. She is married to Nelson, an employee, and a mother to their children. She and Nelson manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Belen operates a school supplies business where people go to buy school supplies such as pens, bond paper, etc., without having to go to a bookstore. She buys the supplies at wholesale prices and then sells them by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales daily.

To help her continue operating her business, Belen is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Belen dreams her business will grow and expand. She also dreams of giving her children a good and high-quality education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for school and office supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Luis, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para la compra de verduras para fortalecer el negocio, porque está en las festividades y la demanda aumenta, se comprara tomates, cebollas, carnes, gaseosas, jugos y otros productos de primera necesidad.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior,  mejoro sus ventas y los ingresos para trabajar y proveer lo necesario a su familia, su intensión es ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida con la familia, tambien sigue realizando reparaciones en su taller de mecanica, que es un ingreso adicional para la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Luis decided to request another loan in order to buy vegetables to re-stock his business. During the holidays, demand for his products greatly increases, so he plans to buy more tomatoes, onions, meat, sodas, juices, and other basic food items. Luis fared very well with his previous loan; his sales increased, as did his earnings. Because of this, he was able to provide for his family. He hopes to be able to offer them a better quality of life.

Luis will also continue to work doing auto repairs in his shop, which serves as an additional source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, meat, sodas, and juices.

loans.name: Gizo

texts.en:
Gizo is 44 years old, from the small village of Terjola district. He lives with his mother, two children, and a daughter-in-law. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Gizo works locally as an artisan and gets a monthly income. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market, at a good price. In addition, Gizo has a tractor and serves local people, plowing agricultural land. 

Gizo is a very hard-working man and does his best to increase the income of his family. He requested a loan to roof the house. As their roof is too old and needs repairing, he plans to change it with a new one. After the roof is changed, their living conditions will be improved. Gizo awaits your support.

loans.use: to roof his house.

loans.name: Nha

texts.en:
Nha was born in 1991. She has two children who are under three years old. Nha and her husband are carpenters. She earns about VND 3,000,000 per month. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 13,000,000 per month. 
	
Nha has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle, she borrowed VND 7,392,000 and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 8,736,000 to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on sacks of cement for his hardware store.

loans.name: Estela Blanca

texts.es:
Estela, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para poder invertir en el negocio, se comprara enchape, aretes, anillos, cadenas y lociones en variedad, esto le ayudara para poder ofrecer a sus clientes en mas y nuevos productos.

Con el préstamo anterior Estela realizo una buena inversión en el negocio, ayudando a incrementar sus condiciones como comerciante, en su familia considera que sus condiciones han mejorado.
texts.en:
Estela has decided to request another loan in order to invest in her business. She will buy plated jewelry, earrings, rings, chains, and a variety of lotions. This will help Estela be able to offer her customers a better variety of merchandise.

With her previous loan, Estela made a successful investment in her business. This helped improve her circumstances as a merchant as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy plated jewelry, earrings, rings, chains, and lotions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is from a small village in the Samtredia district. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband, two children, and retired mother-in-law. Ketevan’s husband works locally as an artisan and earns a monthly salary. In addition, Ketevan owns a plot of land where nuts are grown. She does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The family sells on average 200-300 kg of nuts per year. In addition, Ketevan runs a dairy farm with a calf and two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local, open market. 

Ketevan works hard to do her best for her family. She requested a loan to change the doors and windows in her house. The rest of the loan will be used for renovation of the living room. Her existing house is old and damaged. Ketevan will purchase building materials and repair her home. Then the living conditions of her family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard work-day in a more comfortable environment. Ketevan hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Digna Esperanza

texts.es:
Digna, necesita más capital para continuar trabajando, pues quiere con los fondos prestados comprarse maíz al mayoreo, leña y frijol, con esto estará elaborando los tamales para comercializar, este crédito le ayudara a tener lo necesario para un tiempo de venta.

Considera que el préstamo anterior le dio lo necesario en recursos, hasta el momento se ha mantenido con las ganancias del mismo negocio, colaborando a su familia en todo lo más necesario.
texts.en:
Digna needs more capital in order to continue working. She will use this loan to buy corn at wholesale, firewood, and beans with which to make tamales to sell. This loan will help her to have everything she needs to prepare and sell them. 

Digna's previous loan helped her to obtain all the necessary resources for her to work, and since then she has been earning more from her work and has been able to help out with her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale, firewood, and beans.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is a 62-year-old widow who lives with her son in Ger, in the Hentii province of Mongolia. Her son runs a transportation service business in town. Oyunchimeg has been running her recyclable materials retail business in the local market. She has gained lot of regular customers over the years. 

Oyunchimeg is now requesting MNT 3,500,000 to purchase a large amount of recyclable materials from households and sell them to recycling companies. She is a hard-working, modest and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of recyclable materials from households and sell them to recycling companies.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 52 years old. He is from the small village of Terjola district. He lives with his wife and son. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Besides this, Merab also has a pig and sells piglets. 

Merab is a very hardworking man and does his best to increase the income of his family. He requested a loan for purchasing a pig and feed for the livestock. After purchasing an additional pig, he will be able to increase the livestock and thus, increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Merab awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and feed for the livestock

loans.name: Erika Lissette

texts.es:
Erika, solicita un préstamo para poder surtir la tienda, se comprara productos variados necesarios para tener un negocio con mejor condición, boquitas, galletas, gaseosas, dulces, entre otros que sean necesarios y que pueden generarle más ventas.

Con el préstamo anterior, Erika comenta que las ganancias han mejorado, ya que su clientela le ha demandado, ha adquirido en este periodo un vehículo, producto de su trabajo y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Erika is requesting another loan in order to stock her store. She will buy a variety of products that she needs to improve her business. She will buy snacks, cookies, sodas, candy, and other necessary items in order to generate more sales.

With her previous loan, Erika increased her earnings and earned more business. Her hard work paid of and she was able to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy snacks, cookies, sodas, and candy.

loans.name: Fredy Isai

texts.es:
Fredy, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para poder invertir en el negocio, adquiriendo variedad de prendas enchapadas como aretes, cadenas, pulseras y anillos, que son el producto que muestra a los clientes y del cual obtiene buenos beneficios.

Él manifiesta que a través de los préstamos ha logrado tener mejores ventas, pues adquirió prendas en variedad de estilos, le ha permitido en su familia mejorar la calidad de vida y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Fredy has decided to request another loan to invest in his business. He will buy some plated jewelry such as earrings, chains, bracelets, and rings, which he presents for customers and has been successful selling.

With his previous loan, Fredy was able to increase his sales with the various pieces of jewelry he bought. He has been able to increase his earnings and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy earrings, chains, bracelets, and rings.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, recurre a solicitar un préstamo nuevamente para continuar prosperando, se comprara un lote de verduras tomates, cebollas, chiles y frutas frescas, uvas, manzanas, peras, las cuales le servirán para ofrecer  a los clientes más variedad. 

El crédito anterior, le dio un efecto positivo al negocio, le ayudo a incrementar el negocio, sus condiciones familiares han mejorado, esta agradecida por el aporte.
texts.en:
Gloria needs to invest in her business.  She is returning to request a new loan so that she can continue to prosper.  She will use the loan to buy vegetables in bulk, including tomatoes, onions, chili peppers.  She will also buy fresh fruit, including grapes, apples, and pears.  This way, she will be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

With her last loan, Gloria saw a positive impact on her business.  The loan helped her to grow her business, and her family's living conditions have improved.  Gloria is grateful for the support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fresh fruit

loans.name: Tuimizane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Charlotte, trésorière du groupe d’affaire Tuimizane, Femme dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée d’environ 34 ans, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse des souliers. Son mari est actuellement  sans emploi formel. Elle commença son business vers les années 2000 avec de fonds propres reçu de son mari. Elle fut initiée par ses pairs. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient de réalise 11 cycles de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires régressent suite aux effets de la guerre. Grâce aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé l’achat de la parcelle. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 30 paires de souliers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et accroitre son entreprise. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Charlotte is the treasurer of the business group Tuimizane. A dynamic woman and entrepreneur, she is the 34-year-old mother of seven children who all attend school. 

Charlotte sells shoes. Her husband is currently without steady employment. Charlotte started her activity in the 2000s using money given by her husband as a starting capital. She was introduced to this business by her peers. The profits earned are used to feed her family and pay for the children’s tuition, and to bolster her savings. 

Charlotte has completed 11 loan cycles, a period during which her business suffered repercussions from the war. Thanks to the financial assistance obtained through Hekima, she has been able to afford a plot of land. 

She will use this new loan to buy 30 pairs of shoes. She would like to see her children grow up and to expand her business. 

Charlotte thanks Hekima for helping low-income women to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy 30 pairs of shoes for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh was born in 1984. She is a single mother with a little child. She does carpentry to earn a living. She gains from it 5,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy wood to make furniture to sell. She wants to do a good job of raising her child and be able to get well-paid jobs in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Zilper

texts.en:
Zilper is 54 years old. She owns a beauty salon in Tudor Mombasa. She is a single mother of three, who has been in this business for the last four years and her income is great. 

Zilper is requesting the second loan to purchase a dryer machine and salon detergents. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Her previous loan was successfully paid and she hopes to open up three other beauty salons in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dryer machine and detergents for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Margo

texts.en: Margo is from the village of Marani. She is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children. Margo’s husband works as a teacher at the local school and gets a small monthly salary. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They are involved in the animal husbandry business and have four milk cows, whose milk is used to make cheese products. They sell approximately 70 kg of cheese per month.  In addition, Margo grows nuts on the family-owned land. She does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The family also has three pigs and sells on average 36 piglets per year. Margo is a very hardworking person, with a rich work history. She requested a loan to purchase a milking cow which will enable her to produce and sell more cheese. She wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Salamata Demba

texts.fr:
Madame Salamata, âgée de 52 ans, est veuve et mère de 2 enfants dont le plus âgé a 26 ans et le plus jeune, 22 ans. Elle fait du commerce de tissus depuis 11 ans maintenant. Depuis le décès de son époux, c’est elle qui s’occupe quotidiennement de la dépense de sa famille. Avec le crédit, elle pourra acheter des tissus pour les revendre afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de son foyer à partir des bénéfices tirés de son activité.
Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite élargir son commerce et ouvrir une boutique de vente de tissus.
texts.en:
Ms. Salamata, aged 52, is a widow and the mother of two children, of whom the oldest is 26 years old, and the youngest is 22. She has been doing commerce in cloth for eleven years now. Since her husband's death, she is the one who takes care of family expenses each day. 

With this loan, she will be able to purchase cloth to resell and be able to improve her home's food situation by using the profits made from her business. For the future, she would like to expand her business and open a shop selling cloth.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to resell

loans.name: Sandra Haydee

texts.es:
Sandra, vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos con su esposo, ella administra una venta de tortillas y también de pupusas y verduras, estos negocios le han permitido ayuda de su esposo para el sustento de su familia.

Ella manifiesta que actualmente tiene la necesidad de un préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de los materiales para la elaboración de la venta por ejemplo se comprará maíz por mayor cantidad, aceite, tomates, cebollas, chicharrón, leña y otros productos necesarios que le ayudarán a tener a la mano para poder realizar la venta.

Su aspiración es a través del negocio ayudar a sus hijos a que puedan desarrollarse, mejorando sus condiciones de vida y facilitándole los recursos para que puedan realizar sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her family. She and her husband have three children. She runs a business selling tortillas, pupusas and vegetables. The business has enabled her to help her husband support the family.

She notes that currently she needs a loan in order to purchase the ingredients to make her products. For example she will buy corn in greater volume, cooking oil, tomatoes, onions, pork rinds, firewood and other necessary items that she needs to have at hand in order to make her sales.

Her aspiration is that her business will help her children succeed and that it will improve their standard of living and provide the resources so they can realize their objectives.

loans.use: to buy corn, cooking oil, tomatoes, onions and pork rinds.

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene is 47 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Ger, in the Darhan province of Mongolia. Her husband, Yondon, runs a transportation service business in town. Her daughter, Erdenechimeg, age 23, and two sons, Sugar, age 21, and Enhbayar, age 15, are university students. Her youngest son, Batbaatar, age 13, goes to a local school. 

Oyun-Erdene has been running her recyclable material retail business in the local market for 17 years and has gained lot of experience and customers' trust over the years. She is now requesting MNT 4,000,000 to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car for her husband's transportation business. She is a hard-working woman who says, "My husband and I want to let my children graduate good universities, with better education."

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car for her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up on products (five cases of Primus, three cases of Fanta, and two cases of Aigle).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Nieta, composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de la friperie ,de condiments et de produits cosmétiques.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Nieta sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente MAMOU, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 10 pièces de wax et 10 pièces de bazin avec les grossistes de Bamako  pour ensuite vendre sur place à la maison et en ambulante au niveau de la ville de Fana.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’habits.
texts.en:
The women of the group Nieta, which is composed of married women and widows, average 35 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in Fana City, in Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in clothing, secondhand clothing, condiments, and cosmetic products. 

The women of the group Nieta are on their third loan.

This client, MAMOU, the second person from the left in the photo, intends to purchase 10 lengths of Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and 10 lengths of damask from Bamako wholesalers. She will then sell them locally from the house, by going door to door, and in Fana City.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs. Part of the profits will be reinvested in the clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Don José es una persona llena de virtudes y valores que ha sabido ganarse el respeto de todos por su humildad y su gran empeño en el trabajo, Don José es casado y tiene tres hijos, él vive en Otavalo y se dedica a la confección de bolsos y sacos en lana, negocio que comenzó hace mas de 5 años por iniciativa de su mujer, este trabajo le ha dado grandes satisfacciones como el ver crecer a sus hijos y ayudar en las tareas del hogar.
Don José solicito un crédito a FODEMI, para invertir en la compra de materia prima como lana de diferentes colores para la confección de bolsos y sacos inversión que le va a ayudar a seguir creciendo en su negocio y cumplir con la demanda que actualmente tiene en la venta de  sus productos.
El sueño que don José tiene es tener una pequeña empresa de fabricación de sacos y bolsos a base de lana y algodón y con esto brindar fuentes de trabajo a las personas que necesiten trabajar.
texts.en: José possesses many fine qualities and values and has been able to earn the respect of everyone on account of his humility and his tremendous commitment to his work.  He is married with three children and lives in Otavalo.  He works in the manufacture of woollen bags and handbags, a business which he started 5 years ago, at the suggestion of his wife.  His work has given him great satisfaction, such as being able to see his sons grow up and help with the household chores.  José is applying to FODEMI for a loan which will help him to continue expanding his business and meet the demand which currently exists for his products.  José's dream is to have a small business making woollen and cotton bags and handbags and to be able to provide job opportunities for people who are looking for work.

loans.use: to buy wool of different colours for the manufacture of bags and handbags.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, pues quiere iniciar la temporada alquilando el terreno donde estará realizando el cultivo, esto le permitirá adelantar su trabajo para el inicio de la siembra.

Él considera que a través del aporte de los prestamos, ha logrado realizar las siembras, comprando abono, herbicidas, que son los necesarios para el cultivo, este trabajo le asegura la alimentación en su familia.
texts.en:
José has decided on a new loan in order to grow corn and beans. He wants to begin the season by renting the land where he will cultivate his crops. This will enable him to get a head start on preparations for planting.

He feels that through these loans he has been successful in sowing his fields since he is able to buy compost and herbicides, which are necessary for his crops. This work insures he is able to feed his family.

loans.use: to rent land.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 40 years old; she lives in the Terjola district with her husband and two children. Her children are in school. 

The family runs an agricultural business; specifically, they have a pig and a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. In addition, they have a vineyard and 0.6 hectare agricultural land, where nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested nuts and wine locally. 

Lali is very hard-working woman, and does her best to ensure a good harvest. She has requested a loan to renovate the house, as their house is too old.

After the house is renovated, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Lali awaits your support!

loans.use: to renovate the house.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van was born in 1980. She has two daughters, in 2nd and 7th  grade, and a son in 5th grade.  She and her husband earn a living by carpentery. Van gets 4,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month.

Van has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. 

She always wants to earn more money for her family’s income, and so her children can have good careers.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 27 years old. She does outside catering in Mombasa. She is a widow who supports her three children and has been in this business for the last three years. She is doing well. 

Beth has applied for her first loan, to purchase a refrigerator for keeping her juices cold. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to excel in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for her catering business, to be used to store her fruit juices.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She owns a clothing shop where she sells clothes, shoes, bags, etc.  Annah is married, and has four children. 

The business has been supporting Annah and her family for the last ten years; she received the money to start the business from her husband. She also runs a transport business, owning a motorcycle.

Annah is applying for a loan of 104,800 Kenya shillings to purchase new shoes and clothes to sell at the new business location. The extra income from this business will help her pay for her children’s school fees. 

Her ambition is to grow the business to a fully stocked boutique, and open other stalls in the future, reaching at least five new stalls in the next five years. 

The challenge in the business is bad debts and price fluctuations.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes and clothes for sale at the new business location.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is 62 years old, married, and has one child.  She is from the village of Salkhino and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and grandchild. Tamara and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. Her husband works as a builder locally and her son is a soldier. 

The family is involved in the animal husbandry business and has six calves and four milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products sold at the local open market. In addition, Tamara grows maize on the family-owned land. She does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The family has two pigs and sells on average 12 piglets per year. The family also owns a grain mill and serves the local farmers. 

Tamara is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase two milking cows.  She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Tamara wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and the living conditions for the family will be improved.  She is a very hardworking person with a rich experience in her work.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 48-year-old green grocer in Kisauni, Mombasa. He is the father of two children. He has been in this business for the past three years, and his income is great. 

He is requesting his first loan to expand his kiosk, and to purchase more green vegetables and fruits for sale.  

He will use the anticipated profit to pay his loan, and he hopes to have a good life in the future.

loans.use: to expand his kiosk and purchase more green vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en:
Mrs.Purevjav is 71 years old, and lives with her daughter in an apartment in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her daughter, Gantuya, works at a local administration office as social worker. 

Purevjav has been running her second-hand clothing retail business in a local market since 1996. She has lot of experience in clothing retail, and has built a strong relationship with suppliers and customers over the years. 

She is now requesting 1'600'000MNT to purchase construction and insulation materials to renovate and insulate her apartment in order to stay warm during the cold Mongolian winters. She is a comparably enthusiastic, friendly and hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase construction and insulation materials to renovate and insulate her apartment, in order to stay warm during cold Mongolian winters.

loans.name: Wendy De Jesus

texts.es:
Wendy, solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio, comprando cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos, esto le dará un impulso para que su actividad económica se mantenga en buen volumen, ya que anteriormente su negocio ha sido estable, porque ha comprado cerdos de los prestamos otorgados.

Sus condiciones en la familia, manifiesta Wendy que están mejor, tiene un hijo al que le brinda muchos cuidados, en el negocio a través de los préstamos su granja se ha mantenido con cerdos disponibles para la venta.
texts.en:
Wendy is requesting a loan to invest in her business buying pigs to fatten and sell. This will give her the boost she needs to insure a good volume in her business since formerly her business was stable because she was able to buy pigs with the loans provided. 

She states that her family’s living conditions are better. She has a son whom she is raising with great care. Through the loans she has been able to have pigs available for sale on her farm.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her farm.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Mrs. Oyungerel is 44 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger or traditional Mongolian tent in Arhangai province. Her husband Monhbayaris is a 41-year-old herdsman, while her son Budragchaa is a student in a local school. Mrs. Oyungerel has earned a living by selling clothes on a retail business since 2003. She imports her clothes from Erlian, China and sells them in a stall in the local market. She is now requesting a loan for 650,000 MNT to import more clothing from China. She is a hardworking, well-known and clever person.

loans.use: to import seasonal clothing from Erlian, China.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 63 years old. She lives with her son in the small village of Samtredia district, West Georgia. Dali is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows, a calf, and a pig. In addition, they have two beehives with bee colonies and 0.5 hectares of agricultural land, where 400 nut trees and mandarin trees are grown. They locally sell the harvested products and cheese. 

Dali is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, she will be able to produce more dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Dali awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong was born in 1972. She has two children who are adults. Her husband is dead. Phuong sells fruit and does carpentry to earn a living. She has done her job for 10 years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

Phuong has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy fruit and wood for her business. She always wants to enlarge her woodworking workshop.

loans.use: to buy fruit and wood for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 46 years old. She is a used clothing vendor and fresh juice maker in Kisauni, Mombasa. She is a single mother who has been in this business for the last twenty-three years. 

She is requesting for her first loan to increase her stock of used clothes and buy fruit for making fresh juice. 

She will use the anticipated profit to purchase a deep freezer for keeping her fresh juice and also repay her loan. She hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of used clothes and buy fresh fruit for juice making.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en: Emzar is 52 years old and from a small village of Vani district. Emzar has a large family: wife, parents, two sons, daughter-in-law, and an infant granddaughter. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have four milk cows and two calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. In addition, they have two pigs and sell piglets. Emzar also has agricultural land where he grows 200 nut trees. He sells approximately 300 kg of nuts seasonally. He is a very hard working man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. Emzar requested a loan to purchase a milk cow and to renovate the shed. After purchasing an additional cow, they will produce more dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will improve their living conditions. Emzar awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and to renovate the shed

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is a 28-year-old clothing vendor in Mbungoni Mombasa. He is a single man who supports five siblings. He has been in this business for the last one year and has done great. 

He is requesting his first loan to purchase assorted clothing for his kiosk so that he can have a greater variety of products. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. He hopes to own several outlets of this kind in the future.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing for his kiosk

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is from the Samtredia district of West Georgia. She is 51 years old and lives with her husband, daughter, son and retired mother-in-law. 

Rusudan’s husband and son work as car mechanics locally and her daughter is an operator at the local internet café. Rusudan runs an agricultural business. In particular, she owns two calves and three milk cows whose milk is used in dairy products. Rusudan produces cheese and sells it locally. Also, they have a plot of land, where nuts are grown. The family completes all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The family sells on average 250 kg of nuts per year. 

Rusudan works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to build up her savings and improve the living conditions of her family. She has requested a loan to renovate her house. Her existing house is old and damaged. Rusudan will purchase building materials and repair her home. Then, the living conditions of her family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard workday in a more comfortable environment. Rusudan hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate their house

loans.name: Tuong

texts.en:
Tuong was born in 1977. She has two children who attend secondary school. Her husband is a carpenter. Tuong does carpentry and raises pigs to earn a living. Her income is about 6,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 14,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for pigs. She always wants to raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en: Madona is a 52-year-old farmer. She lives in the village of Laneti in the Samtredia district with her daughter and son, who is a soldier. The family earns its income by farming. In particular, they have a calf and three milk cows. They use the milk to produce traditional Georgian cheese and sell it at the local open market. In addition, they have a small pig-breeding farm with one pig and several piglets. They sell the piglets to a wholesaler. Along with these activities, the family has a plot of land where it grows green vegetables. Madona has requested a loan to expand her cattle shed so she can increase the size of her herd and have a place for her animals to stay. The cheese produced by Madona is high quality and in demand in the local market. According to her estimation, when she has more cows she won’t have any problems selling the increased amount of the cheese they produce. A larger heard will have a positive impact on her family’s income and allow them to improve their living conditions by buying more items for their household.

loans.use: to expand the size of her cattle shed.

loans.name: Hat

texts.en:
Hat was born in 1977, and she is a widow. She has a son who is in the 9th grade. Hat collects iron scraps and raises pigs to earn a living. She earns 4,000,000 VND a month, which constitutes her family’s total earnings. 

Hat has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last loan cycle she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy food for pigs. She wants to raise her son well so he can get a job in the future.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Limousine Group

texts.en:
Yohana is in his early 50s, married, and has seven children, three of whom attend school. For six years, he has been running a butcher shop. He works from 6 AM to 7 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

Yohana is requesting his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to increase stock of meat to his butcher business.  He used the previous loan to increase his meat inventory, buy a sofa set, cover household expenses, and pay school fees. His dream is to one day be able to build a nice house and provide better education to his children.

Yohana will share this loan with his loan group Limousine, which totals 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock of meat for his butcher's business.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarantuya is 26 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a small house in Orhon province of Mongolia. Her husband Oyun-Erdene, age 25, works at a local private company. Her daughter Amin-Erdene, age 3, goes to local kindergarten. 

Mrs. Sarantuya graduated from a hairstylist course in 2001 and started working in a big hair salon in 2002. She has gained a lot of experience and customers over the years and is now planning to start her own hair salon in a rental place. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment and tools to start her own hair salon. She is hardworking, open-minded and modest.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to start her own hair salon

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is taking out another Kiva loan of Ksh. 50,000 to boost her grocery business. With the loan she wants to rent a larger stall and create shelves for the display of her products. Her previous loan was used to increase stock in her stall which increased her monthly income  by 50% hence  improving  family living  standards.

loans.use: to rent a larger stall and create shelves for the display of her products.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh was born in 1974. She has two sons and a daughter. They are in high school and secondary school. Her husband is a carpenter. Anh raises chickens and does carpentry to earn a living. She earns 6,000,000 VND a month, and her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

Anh has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last loan cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for chickens and pigs. She wants her children to receive higher education and to enlarge her chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with six children. She describes herself as a visionary woman. She operates a retail business where she sells water to the community. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Monica will use the 32,000 KES loan to buy a water tank. Her goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Gertudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband have been rice farmers for more than seven years now and this is their source of income. Gertrudes is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

In the future, Gertrudes hopes to expand her farming business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Abigael Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kamwanya est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Abigaël, âgée d’environ 55 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Son conjoint est un policier, officier de l’ordre public. La cliente est vendeuse de Chikwange (aliment approprié aux congolais-Kinshasa) à son domicile. Elle fait également le commerce de divers pour accroitre ses revenus. Elle commença son business avec son fonds propre reçu des soldes de son mari. Depuis 1998, elle exerce cette activité. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouveaux produits (manioc, eau, sachets emballage, braise, etc.). En plus, elle ambitionne voir ses enfants qui sont à l’université finir leurs études. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables
texts.en: This client, by the name of Kamwanya, is an entrepreneur and the leader of the Abigael group. She is about 55 years old, married and the mother of three. Her husband is a policeman, a public safety officer. She sells “chikwange” (a typical dish in Kinshasa, Congo) out of her home. She also sells miscellaneous items to increase her revenues. She launched her business with her own funds received from her husband’s salary. She has been in this business since 1998. Later on she obtained a loan from IMF Hekima. This new loan will allow her to stock up on products (manioc/cassava, water, bags for packaging, coal etc). In addition she would like to see her children, who study at the university, to complete their degrees. This client thanks Hekima for its work supporting female entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to stock up on products (manioc/cassava, water, bags for packaging, coal etc).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Miraj

texts.en:
Miraj is the 50-year-old owner of a food kiosk in Gogoni Kilifi. She is married and her husband's work provides additional income to the family. Together they support four people. She been in business for twelve years, and she is doing well. 

She requests her third loan to purchase stocks of dried food, wheat flour, sugar, beans, and cooking fat for her kiosk. She will use the anticipated profit to develop her rental houses. 

Her earlier loans were paid successfully. She hopes to be a self-reliant wife in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of dried food, wheat flour, sugar, beans, and cooking fat

loans.name: Nyokabi

texts.en:
Nyokabi is a 40-year-old cafe owner in Ujamaa Likoni Mombasa. She is married and her husband provides additional income. Together they support four people. Nyokabi has been in the food business for the past three years and she is doing well. 

She is requesting her first loan to purchase dry food stock for her kiosk including maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, beans, and cooking fat. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business, and she hopes to live a happy life in future.

loans.use: to purchase dry food stock for her kiosk.

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en:
Mr. Selenge is 47 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife Bolormaa, aged 45, is a musician at a local theater. His son Zolbayar helps him run an organic bakery in their spare room. Mr. Selenge started his organic bakery in 2008, and he is well known in town for his unique tasting organic bakery products. 

He is now requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase equipment and organic flour for the bakery. Mr. Selenge is a hardworking, open-minded, and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and organic flour for his bakery.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 54 years old, married and has five adult children who are all married. She owns a grocery store selling such produce as onions, tomatoes, cabbage, and coconuts. She has owned this business for many years and has gained great sales experience that has helped increase her customers and income range. It is very satisfying for her to see customers leave happy. In addition to providing excellent service, everything she sells is of high quality and at reasonable prices. She believes that if she has a start, she will be challenged, and if she is challenged, she will be victorious. The challenge she is looking for now is to expand her business and she needs capital. For this reason she is seeking a loan amounting to 30000 KES.

loans.use: to expand her grocery business.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en: Mesaid is taking out a second Kiva loans to expand her business. She had taken the first loan to stock her stall which has helped to increase her monthly income and improve her family's living standards. Due her hard work and good relationship with her customers, she has been able to have a large number of customers  For this reason, she needs to expand the stall and is seeking a loan amounting to 50,000 KES.

loans.use: to expand her shop so it is better stocked.

loans.name: Pikria

texts.en:
Pikria is 29 years old. She lives with her mother, brother and nephew. Her mother is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows and a calf; the milk is used in cheese production. Besides that, they have a pig and 30 hens. 

Pikria sells cheese, piglets and eggs locally in an open market at a good price. She is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan to buy and sell fruit and vegetables. Pikria plans to purchase fruit and vegetables from the wholesalers and resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Pikria awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy and sell fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 13 years to 19 years. She describes herself as a strong, optimistic and courageous woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruit. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of permanent business premises to operate her business from. 

Margaret will use the Kes 20,000 loan to restock her grocery store by buying fruit and vegetables. Her business goal is to improve her business  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a plot of land for her family and build a house. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is married and the mother of six children. She has been educated through trade school and currently earns a living by selling soft drinks in the town of Akotokyir. She has been in this line of work for five years while her husband has earned a living as a fireman. Juliana uses her income to help support her family, and will use this loan to buy additional soft drinks to sell in her shop. With the new profits made possible by this loan, Juliana plans to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sinh's Group

texts.en:
Sinh was born in 1972. She has two adult children, and her husband is a farmer. His income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. Sinh collects iron scraps and raises pigs to earn a living. She earns about 4,000,000 VND a month, and her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Sinh has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In this first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy more iron scraps to recycle. In the future, she wants to save more money for her family.

Other members who are part of Sinh's group include Tinh, who was born in 1974 and has two children, and Duyen, who was born in 1991 and has one child. They both collect iron scraps to earn a living, and each one wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to do her job.

loans.use: to buy more iron scraps to recycle.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en: Carolyn is a married woman with two children, ages 13 and 14. She describes herself to be a humble, religious and polite. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located along a busy street in an urban area and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be frequent power blackouts which affect her business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy beauty products. Her business goal is to run a bigger beauty salon within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will create job opportunities for women in her salon. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 35-year-old wholesale fruit vendor in Kisauni, Mombasa. He is a married father of four who is the sole support for his family. He has been in this business for the past 15 years and has done well. 

He is requesting his first loan to expand his business by increasing his fruit volume sold wholesale. 

He will use the anticipated profit to put up rental houses in his already acquired piece of land and he hopes to own a public service vehicle in the future.

loans.use: to expand his business by increasing his fruit volume sold wholesale.

loans.name: Shirgal

texts.en: Shirgal is 50 years old lives with his wife and three children in a Ger in Bulgan province of Mongolia. His wife Tsetsgee works at a local transportation office as a clerk. His two sons, Batmonh, age 27, and Batmend, age 25, work at private companies as engineers. His daughter Buyanzaya, age 17, has just enrolled at university. Borrower has been running his business of bakery and felt production in his home and he also sells organic dairy products and vegetables at the local market. He also rents his spare space to his neighbors as a storage pit. He is now requesting 2'500'000MNT to purchase organic dairy products and vegetables to sell during winter. He and his family are hardworking people.

loans.use: to purchase organic dairy products and vegetables to sell during winter

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en: Mrs. Suhbaatar is 23 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger (or traditional Mongolian tent) in Uvs province. Her husband Anhtuya, who is 27, stays home to care for their new baby boy, Amarbayasgalan, who is one year old. Her older son Anhsuh, who is four, goes to local kindergarten. Mrs. Suhbaatar has worked in various fields and is now planning to start her own business of selling groceries. She is requesting a loan for 3,500,000 MNT to buy a refrigerator and items to sell from it in her grocery store. She is a hardworking and realistic person.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and items to sell in it.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en: Gocha is 42 years old. He lives in Chiatura, in the village of Kartskhi with his wife and two infant children. Gocha and his wife run an agricultural farm in the village. They have a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land where various fruits and vegetables are grown.  After the harvest season, the fruits and vegetables are sold to the retailers. In addition, they are involved in the animal husbandry business and have a milk cow and nine sheep. Along with the above-mentioned business, Gocha is a shoemaker. When he has orders from the villagers, he repairs shoes and gets additional income. With the requested loan, Gocha will purchase a milk cow. He plans to produce more Georgian cheese and sell it on the market. It will increase the income of the family. Gocha and his wife hope that the cheese production will allow them to save for an improvement in living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Reli Group

texts.en:
Rashid, who is in his late 30's, is married with two children. Of the two children, one goes to school and the other is still a baby. He has been a tailor for period of five years. He works from 8 am to 6 pm daily, and he is able to earn a small profit per month.

This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a tailoring machine, bed sheet materials and fabrics. He covered household expenses, started building his house and paid back all his loans successfully. He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes materials and to put electricity in his house. His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house and open space for a business selling motorcycle spare parts .

He will share this loan with his loan group "Reli", which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials and to put electricity in his house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace's business has continued to witness much growth. She was able to complete the repayments before the expected time due to increased income. She looks forward to a more fruitful year in 2013.

Grace is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to pay for additional food stuff required in her food stall. The additional income from this loan will help her pay for the educational expenses of her children. She still harbors the ambition of increasing the number of stalls.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of food stuffs for the food stall.

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy is 44 and lives with his four children, aged 18, 10, 6, and 3, who are all still in school. He earns a living from his restaurant, which offers different services, including serving breakfast and lunch foods such as tamales, eggs, beans, soups, meat dishes, and salads; the restaurant also offers accommodation. He has been running the business for a number of years and has gained plenty of sales experience, which allows him to make bigger profits and expand his customer base. 

Billy plies his trade in a coastal region, which he considers very favorable for his business, and he is well known throughout the region for preparing the most delicious dishes in the area and providing affordable accommodation for all. His greatest assets are hard work and love of the job which, he knows, are the only ways to achieve his ambition.

Due to his increased number of customers, Billy wishes to expand his restaurant. He has requested a loan of 100,000 KSH.

loans.use: to expand his restaurant.

loans.name: Shinetsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Shinetsetseg is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in an apartment in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Batbaatar, age 35, works for a local private company as a salesperson. Her sons Tserenbaatar, age 9, and Enerelt, age 7, go to local primary school. 

Mrs. Shinetsetseg has been running a small cosmetics retail counter since 2010. She has built strong relationships with her customers and suppliers over the years. She purchases cosmetics products wholesale and resells them at a retail counter. She pays transportation costs to pick up wholesale cosmetics. She is now requesting a 6,500,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas car to reduce the transportation costs of her cosmetics business. She is a hardworking, welcoming, and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas car to reduce transportation costs for her cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Abil

texts.en:
Abil is 48 years old, married and has two children. He is a farmer who has been growing and selling seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last six years. During those years, Abil gained enough skill and experience to run his business. He chose this business because it is profitable, and because fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 
People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them to be healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on the table of every family in Azerbaijan, and they are also used to make fresh fruit punch. Abil usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 130 AZN.
As these products are in high demand, Abil wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet the demand. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers to permit him to meet the high market demand for fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Silvia Carmelina

texts.es:
Silvia, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita más capital para el negocio, comprando los productos como aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pastas y otros productos que son  necesarios tener para la demanda de los clientes.

Con los préstamos ha tenido una experiencia positiva, que le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio, con las ganancias que ha generado ha podido ayudar a su familia, teniendo una mejor condición para superarse.
texts.en: Silvia decided to request another loan because she needs more capital for her business. She will buy products such as oil, rice, sugar, beans, pastas, and other products that are necessary to meet the demand of her customers. With her previous loans, Silvia has had a very positive experience. They helped her to strengthen her business and with the earnings they generated she has been able to help her family. She is in a better place to improve.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, beans, and pastas.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina is 65 years old. She lives in a small village in the Senaki district with her husband and two children. The family runs an agricultural business. They have two pigs and two milk cows whose milk is used in cheese production. Valentina sells cheese and piglets locally. She also has a hectare of agricultural land, where maize is grown. She is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. She has requested a loan to  purchase an additional milk cow. She will produce more dairy products, and this will increase the income of her family. With the increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Valentina awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en: Mzia is 59 years old. She lives in the small village of Chkhorotsku district with her husband, who is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows and a calf, whose milk is used in cheese production. They also have a plot of agricultural land, where 150 nut trees and maize are grown. They sell harvested products and cheese locally at a good price. Mzia is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan for a roof for the shed. After the shed is roofed, the livestock will be in better condition and Mzia will expand her amount of cattle. This will increase the income of her family. With increased income, the living conditions of her family will be improved. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to put a roof on the shed.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline lives in West Point, Montserrado county. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children, ages 21, 24, and 27. Only two are presently in school and live at home. 

For two years now, Roseline has been involved in the sale of fashion fabric and artificial hair. Most interestingly, she has many customers since her business is in a very good location in the market. She started her business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. One of the problems she faces is fewer commodities since she has more customers. 

Roseline is requesting a loan to buy fashion fabric and artificial hair for her business. She plans to expand her business even more and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fashion fabric and artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy umbrellas, parasols, plastic ware, sandals and pieces of fabric.

loans.name: Berta Hilda

texts.es: La señora Berta habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos,  ella es una mujer trabajadora que busca la mejoria es su  hogar ya que su esposo labaora para una empresa privada y ella comparte con el los gastos del hogar, con este nuevo credito ella podra realizar compras para su negocio y asi lograr tener un buen inventario, su negocio es de venta de Frutas y verduras, comprara lo siguiente: Cebolla, Chiltoma, Tomate, Zanahoria, Repollo, etc. y frutas como: Sandia, Melon, Naranja, Banano, etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic atravez de Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Berta lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with her husband and children. Berta is a hardworking woman who is trying to improve her home. Her husband works for a private company and she helps him to pay their household expenses. 

With this new loan, Berta will be able to buy some produce for her business, which will allow her to offer her customers a better variety. She works selling fruits and vegetables, so she will buy: onions, peppers, tomatoes, carrots, cabbage, among others, as well as fruits: watermelon, melons, oranges, bananas, etc. 

Berta is grateful for the support she receives from Afodenic through the Kiva loans offered to her.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en: Dorice is a married woman. She has two children, 15 and 17. She describes herself as a motivated and God-fearing woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a market, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as stiff competition in the area. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will achieve her dream of expanding her business. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her store.

loans.name: Tseveennamjil

texts.en: Mr. Tseveennamjil is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger (felt hut) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Buyanhuu, age 37, runs a butcher shop in the local food market. His daughter Enhmaa, age 7, goes to the local primary school, and his younger daughter, Erhmaa, age 5, goes to the local kindergarten. The borrower has been working as an electric engineer in a local gas station. His wife has been running the butcher shop at a rental counter in the local food market since 1994. She is well known among her customers for her organic qualified meat products. The borrower is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic meat from herders for his wife's butcher shop business. The borrower's family are hard-working, optimistic people.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic meat from herders for his wife's butcher shop business.

loans.name: Albalina Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Albalina habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo y familia, ella sueña con tener su casa terminada y con las mejores condiciones, ella labora para una casa privada y su mayor dificultad es que no puede reunir de una sola vez el dinero para comprar el material que necesita, Gracias  a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva comprara los siguiente: Ceramica, Cemento, Pintura etc.
texts.en: Albalina lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with her husband and family. She dreams of finishing her house and living under better conditions. Albalina works in a private home. Her greatest challenge is that she is not able to get together at one time all of the money she needs to buy the materials to finish her house. Thanks to Afodenic and Kiva, Albalina will be able to buy ceramic, cement, paint, etc. for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Leodegaria Juana

texts.es:
La señora Leodegaria Juana esta casada, tiene 34 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tienen 3 hijos  2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica ala venta de papas fritas, hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia, espera su negocio siga prosperando.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de puerta para su vivienda, ya que ha terminado la construcción de su vivienda y ahora corresponde la instalación de puertas, espera completar su vivienda de ser posible la instalación también de ventanas.
texts.en:
Lodegaria Juana is married and is 34 years old.  She didn't have the opportunity to study.  She has 3 children, 2 of whom are studying.  She makes her living selling french fries.  She has 3 years experience doing this, and hopes that her business continues to prosper. 

She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy doors for her house, since construction on the house is now complete and doors need to be installed.  She hopes to complete her house so that she can also install windows.

loans.use: to install doors on her house.

loans.name: Turdukan

texts.ru: Турдукан 64 года, вдова, воспитала восемь детей. Дети Турдукан все взрослые и живут независимо.Лишь младший сын не женатый, он работает в России, она планирует женить его осенью. Турдукан на протяжении 42 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Турдукан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы,10 голов овец и 3 козы.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турдукан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 36,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота, что позволит ей увеличить доходы от перепродажи. На  полученные доходы от кредита Турдукан планирует провести свадьбу младшему сыну.
texts.en: Turdukan is 64 years old, a widow, and has raised eight children. All of  Turdukan's children are adults living on their own. Only the youngest son is still single.
