This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to pay some of the maintenance and repair costs for his taxi.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una persona feliz, muy dedicada a su trabajo, responsable para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Martha vive en la ciudad de Atuntaqui con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Martha se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir, este negocio lo heredó de su madre, al momento le está yendo muy bien ya que sus productos los está distribuyendo a algunas tiendas de ropa en su ciudad.
Martha solicita un crédito a FODEMI para invertir en la compra de tela térmica y tela de algodón en cantidad mayores para la realización de sus prendas de vestir al por mayor, inversión que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos. 
Martha sueña en tener un taller más grande que le permita contratar a más personal y convertirse en una empresa grande y distribuir al por mayor en todo el país y con estos ingresos darles la educación a sus hijos y enseñarles este bonito oficio para que sigan con la tradición.
texts.en:
Martha is a cheerful person who is very dedicated to her work and responsible for trying to improve her family's quality of life. Martha lives in the city of Atuntaqui with her husband and her three children. She works making clothes, having inherited this business from her mother. At the moment things are going well for her as she is distributing her products to some clothes shops in the city. 
Martha is requesting a loan from FODEMI to invest in buying thermal and cotton fabric in large quantities so that she can produce her clothes wholesale. This investment will allow her to increase her sales and her income. 
Martha dreams of having a larger workshop which will allow her to hire more workers and to become a large company, distributing wholesale all over the country, and using this income to give her children an education and to teach them this nice profession so that they continue the tradition.

loans.use: to buy cotton and thermal fabric to make clothes.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man. He has 6 children ranging in age from 15 years to 28 years. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a grocery store  and a farm where he sells vegetables such as maize, beans, cabbage, kale etc . He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located within an urban area and his primary customers are schools, institutions and hotels . He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell . His business goal is to be a large supplier of fruit and vegetables within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is 23 years old and from Gaza. He has owned a barbershop since 2009.

Jihad asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy chairs, scissors, and other barbershop materials for the barbershop.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase his customers and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy chairs, scissors, and other barbershop materials.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 51 years old and a single mother to three children. She is a farmer in Nyahururu town, where she grows cash crops such as maize, beans and potatoes. She has been in the business for more than 10 years and it has been profitable.

This is her second loan and she plans to use it to buy supplies for the farm, such as seeds, fertilizer and manure.

Gladys anticipates making greater profits from her harvest, which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business and farm on a larger scale, making more income and thus be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, seeds and manure.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 5 children with ranging in age from 7 to 25 years old. He describes himself to be a determined man . He operates a farm where he sells potatoes . He has been involved in this business for 18 years. His business is located within a viable business area and his primary customers are schools, institutions and hotels . He describes his biggest business challenge to be harsh climatic conditions which affect the crop . He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seed potatoes . His business goal is to grow his business within the next 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother to three sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed with a low wage which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

For the past year, Sana has been operating a kindergarten. She has a good reputation among her clients, which makes her project a successful and profitable one. It is a second helper source of income to the family. Sana would like to expand the kindergarten by adding additional rooms to raise the income. 

Sana took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Sana to make some improvements for her project and increase the revenue. 

Sana is pictured inside her kindergarten.

loans.use: to pay the costs of expanding the kindergarten.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He describes himself to be a hardworking man. 

John operates a retail business where he sells paraffin and diesel. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located within a busy area, and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners and residents from the environs. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. John will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy paraffin and diesel to sell. 

John's business goal is to run a petrol filling station within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a large-scale filling station.

loans.use: to buy paraffin and diesel.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Kefah is a 30-year-old, Palestinian, married woman. She lives with her husband and four young children in Qalqilia. Kefah's husband is a construction employee with a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Kefah and her husband are trying to improve the quality of living for the family and, because of that, they built a new house. Their house still needs some construction materials to be ready, such as cement and iron.

Kefah took a USD Youth loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help Kefah's family to complete their house faster, so they can enjoy living in their house soon.

loans.use: to pay the construction expenses to complete the family home.

loans.name: Saadi

texts.en:
Saadi is 19 years old and is from Gaza. He has owned a small vegetable stall in the vegetable market since January 2012.

Saadi asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a small automobile to cut transportation costs for his business. He hopes that this loan, by helping him reduce transportation costs, will in turn improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile to cut transportation costs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 40 years old and is from Ndunyu Njeru. She is married with five children, who are between the ages of one and twenty-two years old.

Agnes has a farming business that she has been doing for 20 years. She has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy fertilizers, a cupboard and to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to boost her business and educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay school fees

loans.name: Nowwara

texts.en:
Nowwara is 30 years old and comes from Gaza. She is married and lives with her eight family members at her father-in-law's house.

She owns a small shop for tailoring clothes for kids and selling them. She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy new tailoring and sewing machines.

She hopes that this loan will help her start with a display space and increase her income through selling more clothes in order to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy new tailoring and sewing machines

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as a focused and determined man. 

Evans operates a barber shop where he provides haircut services. His business is located within a busy business environment and his primary customers are men. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Evans will use the KES 19,500 loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by his six family members for lighting. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Aydah

texts.en:
Aydah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Aydah is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother to two sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Aydah and her husband own a taxi office.  They have had this business for four years. It is considered a very successful business because it is located in a very crowded area in Jabalia.  Aydah and her husband are very ambitious; they want to improve their project by buying office furniture and some communication devices to make the job more efficient. 

Aydah took out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help Aydah and her husband to buy furniture and some communication devices for the taxi office. This will help to improve the project and increase the family's income.

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To pay for furniture and communication devices for the taxi office

loans.name: Pedro Ángel

texts.es:
Don Pedro tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Él vive muy humildemente, es muy reconocido en el lugar en donde vive por ser un hombre trabajador. Se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy temprana edad, no se le presento la oportunidad de estudiar; debido a que en ese tiempo los padres no se preocupaban por eso; sino más bien por que trabajaran; pero él nos comenta que se siente muy feliz por haber aprendido a trabajar.

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, don Pedro debe viajar en su mula unos 1000 metros desde su casa hasta el lugar en donde espera un vehiculo, para llegar a la ciudad, debido a que el lugar en donde vive es de difícil acceso.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar los materiales para construir una casa de adobe y pago de mano de obra. Dicha casa será para el hijo, o para él según quede ya terminada. Su deseo, es que su hijo tenga un lugar digno en donde pueda vivir y con los servicios básicos, como: agua potable y energía eléctrica, la cual será construida con sus propias manos. Además, desea continuar trabajando en la agricultura fuertemente para bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 61 years old and is married with five children. He lives very humbly and he is very well-known in the place where he lives for being a hard-working man. He has worked in agriculture from a very young age as he wasn't given the opportunity to study because at that time his parents were more concerned about working. However, he tells us that he is happy that he learnt to work.

In order to buy agricultural supplies, Pedro must travel with his mule some 1000 metres from his house to the place where a vehicle waits for him to travel to the city, as the place where he lives is difficult to access.

The loan which he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy material to build a house from adobe and to pay workers. This house will be for his son, or for him depending on how it turns out. His wish is for his son to have a decent place to live with basic amenities such as drinking water and electricity, which will be constructed with his own hands. Besides, he wants to continue working hard in agriculture for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a house from adobe and to pay workers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a man of 68 years, married to Serah and a father of five children. He operates a retail shop and also has rental houses. He has been in this business for eight years now.

This will be Joseph's sixth loan with KADET LTD, he plans to use this loan to add stock to his retail business by buying rice, sugar, maize flour etc., and also to renovate his rental houses. In the future he wants to own property.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil for resale and to renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 50 years old and is married, with two children, aged 2 and 13. He is a farmer and has been doing it for the last 35 years. 

Patrick has applied for his fifth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable him to buy fertilizer and seedlings. He hopes to be the leading farmer in his area, in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertlizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Abizera Group

texts.fr:
Acqueline fait partie du groupe Abizera et   habite à Gitega. Elle a   35 ans et est mariée à Deo, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de 3  à 11 ans, tous  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, huile de palme,…)  depuis 3 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, huile de palme ,…)   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Avec le gain de son commerce, elle satisfait les besoins essentiels de sa famille (se nourrir, se loger, se vêtir, payer les frais scolaires des enfants).
texts.en:
Acqueline belongs to the Abizera group and lives in Gitega.  She is 35 years old and married to Deo, a business man.  Together they have four children between the ages of 3 and 11.  They all attend school.  

She has a shop where she has been running a business of selling rice, beans, palm oil, etc. for three years.  

She is on her third loan with Turame.  With the KIVA loan that she is getting, she will increase her working capital and buy numerous items for her shop such as rice, beans, and palm oil, which will increase her profits.  

With the profit from her business, she can meet the major needs of her family such as food, shelter, clothing, and educational expenses.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to buy items for her store such as rice, beans and oil, which will increase her profits. .

loans.name: Blanca Esmeralda

texts.es: Doña Blanca tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada, tiene un hijo y vive en la Esperanza Intibucá junto a su esposo y su hijo. Doña Blanca hace dos años decidió establecer su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como ser: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, pan, refrescos, manteca, churros, condimentos, pollo, café y otros. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio anteriormente vendía comidas. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 11,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar un frezer o congelador de segunda mano para vender embutidos. Esta inversión le ayudara a poder vender embutidos en la pulpería. Su plan es reinvertir las ganancias para hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca is 55 years old, married, and has a son. She lives in La Esperanza Intibucá with her husband and son. Two years ago, Blanca decided to set up her own business, a small general store, where she sells basic household necessities such as sugar, rice, beans, bread, soft drinks, lard, snacks condiments, chicken, coffee, and other items.

She has always had a business; previously she sold meals. She is requesting a second loan from ODEF, for 11,000 lempiras, with which she is going to  buy a second-hand freezer so that she can sell cold cuts. 

This investment will help her to sell cold cuts in the general store. Her plan is to reinvest the earnings to make her business grow.

loans.use: To buy a freezers so that she can sell cold cuts.

loans.name: Lawi

texts.en:
Lawi lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has six school going children. He owns a clothing shop, a business that he has been operating for fifteen years. He started the business through his personal savings. He is also a building contractor.
He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are occasional limited demand and high market fees.
Lawi is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy more clothes to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es:
Don Cleotilde tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy temprana edad, tiene una gran experiencia en lo que hace y motivación. Aprendió junto con su papá; debido a que en ese tiempo lo que más anhelaban los padres es que sus hijos aprendieran a trabajar, por ese motivo no estudio. 

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, viaja a la ciudad que esta a hora y media en vehiculo particular o autobús; pero por no circular transporte hasta donde él vive debe pagar otro vehiculo para trasladar los insumos hasta su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reparar el molino para picar zacate, esta dañado el motor y necesita repararlo ya que es en esta época que trabaja como molinero prestando sus servicios a las personas que lo contratan. Así, recibirá un ingreso extra para sostenimiento de su familia; pues manifiesta que en este tiempo esta difícil el dinero y por ello debe limitarse de muchas cosas. 

Su mayor deseo, es proporcionar a su familia de lo que él no pudo obtener cuando joven; como lo fue el estudio y otras cosas para mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Don Cleotilde is a 61-year old man, married and father of two children. He works on agriculture since he was very young, and has a great experience and motivation in what he does. He learned with his father and didn't study, as at that time what parents wanted was for their children to learn a job. In order to buy farming inputs, he needs to go to the city, which is one and a half hour away by car or bus. Also, given that there's not direct transportation to where he lives, he needs to use another vehicle to take home all those inputs.  

He will use the loan requested to Fundación Campo to repair the mill to cut up forage. The engine is damaged and he needs to repair it so that he can continue to work as a miller providing services to people who hire him. Thanks to this, he will receive an extra income to support his family, especially at a time when money is difficult to earn and they need to make a lot of sacrifices. His biggest dream is to provide his family with what he couldn't enjoy when he was young: the possibility of studying and other things to improve their lives.

loans.use: to repair the mill to cut up forage.

loans.name: Susana Filomena

texts.es: Susana, 61 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta y elaboración  de hamburguesas y  hot dog, madre de 5 hijos, es originaria del Municipio de  San Carlos, pero actualmente vive en Granada, lleva 2 años trabajando en el sector comercio. Ella inicio  con su pequeño negocio, vendiendo hot-dog de forma ambulante, asi es como ella  se gana la vida, y ha podido salir adelante con las ganancias que le genera su negocio de hamburguesa, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y el de su hermano. Sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio. Ella esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar un barril y toda la materia prima que necesita como, leña, tomate, cebolla, harina, etc. ya que ella estima que este préstamo le ayudaría a comprar todo lo necesario para la elaboración de su comida, sus planes futuros es tener un negocio estable y rentable con muy buena clientela.
texts.en:
Susana, age 61, is a merchant who prepares and sells hamburgers and hot dogs. She is the mother of five children and is originally from the town of San Carlos, but currently lives in Granada. Susana has been working for two years in the retail trade. She started her small business by selling hot dogs as a street vendor so that she could earn a living. Susana was then able to move forward with the earnings she generated from selling hamburgers. She has the support of her daughter and her brother. Her expectations include being able to grow her business.

Susana is in need of a loan so that she can buy a barrel and all of the supplies that she needs such as firewood, tomatoes, onions, flour, and other items. She feels that this loan will help her buy all the things that she needs to prepare her food. Her future plans include having a stable and profitable business with very good customers.

loans.use: to buy a barrel, firewood, tomatoes, onions, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as a determined and honest woman. She operates a grocery store,  where she sells vegetables and fruits. Her business is located within a busy shopping centre, and her primary customers are residents from the environs. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business.  Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her grocery store business.  In addition, Alice sells clothes that are commonly known as 'Mitumba' in local language, which increases her business income. 

She will use the KES 29,860 loan to buy bathroom tiles so as to improve her bathroom condition.

loans.use: to buy bathroom tiles.

loans.name: Sonia Bertalina

texts.es: Sonia Bertalina de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta  de antojitos típicos,  atol, empanadas, pastelitos, pupusas, entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia en el lugar que califico como muy bueno para sus actividades comerciales ya tiene mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Sonia es una mujer emprendedora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito que tanto desea, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero para ello necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar verduras, maíz, carnes, quesillo, etc. Sonia Bertalina tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la confianza que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sonia Bertalina, age 45, lives in her own house with her life partner and their children.  She sells typical snacks, ‘atol’ [corn-based beverage], empanadas, pastries, and ‘pupusas’ [stuffed corn tortillas], among others.

She has had the business for several years, and this has rewarded her with a lot of sales experience.  This allows her to get better income.  She does business in a place that is very good for commercial activities.  She has a lot of fixed customers who prefer her.  This is because everything she sells is first quality at reasonable prices and because, most of all, she provides excellent service.  

Sonia is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She is always on the lookout for new opportunities that will allow her to achieve the success she so desires. 

Like all good merchants, she wants to make her business grow and make a new investment.  However, in order to do so she needs financial backing.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow her to buy vegetables, corn, meat, and soft cheeses, etc.

Sonia Bertalina has good payment references and is very responsible.  She assures that she will be able to repay the loan.  She is confident that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, corn, meat, and soft cheeses, etc.

loans.name: Mawate

texts.en: Mawate lives in West Point, one of the busies and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is 50 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 19 and 31.  Only one lives at home and attends school.  For ten years she has been running a shop where she sells cold water, soft drinks, charcoal, beer, etc. A problem she faces is that in the rainy season business is poor.  She enjoys the interaction she has with her customers and the profit she makes.  Providing food for her family makes her proud. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, charcoal, beer, etc. for her business.  Her dream is to own a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, charcoal, beer, etc. for her business,

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one school going child. He owns a clothing shop, a business that he has been operating for two years. He started the business through his personal savings. He is also a driver of a public service vehicle. He mainly sells bedsheets.
He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are occasional limited demand and high market fees.
George is applying for a loan of 15,900 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes to sell. The extra income generated from the loan will be added to his savings to educate his children. He desires to grow his business into a wholesale outlet in the near future.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Helen Del Socorro

texts.es:
Helen de 38 años de edad, originaria de Managua, soltera, madre de 3 hijos, actualmente uno de ellos está estudiando en la universidad, los otros dos trabajan, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio hace 12 años, ya que siempre se ha dedicado a la comercialización de productos varios de forma ambulante, luego con el tiempo,  pensando en el futuro de sus hijos decidió establecer su negocio de pulpería en su casa, ella cuenta  con el apoyo de su hermano quien le ayudo con $70 en  su negocio, capital con el que inicio su negocio de pulpería, recibe otros ingresos como son las remesas que le envían sus hijos.
Sus expectativas es ampliar su pulpería. Ella está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar cuadernos, uniformes y zapatos para aprovechar la temporada escolar en donde las ventas de estos útiles escolares es muy solicitada por los clientes, con el propósito de hacer crecer el inventario de su mercadería para que le genere más ingresos, sus planes futuros es comprar un carro, una de sus metas próximas es mejorar la infraestructura del local para darle una mejor presentación al negocio.
texts.en: Helen is 38 years old and is originally from Managua. She is a single mother of 3 sons. One of them is currently studying at the university while the other two are working. Helen has her own small business, which she started 12 years ago, after having worked in the sales of various products as a street vendor. After some time, she decided to open a small shop in her own house, as a way to provide for her children in the future. Helena received the support of her brother, who helped her with $70 to start her business. In addition from her business she receives income from money that is sent by her sons. She plans to expand her shop, thus she is requesting the loan to finance books, notebooks and shoes to be ready for the school season in which the sales of these items increase. By increasing the inventory of her business she expects to get more income. In the future she plans to buy a car, while in the short term her goal is to improve the infrastructure of her shop in order to give her business a better image.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, uniforms and shoes.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos. Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y a elaborar pan junto con sus dos hijas mayores de 18 y 22 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en la agricultura con sus hijos varones. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar harina, azúcar, manteca, huevos, entre otros productos que necesita para elaborar el pan y también para comprar queso fresco para la venta. Con el préstamo, ella espera aumentar la producción de pan y de queso fresco, debido a que por falta de recursos económicos no lo ha podido realizar. Su objetivo, es trabajar bien con la Fundación, para tener las puertas abiertas para cualquier otro préstamo que pueda solicitar.
texts.en:
Mirian, 43, is married and has six children.  She works doing her domestic chores at home and with help from her two oldest daughters who are 18 and 22 years of age bakes bread.  Her husband works in agriculture with their sons.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy flour, sugar, shortening and eggs, among other supplies needed to bake bread and also to buy fresh cheese to sell.  With the loan she hopes to increase bread and fresh cheese production that she’s unable to do so far for lack of economic resources.  Her objective is to work well with the Fundación so that the door to future loans she may need will always be open.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies and fresh cheese.

loans.name: Rosa Orbelina

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija de 18 años de edad. Ella es promotora comunitaria desde el año 2010, enseña a leer y a escribir a las personas mayores que no tuvieron la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar madera, piedra, mano de obra, entre otros materiales para construir su casa. Ella ya posee el adobe y el lugar donde la construirá. Ella ya posee una casa, pero esta muy lejos de su familia y en un área muy sola. Con su casa, podrá cuidar animales propios, comprar muebles, instalar la energía eléctrica y que su hija viva en una casa segura.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, is single and has an 18-year-old daughter.  She’s been a community organizer since 2010.  She teaches adults who did not have the opportunity to attend school how to read and write.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy lumber, stone and other supplies needed to build her house and to pay labor costs.  She already owns the adobe and the place to build it.  She already owns a house but it’s too far from her family and in a very isolated spot.  With her house, she’ll be able to care for animals of her own, to buy furniture and to install electricity so her daughter can live in a safe house.

loans.use: to buy lumber, stone, etc. and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is 19 years old and is from Gaza. He has owned a grocery store since 2011.
He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy goods for the store like soft drinks, and food. This loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy goods for his store like soft drinks, and food.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera. Reside en un lugar que esta a cuatro kilómetros del pueblo, vive con su mamá ya de avanzada edad y dos sobrinas de 8 y 9 años de edad; desde que murió su papá asumió la responsabilidad del hogar, por ser la mayor de los hijos y por que su mamá ya no puede trabajar. María, empezó a sembrar la tierra y a cuidar el ganado que dejo su padre; ella se vio en la necesidad de aprender otras maneras de sobrevivir. Por vivir en un lugar con difícil acceso, ella debe pagar una moto taxi para llegar hasta su casa con los productos que le cobra entre cinco y diez dólares, esto le genera un gasto mayor por lo que se limita de comprar algunas cosas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar alimento para el ganado; debido a que esta es apoca seca y el ganado necesita alimentarse para que estén bien nutridos. Ella necesita el préstamo para no verse en la necesidad de vender los animales, y quedarse sin nada. Su deseo, es dar buen ejemplo a sus sobrinos que no se dejen agobiar por los problemas de la vida, ser buena cliente de la Fundación y continuar luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old and single. She lives in a place that is 4 km from the town. She lives with her mother, who is elderly, and her two nieces, 8 and 9  years old. Since her father died she has assumed responsibility for the household, because she is the eldest and because her mother can no longer  work.

María started farming and looking after the cattle that her father left her, as she  saw the need to learn others ways of surviving.  Because of living in a place that is difficult to get to, she must pay for a mototaxi to get to her home with products, which costs her between five and ten dollars. This represents a major expense, so she can only buy some things.

The loan she is applying to Fundación Campo for is to buy feed for the cattle, due to the fact that it is the dry season, and the cattle need to be fed so that they will be well nourished. She needs the loan so that she will not need to sell the animals and be left with nothing. 

Her wish is to be a good example to her nieces so that they are not overwhelmed by life's problems, to be a good client of the Foundation, and to continue striving for her family.

loans.use: To buy feed for cattle.

loans.name: Jessica Abigail Dorotea

texts.es:
La señora Jessica Abigail Dorotea esta soltera, tiene 24 años de edad, curso los grados de educación secundaria, con titulo de secretaria, actualmente se dedica al tejido de típicos, cortes, sabanas, servilletas, guipiles, y entre otros; cuenta con el apoy de su familia quien la apoyan.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores, altaseda, mish, y otros. Quiere invertir en su negocio, capitalizando así, y entre mas producción tenga, mejorará en ganancia para apoyar de mejor manera a su familia. en el futuro quiere tener trabajador4wes en su negocio, generando así fuente de empleos.
texts.en:
Yessica Abigail Dorotea es single.  She’s 24-years-old and completed secondary education.  She has a secretarial degree.  She currently works knitting traditional costumes, fabrics, sheets, napkins, traditional skirts, etc.  She gets support from her family who backs her up.

She’s requesting this loan to buy yarn in assorted colors, ‘mish’ thread [six-strand thread], ‘altaseda’ [rayon-like thread] thread and others.  She wants to invest in her business injecting more capital and the more production she has the better her profits will be to better support her family.  In future, she’d like to hire personnel for her business thus generating sources of employment.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is happy to be associated with Milango. He received much progress from the previous loan and was able to set up a retail shop. In this business, he sells paraffin, sugar, flour etc. Ibrahim is also married and has four children.

He learnt about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. The main challenge is price fluctuations.

Ibrahim is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase paraffin, sugar, flour, cereals etc. for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his living standards. He aspires to own other centers and plan for his children's education with much security.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock e.g. paraffin, sugar, flour, cereals.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jennifer is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as honest and trustworthy. She operates a school and a retail shop where she provides education and sells household items. Her business is located at a competitive business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy stationery and household items to sell. Her business goal is to own a bigger shop within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stationery and household items

loans.name: Julian Apaza Group

texts.es:
C.F. PANAMERICANA
A.C. JULIAN APAZA
FECHA: 11/12/12

La A.C. “JULIAN APAZA”  iniciará primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, tejido de mantas, venta de mantas, venta de papa, tejido de busos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de mantas que viene trabajando hace tres años atrás; esta técnica la aprendió de sus amigas y la volvió un oficio para generar recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos económicos para apoyar a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
PANAMERICANA FOCAL CENTER
JULIAN APAZA COMUNAL BANK
DATE:  11/12/12

The “Julian Apaza” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board whose treasurer is Rosa.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of activities, among which are: fruit sales, blanket weaving, potato sales and sweatshirt weaving.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small businesswomen one of which is Rosa.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer having been invited by one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently has a business making and selling blankets that she’s been working at for the last three years.  She learned this technique from girlfriends and turned it into her occupation to generate income.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy wool at wholesale from street markets in El Alto and after making them will sell them in her sales stand.  This way of working allows her to generate economic resources to support her family since she lives in a free union and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Miladys

texts.es:
Miladys una humilde señora con 57 años de edad, originaria de Juigalpa Chontales, pero actualmente vive en Managua, casada, madre de 3 hijos, todos son independiente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de ropa. Inicio su negocio con capital propio, dinero que ganaba como maestra, pero luego decidió renunciar de su trabajo para dedicarse a su propio negocio de venta de ropa, pero le fue mal y fracaso, es por eso que hoy en día se dedica solo a la pulpería quien le genera mejores  ingresos, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su hijo.
Ella estas solicitando el financiamiento para comprar cuadernos, lapiceros, abarrotes, mochilas y granos básicos, etc.  Ella estima que le ayudaría a invertir en su negocio, ya que la demanda de sus productos escolares aumenta en esta temporada escolar para incrementar sus ventas, sus planes futuros es establecer un comedor para vender comida, su meta próxima es hacer crecer su negocio y ampliar  el local en donde tiene su negocio.
texts.en:
Miladys is a humble, 57-year-old woman originally from Juigalpa, Chontales, who currently lives in Managua.  She’s married and the mother of three children, all independent now.  She’s a merchant by occupation; she sells groceries and clothes.  She started her business with her own capital, money she earned working as a teacher, but then decided to resign from her job and sell clothes full-time.  But she did not do well and she failed which is why today she only works in the grocery store which generates better income.  Her son helps her with her business.

She is asking for financing to buy notebooks, pencils, grocery items, backpacks, basic grains, etc.  She feels that it will help her stock her business because demand for school supplies rises during the school season so sales will increase.  Her future plan is to open an eatery to sell food.  Her next goal is to make her business grow and expand the site where she has her business.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, grocery items, backpacks, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Katwii

texts.en:
Having successfully repaid her previous Kiva loan, Katwii is asking for another Kiva loan to invest in her clothes-selling business. She is a wise enterprising woman who is focused and her desire is to own several businesses. She says that her food stall is still in operation but she decided to start this clothes-selling business since she saw the need to have one in her locality. 

Thanks to the support she received from Kiva, her food stall grew and sales increased. This new loan will allow her to buy clothes for men, women and children. Katwii will have a variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men, women and children for resale.

loans.name: Marselinah

texts.en:
Marselinah is a 37-year-old, married woman. She has two children, aged 6 and 15 years. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She operates a farm, where she cultivates soy beans, peas, maize, sorghum and other things. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located at a very productive area, and her primary customers are local residents. She says that her biggest business challenge is her customers' low purchasing power. 

She will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to purchase land to expand her farming business, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a borehole.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her family's use.

loans.name: Warada

texts.en:
Warada lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has five school-aged children. He owns a clothes shop and has been in business for five years. He started the business with his personal savings. He is also an electrical contractor.

Warada’s friends invited him to join a group with Milango Financial Services. His aim is to improve his business operations. His main challenges are occasional limited demand and high market fees. Warada is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy clothing to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and used to educate his children. He wants his business to grow into a wholesale outlet in the near future.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell in his clothes shop.

loans.name: Rozaline

texts.en:
Rozaline is 25 years old and from Gaza. She is married.

She has owned a cosmetics and perfumes shop since January 2012.  She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an electricity generator and more perfumes and cosmetics for the shop.

She hopes that this loan will help her improve her income and thus provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy an electricity generator, and more perfumes and cosmetics for the shop.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 40 years old and has 5 children between the ages of 5 and 15. 

For the past three years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. One of the problems she faces is that the prices are too high. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes daily; having money for her expenses makes her proud of her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare rib, meat, pig foot and chicken feet for her business. Her dream is to become a big business woman and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare rib, meat, pig foot and chicken feet for her business,

loans.name: 19 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “19 DE JUNIO”  iniciará tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gladis es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de faldas, tienda de barrio, venta y compra de cordero, venta de ropa, costura de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gladis es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de comida que emprendió mediante su Tía y que hoy en día lo ejerce por cuenta propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos económicos para apoyar a su familia, que componen su madre y para ella.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “10 de Junio” (June 19th) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board where Gladis is secretary.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of activities, among which are: food sales, skirt sales, neighborhood store, sheep buying and selling, clothes sales and clothes sewing.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Gladis.  She indicates that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for a year having been invited to join by one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently has a business making and selling food that she started thanks to her aunt but today she operates by herself.


The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy rice, noodles, oil, etc. at wholesale in street markets in the city of El Alto and then after making it will sell it in street markets in El Alto.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family composed of her and her mother.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, oil, etc.

loans.name: Elliys

texts.en:
Elliys is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as a determined woman. She will use the 30,490 KES loan to buy a water dispenser and microwave for her family. 

Elliys operates a retail store where she sells milk. Her business is located in a busy area with her primary customers being local residents. Her biggest business challenge is having adequate funds to improve. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. Elliys took a previous loan of 300,000 KES which she paid back successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water dispenser and microwave for her family.

loans.name: Elphas

texts.en: Elphas is a 28 year old single man. He describes himself as honest and trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells stationery and printing papers. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a very competitive business environment and his primary customers are primary schools and colleges. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stationery to sell. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a big supplier. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stationery

loans.name: Transito Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Transito de 33 años de edad, trabaja comercializando pan en su bicicleta en la que coloca un canasto con pan de manera que pueda movilizarse más fácilmente, ella realiza esta actividad a diario, contando con una ruta fija y clientes fijos también. Transito vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad, ella es una madre muy estricta y protectora que desea el bien de sus hijos, así mismo Transito posee una panadería junto a su esposo en la que elaboran el pan que posteriormente salen a comercializar. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad insumos para mejorar las condiciones de la panadería, invirtiendo en la compra de  harina, sal, manteca, para la elaboración del pan, así mismo para comprar herramientas como cucharas, moldes, batidoras y otras más para hacer su trabajo más eficiente y mejor y así producir más pan.
texts.en:
Tránsito, 33, works selling bread from a basket on her bicycle so she can move about more easily.  She does this daily and has a fixed route and regular customers too.  She lives with her husband and two minor children.  She’s a very strict, protective mother who wants the best for her children.  Tránsito and her husband also own a bakery where they bake the bread they subsequently go out to sell.

She’s requesting a loan to buy larger amounts of ingredients to improve her bakery’s conditions.  She will buy flour, salt, shortening to make bread and will also buy tools like spoons, bread pans, mixers and others to make her work more efficient and better thus producing more bread.

loans.use: to buy flour and bread pans.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria de 33 años de edad, originario del Municipio de San Francisco Libre, pero tiene 3 años de residir en Managua, casada, madre de 2 hijos de 1 y 7  años de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de miscelánea. Inicio trabajando en una empresa que se llama Zona Franca en donde ofrecía productos varios a sus clientes, así fue como  comenzó su negocio con capital propio, dinero que tenía ahorrado de su anterior trabajo, pero luego al casarse decidió emprender otro negocio como es el de la miscelánea con un capital de C$12,500 y con ayuda de Instituciones Financieras, negocio que le genera mucho ingresos a diarios, la cual se siente satisfecha porque le va muy bien en su miscelánea, ya que con las ganancias que le genere su negocio desea convertir su miscelánea en un minisúper para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
Gloria solicita el préstamo para comprar toda la mercadería en general tales  como, verduras, productos de limpieza, chinelas, ropa, zapato y una refrigeradora. Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar  toda la mercadería que aún no tiene en existencia y la  más solicitado por sus  clientes, con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias, una de sus metas es poder comprar su propio carro para poder transportarse y ofrecer sus productos en otros Departamentos.
texts.en:
Gloria, 33, is from the municipality of San Francisco Libre but has lived in Managua for the last three years.  She’s married and the mother of two children who are 1 and 7 years of age.  She’s a merchant by occupation.  She has a variety store.  She started working for a firm called Zona Franca where she’d sell her goods to customers.  This is how she started her business with her own capital which was money she’d saved from her previous job.  When she got married, she decided to start another business and used a capital of 12,500 colones and loans from financial institutions to do so.  This business generates high daily income and she feels satisfied because she does very well in her variety shop.  She wants to use profits generated by the variety shop to convert it into a mini supermarket to meet customer demand.

Gloria’s asking for a loan to buy all the general merchandise like vegetables, cleaning supplies, shawls, clothes, shoes and a refrigerator.  She feels that this loan will help her buy all the merchandise that she still does not have on hand and that’s most requested by her customers aiming at increasing sales and earning higher profits.  One of her goals is to be able to buy her own car to transport herself and sell her goods in other Departments.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 37 years old and married to Margaret, who is a housewife. They have one child, who is three years old now. David has been supplying charcoal in Mwiki town for 12 years and earns an income of 25,300 KES (Kenyan shillings) monthly.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, to hire a bigger truck so that he can supply charcoal to distant places, e.g, Kitui. The anticipated income will be used to improve the living standards of his family.

In the future, he plans to buy his own truck so that he can be responsible for fuel only and not for a rental.

loans.use: to hire a truck that can transport charcoal and to add more stock.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a lady of thirty five years, married to Robert, and the mother of three children now.She still sells home products and also sells shoes and jackets, the business is doing well. She has been in this business for 12 years, and gets a monthly income of twenty seven thousands shillings.

This will be Teresa's second loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the loan to buy new shoes, jackets and more stock of home products for resale. 

In future she wants to open another shop.

loans.use: To buy jackets, shoes and more stock of home products for resale.

loans.name: Bornface

texts.en:
Bornface used his previous loan to purchase bicycle spare parts, which boosted his monthly business income to 50,000 KES.

He is now borrowing a loan of KES.70,000, with which he intends to purchase more bicycle spare parts. He will reinvest back the anticipated profit in his business.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle spare parts to use in his shop.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 44-year-old green grocer in Mariakani. She is married and her husband supports her. They are blessed with four children. 

She has been in this business for the last four years and she is doing well. Rehema is requesting her sixth loan after repaying the previous ones successfully. She will purchase a popcorn machine and pay for the business premises.

She hopes to have a successfully business in future and a good life.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for making popcorn and pay for business premises

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty lives in Montserrado County, the most commercial city in Liberia. She is 57 years old and has two children, ages 30 and 36. 

For the past eight years, Gifty has sold items such as rice, palm oil, soap and salt from a table in the local market. One of the problems she faces is a limited amount of products to sell. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, soap, salt, etc for her business. 

She enjoys the profit she makes every day.  Having money for her expenses makes her proud of her business. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as rice, palm oil, soap and salt to sell at the market.

loans.name: Yvotta C. M.

texts.en: Yvotta C.W. lives in West Point which is one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 children between the ages of 11 months and 17 years that live at home. Three of them attend school. For three years she has been selling sugar, tissues, candles, and other items in her community. One of the problems that she faces is a small income.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes enables her to buy food for her home. This makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, sugar, tissues, candles, and other items for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, tissues, candles, and others items for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and runs a clothing business which she has been operating for eight years. In this business she sells shawls, handbags, pants, shoes etc. She has two children.
She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is price fluctuations.
Ruth is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of second hand clothing, bed sheets, shoes and other items. The proceeds from the loan will be added to her savings to help open a stall in the town. Her dream is to open a larger boutique which can provide more income to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of second hand clothing, bed sheets, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon is a 28 year old married woman. She describes herself as caring and warm . She operates a retail tailor business where she sells clothes that she makes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a very competitive area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the delay of payment from customers. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy clothing material for sewing clothes to sell . Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a tailoring school. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy's business is improving and has enabled her to repay the loan on time. Owing to the low demand characterized in the area early in the year, she has decided to reduce the amount she is applying for.
Lucy is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of groceries and fruit to sell.
She believes this will provide enough income for the family and still allow her to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Sonia Aracely

texts.es: Sonia de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en casa que alquila desde hace varios años, ella posee una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad y de golosinas entre otros más, así mismo posee un molino con el cual brinda sus servicios y también se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza por catálogo. Sonia es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a diversas actividades para poder contar con una vida estable. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para su tienda y poder surtirla de todo lo necesario, así mismo para invertir en la compra de cosméticos y otros productos de belleza para posteriormente venderlos de forma ambulante. Con esto Sonia espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sonia, 48, lives with her family in a house she’s rented for several years.  She has a small store selling basic staple goods and snacks, among others.  She also has a mill she provides service with and also sells beauty products via catalog.  Sonia’s a very hardworking woman who does various things to have a stable life.

She’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy larger amounts of products for her store to stock it with everything necessary.  She will also buy cosmetics and other beauty products to subsequently sell from place to place.  With this, Sonia hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy basic staple goods.

loans.name: Cecilia Isabel

texts.es: Cecilia de 50 años de edad, es madre de familia soltera, quien trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Ella comercializa productos de catálogos como joyas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, zapatos y otros más, y así mismo posee una pequeña sala de belleza la cual poco a poco ha ido mejorando lo cual ha obtenido con mucho esfuerzo. Cecilia desea invertir en la compra de tintes para el cabello, productos para el cabello como tratamientos y champús profesionales, con lo que pueda ofrecer un trabajo mejor. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL y de esta forma alcanzar su meta de mejorar el negocio y así mismo sus ganancias lo cual es muy importante para tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 50, is a single mother who works very hard to get ahead.  She sells products like jewelry, perfume, cream, cosmetics, shoes and others via catalog and she also owns a small beauty salon that she got with much effort and she’s gradually been improving.

Cecilia wants to buy hair dye and other hair care products like treatments and professional shampoo to do better work.  She’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to reach this goal of improving her business as well as her profits which is very important in order to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy hair coloring and cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and owns a curio shop where she sells artwork that is loved by tourists. Her business has been running for five years. 

Joyce learned about Milango Financial Services through friends who invited her to the group. Her goal is to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, a seasonal tourist trade and the high cost of purchasing stock.

Joyce is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to purchase more curios to sell in her shop. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more curios to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Katumu

texts.en:
Katumu lives in West Point, one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County, Liberia. She is 30 years old and has two children in school, ages 13 and 16.  

For the past four years, Katumu has sold rice, milk, sugar, pepper, palm oil and other items on a table at the market. One of the problems she faces is the rainy season. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes as well as being busy. Katumu is proud of her business.

Katumu is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, milk, sugar, pepper, palm oil and other items for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, milk, sugar, pepper, palm oil and other items to sell at the market.

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Vilma del Socorro  reside en la Cuidad de Granada,una de la ciudades mas antigua de nicaragua con aspecto colonial,  tiene 53 años, es comerciante desde hace 6 años, su núcleo familiar se compone de ella y su hijo, su labor consiste en la comercialización de productos artesanales, Toda su artesanías la compra en los municipios de  Masaya, Catarina y san Juan de Oriente, con la ayuda de su hijo se encarga de vender a los transeúntes, ya que posee un pequeño lugar de ventas  en el parque central de Granada,  comenta que sus ventas son muy buenas por lo que se desarrolla bastante el   turismo y es una de las  ciudades mas visitadas por los extranjeros.
 
La idea de iniciar su negocio fue con el propósito de mejorar su ingresos familiares ya que de el depende no solo ella, también su hijo, hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien porque ha logrado mantener su negocio en este tiempo.

En estos momentos su demanda se ha incrementado, por este  motivo es que se acerca a Ceprodel  para solicitar  un nuevo crédito, para la compra de  cerámica de barro, de madera, acrílica, billetera de hombre corriente y de cuero, camisetas xerográficas, collares y camas  de madera para niños. Siendo esta mercadería la más comercializada, lo que contribuirá a mejorar la oferta de sus productos y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Vilma del Socorro lives in the city of Granada, one of the oldest colonial cities in Nicaragua.  She is 53 years old, and has been in business for six years.  Her nuclear family consists of herself and her son, and she makes a living selling hand-crafted items.  She buys all of her products from the municipalities of Masaya, Catarina and San Juan de Oriente.

Her son helps her sell to the visitors who pass through her city.  They have a small area where they sell in the central park in Granada.  She says sales are going well due to the development of turism and the fact that Granada is one of the most visited cities among international travelers.

The idea of starting her business was inspired with the goal of increasing her family's income, since both she and her son rely on this income.  To date, it has gone very well and she has been able to maintain her business.  

Recently, demand has increased, so she has approached Ceprodel to ask for a new loan so she can buy clay pottery, wood carvings, products made of acrylic, fashionable leather wallets for men, xerographed t-shirts, necklaces, and wooden beds for children.  

As these items are the biggest sellers, they will contribute the most to the increase in her household income.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, portfolios, leather purses for women, leather belts for men, typical masks and a variety of costume jewelry.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province. He is married and has two children. He owns a hardware store that he has been operating for three years now. He started the business through his savings.

He learnt about Milango through friends and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges he is facing are purchasing stock and bad debts.

Evans is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy timber, nails, paint and other equipment for the store. His extra income from the loan will be added to savings to buy more stock and educate the children.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails, paint and other equipment.

loans.name: Weniger

texts.es:
Weniger de 36 años, es un hombre que siempre esta activo, le gusta mucho sentirse útil y trabajar para poder mantener bien y con buenas condiciones a su familia, es conviviente con Nolita de 33 años con quien tiene un hijo de 08 años llamado Fernando, el trabaja mucho pues desea mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos. Vive cómodamente junto a su familia en casa propia. Cuando algún vecino, conocido o cliente nuevo desea realizar una construcción, levantar una pared, armar una casa o implementar con nuevos cables y seguridad sus instalaciones eléctricas, no dudan en llamar de inmediato a Weniger ya que su trabajo consiste en realizar construcciones de casa y electrificar las mismas, lleva realizando este trabajo por 06 años de manera independiente ya que antes de eso trabajaba para otras personas y fue ahí en donde aprendió y gano mucha experiencia para hacerlo solo durante todo este tiempo.
Le esta yendo muy bien, tiene muchos contratos y siempre Realiza su trabajo de buena manera y con todos los implementos de seguridad ya que no quiere tener accidentes que lamentar, cuando trabajaba para otras personas tenia pocos ingresos y dependía mucho de lo que le pagaban, pero ahora tiene sus ingresos regulados de acuerdo a los trabajos que hace, se siente mejor y tiene mayor autonomía en su economía, desea seguir trabajando e implementándose  con herramientas y equipos que le permitan realizar su trabajo con mayor rapidez. Este será su  préstamo número 03  con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, además el se compromete a ser puntual, ya que no desea quedar mal con el lindo grupo al que pertenece y al cual desea pertenecer por mucho mas tiempo.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará materiales, herramienta y equipos que necesita para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Weniger, 36 years old, is a man who is always active.  He very much likes to feel useful and to work to be able to support his family well and keep them in good conditions.  He lives with his partner Nolita, 33 years old, with whom he has an 8-year-old son named Fernando.  He works hard because he wants to improve the quality of life of his family.  He lives comfortably with his family in their own home.  

When a neighbor, acquaintance or new customer wants to carry out construction, raise a wall, build a house or install new cables and security for their electricity system, they don’t hesitate to call Weniger immediately as his work consists of constructing houses and doing the electrical work in them.  He has been doing this work for about 6 years independently.  Prior to that he worked for other people and it was there that he learned and gained a lot of experience in order to do it on his own during this time.

It is going very well for him.  He has a lot of contracts and he always carries out his work in a good manner and with all the implements of security since he doesn’t want to have accidents to regret.  When he was working for other people he had limited income and depended a lot on what they paid him but now he has a regular income according to the jobs that he does.  He feels better and has greater autonomy in his finances.  He wants to continue working and implementing with tools and equipment that allow him to carry out his work with greater speed.  

This will be his third loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he will have financial support, since thus he will feel secure in moving forward with his business.  In addition, he is committed to being punctual, since he doesn’t want to make a bad impression on the nice group to which he belongs and to which he wants to belong for much longer.  

With the amount requested of 2000 soles (PEN), he will buy materials, tools and equipment that he needs to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy materials, tools and equipment that he needs to continue with his work.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a crop farm business where he sells cereals. He has been operating this for two years. 

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The main challenges have been the harsh climatic conditions, lack of funds, a problem he sees partly sorted by this loan, and also bad debts.

Samwel is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy cereal stock. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business stock.

loans.use: to buy cereal stock.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary used her previous loan to purchase more molasses to sell, and right now her monthly income is about KES 20,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 60,000 which she intends to use to purchase more molasses to sell to her customers. She also plans to plow back the profit to the business.

Her dream is to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To purchase molasses to sell.

loans.name: Enoch

texts.en:
Enoch is a resident of the Malindi area, in Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has two children, who are in school.

Enoch is a business man and owns a retail shop, a business that he has been running for two years. He began the business with funds that he received from his friends. In this shop, he sells goods like paraffin, sugar and flour to his customers. His main business challenge is price fluctuations.

He learned about Milango from other clients of the institution. He joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of his business. Enoch is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase inventory for his shop, like paraffin, sugar and flour, for resale. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings, to improve on the living standard. 

Enoch aspires to own other business centers and to plan for his children’s education with much security.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his retail store, like paraffin, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from the tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. Henry began the business of tea tree farming this year. 

He learnt about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Henry is applying for a loan of 20,730 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings and he looks forward to establishing the farming by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married business man. He owns a retail shop, a business which he has been operating for two years. In this shop, Karisa sells charcoal. Besides this, he also farms, planting crops.

He learned about Milango through a friend, with the aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is bad debts.

Karisa is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenyan shillings to buy additional stock of charcoal for his shop. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. His aspiration is to open a butchery.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of charcoal for his shop.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es: María de 60 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora que vive junto a dos hijas mayores de edad quienes le ayudan con los gastos familiares. María se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, las cuales elabora y vende en su casa de habitación, este es un trabajo bastante duro ya que debe cocinar el maíz, luego molerlo para hacer la masa y posteriormente pasar una jornada de cuatro horas aproximadamente para hacer las tortillas, a pesar de esto ella se siente muy feliz por tener un negocio estable que le permite contar con una vida humilde pero digna. María solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con la ayuda necesaria para la compra de leña con la cual cocina el maíz, así mismo para comprar cal y mayor cantidad de maíz para elaborar más tortillas, ya que de esta manera ella podrá contar con más ganancias que serán de mucho beneficio.
texts.en:
María, 60, is a very hard-working woman who lives with her two older daughters who help her with family expenses. María works making tortillas, which she makes and sells in her house. This is quite a hard job since she must cook the corn, grind it down to make the dough and then spend four hours a day making the tortillas.

In spite of this, she feels very happy to have a stable business that allows her to have a humble but dignified life. María is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she will have the help necessary to be able to buy firewood (with which she cooks the corn), and also to purchase lime and a larger quantity of corn to make more tortillas. In this way she can have more earnings that will be very beneficial to her.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn

loans.name: Hernaldo José

texts.es:
El señor Hernaldo,  reside  en  la cuidad de Masaya, conocida también como capital del Folklore Nicaragüense, con 51 años de edad, de profesión zapatero, casado y responsable de su hogar. Su negocio consiste en la elaboración de calzado de mujer, tiene la experiencia de 22 años dedicándose a esta labor, lo que le ha permitido adquirir una gran experiencia en la elaboración y diseño de las sandalias.
 
Su núcleo familiar lo conforman dos hijos y su esposa, del cual uno de sus hijos  es independiente, la otra joven es estudiante universitaria en la que están concentrado todo sus esfuerzos para que se forme profesionalmente.

su producto lo comercializa en el mercado municipal de Masaya y le entrega a dos clientes que viajan a los hermanos países de Honduras y Costa Rica

El señor Hernaldo está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima como cuero, suela, pega, cuero nuevo, esponja, cerquillo, piel de cerdo, pega amarilla, pega blanca, fibra, cajuela 30-79, cajuela juanita, cajuela bambú, tela, entre otros.

Considera que el crédito le ayudara en gran parte en aumentar sus ingresos y calidad de vida para su familia así como cubrir la demanda de todos y cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
