Hernaldo resides in the city of Masaya, also known as the capital of Nicaraguan folklore. He is a 51-year-old cobbler who's married and responsible for his home. His business consists of making women's shoes. He has 22 years of experience working in this profession which has allowed him to acquire a great deal of experience in the manufacturing and designing of sandals. 

His family consists of his wife and two children. The one son is independent, and the other younger daughter is a university student who is concentrating all her efforts into becoming a professional.

He sells his product in the municipal market of Masaya and he delivers to two clients who travel to the beautiful counties of Honduras and Costa Rica.

Hernaldo is requesting this loan in order to buy raw materials such as leather, soles, glue, new leather, shoe lasts, sponges, welts, pigskin, yellow glue, white glue, fiber, Juanita PVC resin, PVC 30-79 resin, Bamboo resin, and synthetic fabric among other things. 

He considers that this loan will largely help him in increasing his income and the quality of life for his family as well as to satisfy the demand of each and every one of his customers.

loans.use: to buy shoe-making products such as leather, yellow glue, white glue, shoe lasts, sponges, welts, fiber, Ethylene Vinyl Acetate, linings, pigskin, Juanita PVC resin, PVC 30-79 resin, Bamboo resin, and synthetic fabric.

loans.name: Masumbuko

texts.en:
Masumbuko is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He runs a food café that has been running for six months. He is a married father of two children, although only one is school-going. He is also employed. He employs two other people in the current business.

Despite the challenges of perishability and bad debts, Masumbuko aspires to own a larger shelter from where he can sell the food. Masumbuko learnt of Milango from his friends. He is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase utensils and cereals for the café. 

He also desires to move to a new venue, have a carry-out goods business, and establish a hotel in the future. His challenges have been high competition and related fees.

Masumbuko believes the additional income from this loan will help him build and provide a good form of education to his child.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and cereals for the café.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 44 años de edad, es una persona que con muchos esfuerzos ha sabido salir adelante y criar a su hija quien ahora es madre también de un pequeñ0 niño junto a quienes vive Dora. Ella posee una tortillería donde elabora tortillas en el mediodía y en la noche vendiéndolas en su propia casa o a domicilio, su clientela es bastante amplia por lo que Dora desea invertir en la compra de maíz por mayor de modo que pueda obtenerlo a precios más bajos, así m ismo para comprar leña y cal para cocinar el maíz. Es por esta razón que Dora solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL y contar con el dinero necesario para realiza esto  ya que si ella cuenta con más masa puede atender a más clientes a quienes en ocasiones  no puede venderles por falta de materia prima para elaborar las tortillas.
texts.en:
Dora, 44, is a person who - with much effort - has figured out how to get ahead and raise her daughter who is now a mother herself, of a small boy. Dora lives with them.

She has a tortilla shop where she makes tortillas at midday and sells them at night from her own house or by delivery. She has quite a large client base, which is why Dora wishes to invest in the purchase of wholesale corn so that she can get it at a lower price. She would also like to buy firewood and lime to cook the corn with. 

For this reason, Dora is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, so that she has the money necessary to make these purchases, since if she has more dough she can attend to more customers who she cannot sell to on occasion due to a lack of raw material to make tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn to improve her business

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: ángela de 45 años de edad, es una madre de familia, responsable y trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo y dos pequeños hijos. Ángela es muy dedicada a su trabajo, ella se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, su taller está ubicado en su casa de habitación donde también se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Debido a que el años escolar está por iniciar, esta es la temporada en que se elaboran muchos uniformes, y Ángela desea aprovechar esto al máximo, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el fin de poder contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de hilos de colores, botones, telas, y otros más, lo cual le permita aceptar mayor cantidad de pedidos. Dora desea mejorar sus ganancias y de este modo brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Ángela is 45 years old, and is a responsible and hard-working mother.  She lives with her husband and two small children.  Ángela is very dedicated to her work.  She works in tailoring, and her shop is located in her home where she also does household chores.  Because the school year is about to start, this is the season in which she makes many uniforms.  Ángela wants to take advantage of this as much as possible, and because of this she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL with her goal to be able to have the necessary money to invest in buying colored threads, buttons, fabrics and more.  This will allow her to accept more orders.  She wants to improve her earnings and through this help her husband with the home's expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and buttons.

loans.name: Hendrita

texts.en:
Hendrita is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She owns a café and has been in the business for five years, selling food to the surrounding people. The business has been the source of income for the married mother of children, both of whom are in school. 

Hendrita was introduced to Milango by her friends. She is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase food stock and utensils. 

She intends to save the additional income for future projects. Her main ambition is to increase the size of the business and also open a grocery stall in the near future.

Hendrita believes this will help improve her standard of living, especially her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase food stock and utensils.

loans.name: Masona

texts.en:
Masona lives in Monrovia, the capital city of Montserrado County, which is the major county for producing fish for the Liberian local market. She is 36 years old, married, and has two children, ages 10 and 12. They are in school and live at home. 

For the past five years Masona has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She enjoys the way her customers respond to her business. She learned her way of selling from her mother. She spends nine hours per day on her business. A challenge she faces is how early in the morning she must wake up, to obtain fresh fish to sell. 

Masona is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity of fresh fish for her business. With her business profits, she plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Cecilia Guadalupe

texts.es: Cecilia de 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como carpintero, y así mismo con dos hijos menores de edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Cecilia es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora y amable que posee un negocio propio en el que se dedica a comercializar: jugos, sodas, golosinas, colas y ganchos para el cabello entre otros productos más. Su negocio se encuentra en el mercado municipal lo que es de mucha ventaja para ella por la afluencia de personas que visitan el lugar a diario, contando con varios clientes fijos, con el deseo de aumentar sus ganancias, Cecilia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de sodas por mayor, así mismo jugos y dulces, ya que son estos los productos de mayor demanda, lo que desea aprovechar al máximo, con lo que mejorará su negocio en gran manera al igual que sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years of age and lives with her husband who works as a carpenter, and with their 2 minor children who are in school. Cecilia is a very responsible, hard-working and kind woman who has her own business, selling juices, sodas, sweet snacks, pony tails, and hair fasteners, among other products. 

Cecilia's business is in the municipal market, a location that has its advantages, due to the volume of people who visit the locale daily. She can also count on various fixed customers. Wishing to boost earnings, Cecilia is soliciting a loan from INTEGRAL so she can purchase sodas at wholesale, plus juices and candies. These are the products most in demand. She wants to take advantage of this to the maximum. In this way, Cecilia will improve her business in a grand way, especially her sales.

loans.use: to buy fruit juices and sweets to improve her business.

loans.name: Manuel Isaac

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Isaac, esta soltero tiene 27 años de edad, cursó los 5 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes, y servilletas, inicio este negocio siendo, colaborador con su papá y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de 2 telares completamente equipados, esto para mejorar su producción , ya que quiere implementar otros 2 puestos de trabajo, contribuyendo así a dar trabajos a  2 personas mas. Espera seguir administrando de la mejor manera su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel Isaac, 27, is single and studied for five years in primary school. He makes a living weaving clothing and napkins. He began this business as his father's helper and now has eight years of experience in it. He is supported by his family.

He is requesting a loan that will help him to buy two completely equipped looms, which will help him improve production since he wants to hire two more workers and thus contribute to the employment of two more people.

He hopes to continue administering his business in the best way possible.

loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving

loans.name: Girl

texts.en: Girl is 38 years old and lives in West Point, one of the busiest and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is married and has five children ages 6, 8, 13, 15, and 21, all of them are in school and live at home. For the past seven years she has been selling  chicken, plantain, fish, potatoes, etc.  in her community. She has a lot of customers and makes a good profit. Girl is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, plantain, fish, potatoes,  etc. for her business and hopes her business will prosper so she can send her children to good schools.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, plantain, fish, potatoes, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga de 72 años de edad, originaria de Rivas, pero tiene 7 años de residir en Managua, soltera, madre de 4 hijos, mayores de edad, todos son independiente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de cosméticos, de la que es propietaria hace más de 4 años, con conocimiento académico de tercer grado de primaria. Inicio su negocio con capital propio vendiendo cosméticos, ya que ella viajaba a Guatemala a comprar su mercadería variada porque le salía un poco favorable y de esta manera pudo obtener  buenos ingresos para el sustento de la familia, ella también recibe una pensión que le da el gobierno  por hijos muertos en la guerra y por incapacidad, luego con el tiempo ella decidió emprender otro negocio como es el de pulpería con ayuda de  financiamiento de  instituciones financieras. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y nieta.
Olga solicita el financiamiento para comprar aceite, papel higiénico, jabón, azúcar, desodorante, shampo, galleta, cloro, etc. Ya que ella estima que el crédito le ayudaría a comprar toda la mercadería en general que necesita en su pulpería, para poder incrementar sus ventas y así obtener mejores ganancias, con el propósito de ampliar su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Olga is 72 years of age.  She is originally from Rivas, but she has been residing in Managua for seven years.  She is single and a mother of four children, all of whom are adults and independent.  She runs a grocery store that she has operated for over four years and sells cosmetics.  She has a formal education up to the third grade.  She started her business selling cosmetics with her own capital.  

She has traveled to Guatemala to purchase an assortment of merchandise because [this method] has had positive results and has enabled her to obtain good profits to support her family.  She also receives a pension from the government for children who died in the war and for disability.  After some time passed, she decided to start another business, a grocery store, with the help of financing from financial institutions.  She relies on the support of her daughter and granddaughter [in this endeavor].

Olga requested the financing to buy oil, sugar, cookies, soap, deodorant, shampoo, bleach, and toilet paper, [among other items].  She believes that the credit would help her to purchase all the general merchandise that she needs in her grocery store, [which will allow her] to increase her sales and obtain better profits with the intent to expand her business and satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, cookies, soap, deodorant, shampoo, bleach, and toilet paper, [among other items].

loans.name: Kahunda

texts.en:
Kahunda is a married business lady who lives in Malindi and sells roofing materials of the kind commonly referred to as ‘makuti.' The 'makuti' are woven from coconut leaves and threads. These items are preferred for roofing in the Kilifi area, and at the coast in general, because they insulate home interiors from the heat that is experienced at the coast during the day time. Kahunda has been running the roofing materials business for 15 years. She also keeps dairy animals.

Kahunda was introduced to Milango by her friends. She is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings to purchase more coconut leaves and threads, and animal feed. Her main challenges are high inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers, and a lack of reliable customers. Kahunda will save the additional income from this loan and use it to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut leaves and threads from which to weave roofing materials, and to buy animal feed for her dairy animals.

loans.name: Madayzah

texts.en: Madayzah lives in West Point, one of the busiest and well known markets in Montserrado county.  She is 22 years old, married and has three children between 1 and 8 years old. Two are in school and all of them  live at home. Her husband is a businessman.  For the past three years she been selling   charcoal, soft drinks, etc. in her community. She got money from her oldest sister to start this business but is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, soft drinks, etc.  for her  business. In the future Madayzah wishes to buy a land and build her family a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, soft drinks, etc.  for her  business.

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Giang was born in 1969 and is a widow. She has a son and a daughter who are workers.  Giang grows peach trees to earn a living and earns about 5,000,000 VND per month.  She has done this job for 20 years. 
She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2004. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,374,000 [VND] and repaid on time.  In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 [VND] to buy peach tree seeds.

loans.use: to buy peach tree seeds

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam was born in 1973. She has a son and two daughters. They are studying at secondary school and primary school. Her husband is a builder.  His income is about 5,000,000 VND per month. Tam grows rice and sells fish to earn a living.  She earns about 6,000,000 VND per month.  She has done this job for 15 years. Her family’s total income is 11,000,000 VND.
She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2004. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid on time.  In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,246,000 VND to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion De La Paz

texts.es: Concepción de la Paz  de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida  y sus hijos en casa propia; ella posee una pequeña tienda y librería donde vende artículos escolares cuadernos, lapiceros, pegamento, tijeras, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar que califico como muy bueno, es una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Concepción es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y con muchas metas por delante, su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito es la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar utiles escolares por mayor. Concepción de Paz tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Concepción de la Paz  is forty four years old. She lives with her life's companion and their children in a house they own. She has her own small store and book store where she sells school supplies such as notebooks, pencil cases, glue, scissors and more. She has had this business for many years and this has given her experience in sales that allows her to obtain more profit. It is located in a very good place with a lot of passer by and she has gained many customers. People prefer her because she always has what they need with quality products at accessible prices and with unequalled service at her customer's service. Concepción is a woman who is dedicated to her work. She is energetic and has a lot of goals for the future. The biggest secret to her success is the constancy and live she brings to her work. She knows that it is the only way she will be able to achieve what she wants. Like every good merchant she wants to grow her business and make a new investment but she needs capital and that is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy school supplies wholesale. Concepción de Paz has good payment references and assures us she will pay off her debt. She also trusts that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy school supplies wholesale

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en: Korpo lives in West Point, one of the busiest and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is 39 years old, married and her husband is a businessman. They have five children between the ages of 5 to 19.  For four years now she has been operating a restaurant located in the local market. She received money from her husband to start her business, and learned how to cook from her mother. Korpo likes her business because she makes a good profit and has lots of customers. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, bonnie fish, spear rid, rice, pepper and  pig's feet for her  business. He dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, bonnie fish, spear rid, rice, pepper and pig's feet for her  business.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai was born in 1956. She has four children who are adult and have gotten married. Her husband is dead. She is earns a living as a farmer. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 36 years. Her family’s total income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2003. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 to build some more chicken coops to raise more chickens. She wants to save the profits for her retirement.

loans.use: to build some more chicken coops to raise more chickens.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen was born in 1986. She has two children who are under five years old. Her husband is an ink worker. She is a worker. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 3 years. Her family’s total income is 9,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2012. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy chickens and feed for chickens. She wants to earn some more money after work.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Lesbia Carolina

texts.es: Lesbia una humilde señora  de 35 años de edad, originaria de Estelí, pero tiene 16 años de residir en Managua, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 6, 12 y 16 años, actualmente los tres están estudiando, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de venta de mercadería variada. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio trabajando desde muy joven con su mama,  vendiendo concentrado de pollo, cerdo y  gallina, pero miro que este negocio no era muy rentable, fue así que decidió emprender su propio negocio como es el de la venta de mercadería en general el cual este negocio si le genera muchas ganancias a diario con ayuda de instituciones financieras pudo sacar adelante su negocio, cuenta con otros ingresos como dinero que le da su esposo. Ella está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  ropa y articulo escolares como, faldas, camisas, cuadernos,  lápiz, etc. Para aprovechar la temporada escolar en donde la demanda de estos productos escolares aumentan con el propósito de hacer crecer  el inventario de su negocio y poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura del negocio, su meta próxima es comprar una camioneta para transportar sus productos para evitar mayores gastos.
texts.en: Lesbia is a humble 35 year old woman from Estelí. She has lived in Managua for 16 years. She is the mother of 3 children aged 6, 12 and 16. Right now, the three f them are in school. She is a merchant and sell various merchandise. She started working as a merchant when she was very young, with her mother, selling chicken and pork bullion. but she saw that that business wasn't profitable. That was why she decided to open her own business selling general merchandise. This business generates a lot of income daily. With help from financial institutions, she was able to to get her business ahead. She has other income, such as money that her husband gives her. She is asking for the loan to buy clothes and school supplies such as skirts, shirts, notebooks, pencils, etc. To take advantage of the school year when the sales of these items increase, she wants to grow her business' inventory and meet her customers/ demands. Her plans for the future are to improve her business infrastructure. Her next goal is to buy a pickup truck to transport her products to avoid more expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothes and school supplies such as skirts, shirts, notebooks, pencils, etc.

loans.name: Masofoe

texts.en:
Masofoe is 34 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 17 and 20, who are in school. All of them live at West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. This county is a major center for producing fish for the Liberian local market.

Masofoe is a high school graduate. She has been selling goods, like palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra and pepper, in the local market for the past ten years. Because she uses a motorbike to get her goods from the bush (village), she really faces a big problem during the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to enable her to increase her inventory before the rainy season.

Her dreams are to build a house for her children, and to grow her business because with it, she has gained her independence.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of goods (like palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra and pepper), in advance of the rainy season.

loans.name: Can

texts.en:
Can was born in 1957. She has a son and a daughter who are adults. Her husband and she are farmers to earn a living. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 20 years. Her family’s total income is 6,000,000 VND.

She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2003. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy chickens and chicken feed. She wants to earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken and chicken feed.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai was born in 1965. She has two daughters and a son. Her oldest daughter is a barber. Two other children are studying at secondary school. Her husband is sick and is unable to work. She is a farmer. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 25 years. Her family’s total income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2004. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid on time.  In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy peach seedlings and fertilizer to help them grow. She wants to use her profits to buy medicine for her husband.

loans.use: to buy peach seedlings and fertilizer to help them grow.

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo 3 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of her group Cristo y Nuestro Esfuerzo (Christ and our effort) 3. This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and luxury tourism.

Maritza makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to improve her business. She is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products. She will use this loan to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women's accessories, and other products to resell.

She will use the profits to improve her quality of life. Maritza and her group thank you for your help in achieving their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women's accessories, and other products

loans.name: Segundo Roberto

texts.es: Segundo  vive en el cantón manta. Tiene 48 años. Es soltera. No Tiene hijos. el  Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir sus estudios  y Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. El decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio que es el comercio  En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela segundo  trabaja  solo las mañana  diariamente. Con el préstamo comprara ropa, pantalones, interiores, varios, etc. su meta es tener su propio almacén de ropa
texts.en: Segundo  lives in the Manta canton. He is 48 years old and single.He has no children. He made the decision to continue in his studies and when no one offered him a job at a business, he decided to get the money together to open hi sown business. Now, his business has grown little by little and he has a clientele. Segundo works daily, only in the mornings. With the loan, he will buy clothes, pants, underwear, etc. His goal is to have his own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy clothes, pants and underwear.

loans.name: El Futuro 3 Group

texts.en:
Ramonita is the coordinator of her group El Futuro (The Future) 3. This group is located in the area surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here with her five children. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to educate and take care of her children while she is working to pay for all they need (food, clothes, etc.). She enjoys being at home with her children after work and school.

Ramonita is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothes. She runs her business by walking in her community and in other communities nearby. She is Haitian and is a single mother. Ramonita's profits are the only income for her family's survival. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ladia

texts.en:
Ladia lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is 40 years old and married to a businessman. They have five children between the ages of 2 and 24, who are in school and live at home.

For 10 years Ladia has been operating a shop in her community, where she sells soft drinks, cold water and phone credit cards. She received a little amount from her husband to start her business, and she learned to manage it from her mother. Ladia likes her business, because she makes more profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, and phone credit cards to resell in her business. Ladia plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, and phone credit cards for her  business.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena, 54, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Conrado, an employee, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Lorena operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lorena hopes to give her grandchildren a good education and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Tumendelger

texts.en: Mr.Tumendelger is 26 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife Altantungalag has worked in a cafeteria as a chef and now she is staying home taking care of their newborn baby girl Bulganhishig, age one. The borrower has been working as an assistant worker at a construction site and as a salesperson in a charcoal and firewood selling business. He is planning to start a cafeteria business with his wife and is now requesting 740,000 MNT to purchase equipment and tools for his newly starting cafeteria business. The borrower and his wife both are hardworking and optimistic people.

loans.use: to purchase equipments and tools for his newly starting cafeteria business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Jane requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a resident of the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child.  Raphael owns a mobile money transfer shop, a business that he has been running for four years. He began the business from a loan he obtained from a friend. He is also formally employed.

He learnt about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. His main challenge is lack of till float, a problem he sees partly sorted by this loan.

Raphael is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to increase till money and buy a stock of calling cards. The extra income will be added to his savings to improve on the sources of income, targeting a bank agency business. 

He aspires to own other centers and pay for his child’s future education with much security.

loans.use: to increase till money and buy a stock of calling cards.

loans.name: Noel Alfredo

texts.es: Noel  vive en el cantón manta. Tiene 50años. Es soltera. Tiene hijos. El  toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  con los estudios de sus hijos  y Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. El decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio que es comidas rápidas   En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela Noel  trabaja  solo las mañana  y tardes  diariamente. Con el préstamo comprara ropa, materiales de cocina,, varios, etc. su meta es tener su propio negocio y construir su casa .
texts.en:
Noel lives in Manta canton. He is 50 years old, single, and has children. He made the decision to look for work so that his children could continue their education. As no one was giving him the opportunity to work at a company, he decided to raise money to open his business, which is cooking fast foods.
 
Currently his business has been growing gradually, to the point where it has a clientele. Noel works alone, mornings and evenings daily. With the loan he will buy clothing, kitchen supplies, and various other items. His goal is to have his own business and build his house.

loans.use: To buy flour, plates and various items.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Uranchimeg is 42 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ger, which is in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  Her husband, Sanjaagonchig, used to work in the United States and now works with his family in a private company as an engineer.  Her daughter, Sandanzul, is a 20-year-old university student.  Her son, Batjav, is a 17-year-old senior student in secondary school. 

Mrs. Uranchimeg has been running a retail business selling bags since 2006.  She is well experienced in the field and has built strong relationships with her customers and suppliers.  She imports bags from China and gets her inventory from the railway station by taxi or other transportation (paying higher market price).  She is now requesting 5,950,000 MNT to purchase an Eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car to reduce her transaction cost and to increase her income.  She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "My son will be university student next year and we need to save for his education as well as my daughter."

loans.use: to purchase an Eco-friendly car.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
This is Miguela, 26, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Bernardino, a vendor, and she is a mother to their child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Miguela operates a market stall. She sells various fruits and vegetables in the community market. She buys produce in large quantities and sells them per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales, every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business.  

Miguela hopes to have more stalls in the market one day, and dreams of giving her child a good and quality education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various fruits and vegetables to resell at her market stall.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
This is Dolores, a 65-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines.  She is a widow and a mother to her children.  She and her children are managing their household while operating the business.  She is working hard to provide income for her daily needs.

Dolores owns and oversees the operation of their jeepney transportation business (see footnote).  She has one jeepney (14-16 person capacity) which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP every day.  To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP.  She will be using the loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Dolores hopes to have good health and dreams of having a good life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

-Jeepneys are the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines.  They were originally made from US military jeeps left over from World War II and are known from their flamboyant decoration and crowded seating.  Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain.  They have become a ubiquitous symbol of Philippine culture. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Christian Wilmer

texts.es: Cristian  vive en el guamo. Tiene 29 años. Es casado  tiene  hijos  menores de edad  .El  Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para  darles los estudios a sus hijos    y  Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa.  decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio  de venta  de coco  .En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela  Cristian  trabaja en su negocio solo  diariamente. Con el préstamo  comprara una máquina para procesar el coco, varios, etc. su meta es poder comprarse una trici moto para ya no empujar triciclo
texts.en:
Christian lives in El Guamo. He is 29 years old, married, and has minor children. He made the decision to look for work so that could educate his children. As no one was giving him the opportunity to work at a company, he decided to raise money to open his business selling coconut. 

Presently, his business has been gradually growing, to the point where he has a regular clientele. Christian works at his business on his own, daily. 

With the loan, he will buy a machine for processing coconut and several other items. His goal is to be able to buy himself a motorized tricycle, so that he won't have to push his tricycle.

loans.use: To buy a machine for scraping coconut.

loans.name: Faustino Genaro

texts.es: Faustino  vive en el cantón libertad. Tiene 55 años. Es casado  tiene hijos mayores de edad  .El  Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para  salir adelante con su familia  y  Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa.  Decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio  de venta  de comida  .En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela. Faustino   trabaja en su negocio solo  diariamente. Con el préstamo  comprara alimentos, gasiosas, verduras  varios, etc. su meta es poder  tener su negocio propio y terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Faustino lives in Libertad Canton.  He is 55-years old, is married and has grown children.   Faustino made the decision to look for work to help his family get ahead.  Since no companies offered him employment, he decided to put together the money to start a business selling food.  Currently, his business is growing little by little, and he has a clientele.  Faustino works alone in his business every day.  With the loan, he will purchase food items, sodas and various vegetables etc.  His goal is to have his own business and to finish construction on his home.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, food items and vegetables.

loans.name: Urantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Urantuya is 25 years old and lives with her grandmother and brother in the Hentii province of Mongolia.  Her brother works in a local company as an assistant worker.  Her grandmother is disabled and stays home.  

Mrs. Urantuya has been running a clothing retail business in the local market since 2006.  She is well known by her customers because of her good taste in clothing selection.  She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation materials to insulate her Ger (nomadic tent) in order to stay warm during the winters of Mongolia.  She is a hardworking, kind, and optimistic person.

loans.use: to purchase insulation materials to insulate her ger (nomadic tent) in order to stay warm during the winters of Mongolia.

loans.name: Sambi Ternak Group

texts.en:
Having succeeded with their previous loan, the Sambi Ternak group receives their new loan with an increase in loan size. Now most of the group members already have sows. They need this new loan to purchase feed and superior piglets, and to renovate the animals' cages.

One group member, Ketut, is using her part of the loan to buy super-quality feed, to make her piglets grow fast, healthy and fat. Now she has one sow and three piglets. She hopes that after five months, she will be able to sell the piglets, and the sow will produce a new litter. Ketut's husband supports her business, because it can help their family's income.

One of the group's members resigned, because she has a new job at an office. She was replaced by a new member.

loans.use: to purchase super-quality pig feed.

loans.name: Wilmer Andres

texts.es: Wilmer   vive en el cantón libertad. Tiene 19años. Es casado  no tiene hijos. El  Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para  salir adelante con su familia  y  Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa.  Decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio  de venta  de ropa  .En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientes necesarios. Wilmer  trabaja en su negocio solo  diariamente. Con el préstamo  comprara pantalones , blusas, ropa de niño varios, etc. su meta es poder  tener su propio negocio comercial.
texts.en: Wilmer lives in Libertad Canton.  He is 19-years old, is married and has no children.  Wilmer decided to look for work to help his family get ahead.  Since no company offered him employment, he decided to put together the money to open his own business selling clothing.  His business is now growing bit by bit, and he has the necessary number of customers.  Wilmer works alone in his business every day.  With the loan, he will purchase pants, blouses, a variety of children's clothing etc.  Wilmer's goal is to have his own commercial business.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tables and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Yavuun-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Yavuun-Erdene is 24 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the Uvs province of Mongolia.  His wife, Enh-Amar, is an interior designer who works part-time at construction companies.  His daughter, Enh-Erdene, is a 3-year-old in the local kindergarten.

Mr. Yavuun-Erdene has been growing organic vegetables and fruits on his plot of land for years.  He is now preparing for plantation and requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase seeds, soil, and a few more fruit trees.  He is a hardworking and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, soils and a few more fruit trees for his business.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a 47-year-old, married woman, from Dauis, Bohol. She has six children. The eldest is 18 years old, while the youngest is 7. Benita is engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables. During her leisure time, she cooks home-made snack foods, like pancakes. She sells the snack foods to people in neighboring towns.

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase rice and soft drinks, for a start-up of a small store. She works hard for a living. 

Benita would like to invest in other business ventures, and to support the education of her growing children, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice and soft drinks, for a start-up of a small grocery store.

loans.name: Simon Bolivar

texts.es: Simón   vive en el cantón manta. Tiene 48 años. Es casado  Tiene hijos. el  Toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  con los estudios de sus hijos  y Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. El decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio que costuras  En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela simón trabaja  todos los días diariamente. Con el préstamo comprara, telas, hilos, varios, etc. su meta es tener su propio taller de costura  y  construir su casa .
texts.en: Simón lives in the canton of Manta. He is 48 years old. He is married and has children. He made the decision to look for work in order to continue his children's education and because how no one was giving him the opportunity to work for a company. He decided to raise money in order to open his sewing business. Presently, his business grew little by little until the point of having a customer base. Simón works every day. With this loan, he will buy fabrics, threads, etc. His goal is to have his own sewing workshop and build his home.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Judith Valentina

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer de 32 años, vive  en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Judith pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ciencias de la Comunicación, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Judith trabaja como promotora de ventas en una empresa de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Judith se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una moto lineal, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder transporte desde las lejanías de su hogar hasta el centro de ciudad, donde queda su trabajo, de esta manera Judith podrá ahorrar un poco de dinero, a fin de utilizarlo en un futuro no muy lejano para la compra de su casa propia.
texts.en:
Judith is 32 and lives in the city of Ica with her partner. She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person, who has a big desire to overcome. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Judith was able to study communication sciences. In her free time she likes to play sports and on some occasions she cooks a very delicious Carapulcra (Peruvian stew) to share with her family. 

By her own initiative, with much tenacity and dedication, Judith works as a saleswoman in a company in her city. She works every day starting at early hours in the morning and can do it for approximately 12 hours. She feels at ease doing her work and believes that it is going well for her due to her good performance and the kind way she treats others. 

Judith is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help provided she will be able to purchase a motorcycle, which will allow her to be able to have transportation from her home (which is in the distance) to the center of the city, where her work is. In this way, Judith will be able to save a bit of money, with the goal of using it in a future that is not very far away, for the purchase of her own house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 47-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines.  She is married to Domingo, a porter, and is a mother to her children.  She and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses, as they also manage their household.

Teresita buys and sells charcoal.  She buys large quantities of charcoal and then sells them per plastic or per sack.  She also has a food stall.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 550 PHP in sales every day.  To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan for 22,000 PHP.  She will be using the loan to buy more charcoal as well as different ingredients for her food stall.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. 

Teresita hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a better life.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and different ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Darma Sedana Group

texts.en:
The Darma Sedana group is receiving their fourth loan, with the same loan size and the same members as the previous loan. They need another loan for their businesses, because they have a strong will to become successful pig breeders. The group members will use the loan to improve their businesses, by purchasing superior piglets, or a sow.

One member, Ni Ketut, will use her part of the loan to buy three superior piglets. She has a plan to maintain them for fattening. She hopes MUK and Kiva will always support her and the group, not only for the loan but for training, also.

loans.use: To buy three superior piglets

loans.name: Ena Del Transito

texts.es: Ena vive junto a su esposo y un pequeño hijo quien es su fuerza para salir adelante.  Ella se dedica a la venta de cremas para el cabello y el cuerpo, cosméticos, perfumes, y otros más, así mismo vende productos de catálogos, los cuales día con día sale a vender de forma ambulante con vecinas, amigas, y otras personas que residen en la zona, con esto ella puede mejorar su economía en el hogar contando con todo lo necesario para vivir estables. Ena desea mucho mejorar su vivienda y así brindarle las condiciones óptimas a su hijo para que cuente con una vivienda segura. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda invertir en la mejora de su hogar, ampliándola para realizar una habitación más y así mismo para realizar reparaciones en el piso. Con esto Ena podrá vivir más tranquila y en mejores condiciones junto a su familia.
texts.en: Ena lives with her husband and her young son, who is her motivation for getting ahead. She makes a living by selling hair creams, body creams, cosmetics, perfumes, and other things. She also goes out day after day to sell products from catalogues to her neighbors, friends, and other people residing in the district. With this she can increase her home finances and have everything she needs to live a stable life. Ena greatly desires to improve her home in order to give her son the best conditions possible so he can have a safe home. She is requesting a loan from Integral, with which she will improve her home by widening it make another room and repairing the floor. In doing this, Ena will be able to live more peacefully and in better conditions with her family.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Tsagaan

texts.en: Mr. Tsagaan, 59 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife leads a construction executive team. His son recently began his career as a teacher at a private university. He has a vast amount of experience, 15 years, in the mining industry and sometimes gives consulting services to mining business entities. Three years ago, he shifted to the agricultural industry and holds the position of vice chairman at a private business entity. In 2001, he began building his two flat mansion and currently completed his first flat.. Due to lack of finances, the second flat and half story are not finished completely. So he is requesting a loan of 6,700,000 MNT to purchase insulation and construction materials at its low price period. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place because the unfinished second flat repair was the main cause of heat loss. The house was so vulnerable to storms and frost. More importantly, the family will burn less coal due to the insulation and they will contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase insulation and construction materials

loans.name: Italo Pedro

texts.es:
Italo es un hombre de 57 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su esposa y sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Italo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear con su esposa por la orilla de una playa cercana a su hogar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Italo se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde cultiva frejoles, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por los cuidados que le da a su cultivo.
Italo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, de esta manera Italo desea obtener una buena cosecha, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa en mejores condiciones que brinden mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Italo is a 57-year old man.  He lives in the city of Camaná with his wife and their children.  He loves his family, and they give meaning to his life.  Italo is a friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all his hard work toward getting his family ahead.  Unfortunately, due to his financial situation and his need to work, Italo wasn't able to study a profession.  But he would have liked very much to do so.  In his free time, Italo likes to walk with his wife on a beach near their home.  And sometimes he makes a delicious Arroz Chaufa (fried rice) to share with his family. 
Italo started farming on his own initiative.  He works with a lot of hard work and dedication.  He has a small plot of land on which he grows beans.  He works everyday for about ten hours, starting very early in the morning.  Italo feels happy doing his work and he believes that it is going well for him because of his experience and the care he gives to his crops. 
Italo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered, he will be able to purchase compost and fertilizer for his crops.  In this way, Italo hopes to get a better harvest.  He will continue working and putting forth the effort to make his greatest dream come true- to improve the condition of his house, which will offer his family improved security and well-being.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, en el distrito de Aguaytia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Rafael no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rafael se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde cultiva café, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los cuidados y el mantenimiento que le da a su cultivo.
Rafael se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, de esta manera Rafael espera obtener una buena cosecha, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa en mejores condiciones que brinden mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael is 44, and lives in the city of Pucallpa in Aguaytia district with his wife and three children, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly person; hard-working and enthusiastic, who with his wife devotes all his efforts to raising his family. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and the need to work to pay his expenses, Rafael was not able to complete his high school studies, but he would have very much liked to have done so. In his free time he likes to play football and sometimes cooks a very delicious "lomo saltado" (marinated strips of beef, stir-fried with vegetables) to share with his family. 

Through his own initiative and with a great deal of effort and dedication, Rafael works in agriculture. He has a small parcel of land where he grows coffee. He works every day from the early hours of the morning and can do so for approximately10 hours. He feels happy doing his work and believes it is going well because of the care and proper maintenance he gives his crop.

Rafael is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided, he will be able to buy manure and fertilizers for his crop. This way Rafael hopes to obtain a good harvest, so he will continue working and doing his best to achieve his great dream of having his home in better condition, that will offer greater safety and well-being to his family.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy root vegetables to sell

loans.name: David Edgardo

texts.es: David Edgardo de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él posee un taller de estructura metálica tiene  años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda y es un lugar muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque su trabajo es de calidad, a buenos precios, pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; David es un hombre trabajador, muy activo y con muchas metas que desea alcanzar día a día se esfuerza al máximo, es muy constante en sus objetivos pues sabe que solo así logrará el éxito, para el lo mas importante es la familia y su seguridad y trabaja duro para lograr su bienestar, en los últimos meses la vivienda ha tenido algunos deterioros y quiere darle mantenimiento y mejorarla con algunas divisiones internas pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, arena, herramienta etc. David Edgardo tiene buenas referencias de pago es responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: David Edgardo is 51-years old and lives with his life partner and their children in their own home.  He has had a metal frame-work workshop for many years.  His years of work have granted him a lot of experience and allowed him to improve his earnings.  His business is located in his home, which is in a busy area.  He has a lot of customers.  People prefer his business because of the quality of his work, his good prices and, above all, because of his excellent customer service.  David is a hard-working and very active man who has a lot of goals that he hopes to meet.  He puts forth the maximum effort day after day.  He is tenacious in his objectives, as he knows that is way to succeed.  For David, the most important things are his family and their safety.  He works hard to insure his family's well-being.  In the last months, their home has had some damage, and David wants to fix up his home and make some improvements with some internal divisions.  But he doesn't have sufficient capital.  And so he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that would enable him to purchase cement, bricks, sand, tools etc.  David Edgardo is a good credit risk, is responsible and is certain he will be able to settle his debt.  He has faith that he will give his family a full life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand and tools.

loans.name: Munkhtulga

texts.en: Mr. Munkhtulga, 41 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as a decorator at a private business entity. He has been working as a plumbing serviceman for four years at a water management agency. He has borrowed money from our organization several times and paid his debt always on time. He is one of our reliable clients. This time he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to build a barn, which will be joined with their main house. The barn he will build has the advantage of reducing heat loss through the house door. Most importantly, the family will burn less coal and this action will certainly contribute to the efforts against air pollution. Especially this year, when winter is becoming harsh and the family uses an electric heater to heat the house. This electric heater they use consumes a considerable amount of electricity so building the barn is his only solution to reducing heat loss through the door. In addition, the cost of purchasing construction materials is cheaper at this time.

loans.use: To build a barn

loans.name: Ilsy Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Ilsy Gabriela esta casada, tiene  24 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación secundaria, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, se dedica a la venta de tamales y bebidas, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus familiares, hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya en el mismo negocio.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de insumos necesarios para su venta, compra de maíz, carne, achote, hojas, arroz quebrado, azúcar, etc. Quiere administrar su negocio de la mejor manera, para que tenga buenas ganancias, y seguirá apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Ilsy Gabriela is married and 24-years old.  She completed secondary school.  She has two small children.  Señora Ilsy Gabriela makes her living selling tamales and beverages.  She was able to start her business thanks to the support of her family.  She now has three years of experience, and her husband helps her with the business. 

Señora Ilsy Gabriela is requesting a loan, which will help her to purchase the supplies she needs for her sales: corn, meat, seasonings, leaves, broken rice, sugar etc.  She wants to run her business in the best way possible so that she can earn a good living and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase tamale-making supplies and beverages.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis de treinta y uno años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia. Él se dedica al servicio de construcción, es un excelente albañil y tiene quince años en la labor, eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, sabe que es un negocio muy rentable y ya tiene mucha clientela, pues su trabajo es de primera calidad los precios por construcción muy accesibles y además con un servicio excelente, sus clientes siempre quedan satisfechos; José es un hombre honrado y muy trabajador, con muchos propósitos a futuro, piensa que para  tener éxito, debes saber qué estás haciendo, te debe gustar lo que estás haciendo y creer en lo que estás haciendo, el cree en su sueño de hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar herramientas de albañilería como pulidoras, cortadoras, sierra etc.. José Luis tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Luis is thirty-one years old and lives together with his family in their own house. He works in construction services; he is an excellent mason and has done this work for fifteen years. This has given him valuable experience that allows him to get better earnings. 

He knows that it’s a very profitable business. He has many customers because his work is of top quality, his construction prices very affordable and additionally come with excellent service. His customers are always satisfied.

José is an honest and very hardworking man with many goals for the future. He thinks that in order to be successful, you should know what you are doing, enjoy what you’re doing, and believe in what you do. He believes in his dream of making his business grow. 

Because of this, he is requesting a loan from Integral that allows him to buy masonry tools like power polishers, power saws, and hand saws, etc. José Luis has good payment references and irreproachable morals. He assures that he will be able to pay off the debt; at the same time, he has the hope that in this way, he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase power polishers, power saws, and hand saws.

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS SOLIDARIAS”  iniciará octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Clotilde es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de chambritas, comercio de comida, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Clotilde es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de prendas que viene trabajando hace años atrás; esta técnica la aprendió en un curso técnico  que optó aprender, posteriormente este conocimiento lo volvió un oficio para generar recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos económicos para apoyar a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Solidarias" will begin their eighth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Pan American Regional Hub. It is formed by eight members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Clotilde is Treasurer. The businesses which the members carry out are varied, including: making crocheted baby clothes, selling food, and selling vegetables. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small microbusinesses of which Clotilde is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer four years ago through the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a garment-sewing business which she has had for four years; sewing is a skill she learnt in a technical course which she opted to take, and subsequently this knowledge gave her a way of generating income. The loan she is taking out is to increase capital (purchasing fabric), which she will obtain wholesale from the fairs in the city of El Alto and use to make garments to sell. This work allows her to generate income to support her family since she lives in a civil union and has a son.

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she liked its healthcare services.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Olivia Guadalupe

texts.es: Olivia Guadalupe vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad , arroz, frijoles, leche, pan, huevos, entre otros, además para complementar los gastos del hogar vende ollas de aluminio y de barro, ya tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite conseguir con las ventas las mejores ganancias, es muy conocida en la zona pues la tienda esta bien surtida y siempre satisface a su clientela, además los productos que comercia son de primera calidad y los vende a precios accesibles; Olivia es una mujer emprendedora muy honrada y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante, piensa que nunca hay que desistir de un sueño, sólo tratar de ver las señales que te lleven a él, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, productos instantáneos, bebidas, ollas de barro y aluminio etc. Olivia Guadalupe tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Olivia Guadalupe lives with her life companion and their children in their own house. She has a store where she sells basic necessities: rice, beans, milk, bread, and eggs, among other items. In addition, to supplement the household expenses, she sells aluminum and clay pots. She has already been in this business for a number of years, and this has given her valuable experience that allows her to obtain the best earnings from her sales. She is very well known in the district, since the store is well stocked and she always satisfies her customers. In addition, the products that she sells are of first quality, and she sells them at affordable prices. Olivia is an entrepreneurial woman, very honest, and with great enthusiasm for advancing. She thinks that it is never necessary to abandon a dream, one should only try to see the signs that bring you to it. This is how she decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy basic foodstuffs, candies, instant products, beverages, clay and aluminum pots, etc. for her store. Olivia Guadalupe has good payment references and impeccable ethics. She affirms that she will pay off the debt in the established time period, and she has confidence that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs, candies, beverages, and clay and aluminum pots for her store

loans.name: Lidia Inés

texts.es: Lidia Inés  de 40 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo e hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio de tienda y venta de productos por catálogo desde hace varios años. La tienda está ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual ha adecuado y surtido de tal forma que sus clientes estén satisfechos al siempre encontrar lo que buscan. Lidia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora ya que en sus negocios siempre pone todo su empeño para darles el mejor servicio y productos a su fiel clientela, la cual siempre la busca por su honradez y dedicación. Ella tiene un sueño y es el de darle a sus hijos una buena educación y así asegurarles un buen futuro, Lidia sabe que esto lo podrá conseguir solo si invierte en más productos para surtir su tienda y actualizando sus catálogos de productos para dar siempre lo más novedoso y nuevo para sus clientes, es por estas razones que decidió solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder lograr sus objetivos y surtir su tienda con productos tales como: aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, bebidas, macarrones, etc. ya que desea cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado que le permita incrementar sus ingresos de tal forma que pueda ofrecer a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en: Lidia Inés is 40, and lives in her own house with her husband and children. She works in a store and has been selling products by catalogue for the past few years. The store is located in her house, which she has adjusted and furnished in such a way that her customers are satisfied when they always find what they are looking for. Lidia is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman, and in her business she always puts all of her effort to give the best service and products to her loyal clientele, which always looks for her due to her honesty and dedication. She has a dream and it is to give her children a good education and in that way assure them a good future. Lidia knows that she will be able to get this only if she invests in more products to stock her store and receive the most current catalogs of products in order to always give the most original and new things to her customers. It is due to these reasons that she decided to apply for a loan from INTEGRAL in order to be able to achieve her objectives and stock her store with products like: oil, rice, sugar, beans, candy, drinks, noodles, etc. She wants to cover a bigger demand of the market which will allow her to increase her income. In that way she will be able to offer better opportunities in life to her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, beans, candy, drinks, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra lives in the Philippines.  As a married mother of two children, Pedra works hard to support her family.  

She has a food vending business and also earns additional income from her general store. Pedra is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. Pedra has been sustaining her business activities through her previous two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Imenye Group

texts.fr:
Eliane fait partie du groupe Imenye et   habite à Gitega. Elle a 28 ans et est mariée à Schadrack, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés de 4 mois à 7 ans,  dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce  de poules    depuis 3 mois. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de poules  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait que ses enfants continuent les études et aient une bonne santé.
texts.en:
Eliane is a member of the Imenye group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 28 years old and married to Schadrack, a driver.  Together, they have three children, ranging in ages between 4 months and 7 years.  Two of their children are in school.

Eliane has been selling hens for three months.

This is her sixth loan with Turame.  With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy many hens for resale, in order to make more money.

In the coming years, she would like her children to keep on going to school and be healthy.

loans.use: to buy a large number of hens for resale, in order to increase her capital and make more money.

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es: José Salvador vive en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Él es una persona trabajadora, honrada y emprendedora que se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de muebles y electrodomésticos, negocio en el cual tiene ya mucha experiencia por lo que es muy buscado en su zona por la calidad y durabilidad de los productos. El  negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia ya que este es su única fuente de ingresos y es de esta manera que se gana la vida y lleva el sustento para su familia. José tiene el sueño de darles una educación a sus hijos para darles un mejor futuro y una mejor calidad de vida, es por esta razón que quiere invertir en su negocio e incrementar el catálogo de productos que elabora y comercializa, el invertirá en la compra de materiales como hierro, electrodos, discos de pulir y electrodomésticos ya elaborados para su comercialización y sabe que la única manera de conseguirlo es solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder llevar acabo sus propósitos. José confía en que con la ayuda de este crédito podrá estar un paso más cerca de su sueño y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Salvador lives in his own house with his wife and children. He is a hard-working person, honest and entrepreneurial, who works in making and selling furniture and household appliances, a business in which he already has a lot of experience. For this reason, he is much sought after in his district for the quality and durability of his products. His business is located in his place of residence, since this is his only source of income, and it is in this way that he earns a living and brings sustenance to his family. José has a dream of giving his children an education in order to give them a better future and a better quality of life. It is for this reason that he wants to invest in his business and expand the catalog of products that he makes and sells.
