He will invest in the purchase of materials such as iron, electrodes, polishing disks, and manufactured household appliances to sell, and he knows that the only way to do this is to apply for a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to accomplish his goals. José has confidence that with the help of this loan he will be able to be one step closer to his dream and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: compra de materiales como hierro, electrodos, discos de pulir y electrodomésticos

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Altantsetseg is a 48-year-old widow who lives with her daughter and grandson in a small house in the Dornogovi province of Mongolia. Her daughter Ariuntuya works in a local private company as an assistant manager. Her grandson goes to a local kindergarten. The borrower has been running her grocery store in the spare room of her house. She started selling organic dairy products and vegetables in her store and now needs an extra investment of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products and vegetables for her grocery store. She is a hardworking, diligent and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products and vegetables for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana Gladis de 40 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos mayores de edad y sus hermanos y sus cuñadas. Es una mujer muy trabajadora., honesta y responsable con sus que haceres diarios, es amable y muy emprendedora ya que siempre ha querido darle un buen ejemplo a sus hijos. Ana posee un pequeño negocio donde vende pupusas es así como ella se gana la vida honradamente y se caracteriza por ser amable con los clientes que la premian dándole su preferencia. Ella desea comprar insumos y materiales para que su negocio crezca es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para la solicitar un crédito y comprar: Maíz, Frijol, Arroz, Queso, Ayote,  Tomates, Repollo, entre otros. Espera recibir la ayuda ya que confía en Dios que su negocio crecerá un poco y así podrá seguir satisfacción las necesidades de su humilde hogar.
texts.en: Ana Gladis is 40 years old. She lives with her two adult children and her brothers and her sisters-in-law. She is a very hard-working woman, honest and responsible with her daily tasks. She is friendly and very entrepreneurial, since she has always wanted to give a good example to her children. Ana has a little business where she sells pupusas [thick, stuffed corn tortillas, a typical Salvadoran food]. This is how she earns an honest living, and she is known for being kind to her customers, who reward her by giving her their business. She wants to buy supplies and ingredients so that her business can grow. This is why she came to INTEGRAL, to apply for a loan and buy corn, beans, rice, cheese, squash, tomatoes, and cabbage, among other items. She hopes to receive the help, since she trusts in God that her business will grow a little and thus she will be able to continue satisfying the needs of her humble household.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, cheese, squash, tomatoes, and cabbage, among other items

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Quy was born in 1966. She has two daughters who have gotten married. Her husband is a worker. Quy raises pigs to earn a living. Her income is about 2,500,000 dong [VND]. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,500,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy food for pigs. She wants to use the profit to buy some new furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin was born in 1972. She has two children. Her son is a worker. Her daughter has gotten married. Her husband is a security man. She raises pigs and chickens to earn a living. She has been doing this job for three years. She gets 2,500,000 VND a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 
	
Chin has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy food for her chickens and pigs. Her dream is to let her children have good careers and expand her animal farm.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase apples, grapes, pears, bananas, mangoes, etc.

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталий уже 11 лет занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Приветное. У него есть 45 соток своей земли и еще он дополнительно арендует 90 соток, на которых выращивает ранние помидоры, капусту, лук, перец. После высадки рассады в грунт, он в теплицах выращивает раннюю капусту. 
Виталию нужна сумма в 12 000 гривен на нужды тепличного хозяйства, а именно для того, чтобы закупить всё необходимое для нового сезона, а именно семена, пленку, удобрения, а также успеть реконструировать теплицу до начала посева. Виталий подготавливает теплицы и грунт, чтобы заработать деньги в сезон и обеспечить нужды своей семьи и бизнеса.
texts.en:
Vitaliy has been involved in agriculture in the village of Privetnoye for the past 11 years.  He owns 4,500 square meters of land (1.1 acre) and rents an additional 9,0000 square meters (2.2 acres), on which he grows early tomatoes, cabbage, onions and peppers.  He grows early cabbage in greenhouses after transplanting seedlings in the ground.

Vitaliy needs 12,000 hryvnia for his greenhouse business.  He specifically needs to buy all the necessities for the new season: seeds, plastic sheeting, fertilizers.  He also needs to rebuild a greenhouse on time, before the start of the sowing season.  Vitaliy is preparing his greenhouses and his soil, so that he will make enough money this season and meet the needs of his family and of his business.

loans.use: to buy all necessities for the new season, particularly seeds, plastic sheeting, fertilizers; also to rebuild a greenhouse on time, before the beginning of the sowing season.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna de 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como motorista y junto a su hijo quien se dedica a estudiar. Reyna es una madre de familia quien se dedica de lleno a su hogar y al bienestar de su familia, razón por la que posee su propio negocio con el cual pueda ayudarle a su esposo con todos los gastos. Reyna se dedica a la venta de pollo y verduras en el mercado regional del lugar en que reside, ella es muy esmerada y trabajadora y desea mucho mejorar su venta. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL con el cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de pollos y así mismo más variedad y cantidad de verduras con las cuales pueda atender a más clientes y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Reyna is 36 years old.  She lives with her husband, who works as a driver and with her son, who is in school.  Reyna is a mother who works very hard in her home and for the wellbeing of her family.  For this reason she has her own business with which she can help her husband with all of the expenses.  Reyna sells chicken and vegetables in the regional market near where she lives.  She is very conscientious and hard-working and would like to improve her sales.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL with which she can count on the money necessary to buy more chicken and a better variety and quantity of vegetables with which to serve her clients and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Prosperidad

texts.en:
Prosperidad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a water refilling station business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to buy empty gallons for her water refilling station business.

Prosperidad has been in this business for seven years. She also earns more income from a restaurant.

Prosperidad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy water containers

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An was born in 1979. She has two children who are studying at the 4th grade and the 7th grade. Her husband is a ferryman. His income is about 4,000,000 VND. An sells vegetables to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this work for five years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. 

An has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy more vegetables to sell. She always wants to use the profit to buy some new furniture for her house and raise her children to grow up well.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is married and works hard to support her family.  She has a business selling personal products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a variety store. Rachel is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more personal products to sell to her customers.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy personal products to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 49 years old and married with three children.  She works very hard to provide for them.  

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Emma has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soap, noodles, softdrinks and other groceries. 

In the future Emma would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela is 43 years old and married with eight children, five of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Fidela runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Fidela has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as bread, cooking oil, eggs and other groceries. 

In the future Fidela would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 28 years old, married and has one child.  She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Joy requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 46 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Letecia has a business selling coconut in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coconut to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to buy a vehicle for her business.

loans.use: buy coconut to sell

loans.name: Lornita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Lornita works hard to support her family.  She has a buy & sell coffee business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Lornita is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy additional coffee to sell in her buy & sell coffee business.

Lornita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy coffee to resell

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en: Rosenie works hard to support her family. She is single and has a variety store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell. Rosenie has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. In the future, Rosenie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 35 years old and has four children. Teresita is married and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Teresita has been in the pig fattening business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en: Amada is a 62-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in the rice farming business for several years together with her husband. This is the source of their income. Amada is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, they will be able to improve their harvest. In the future, Amada hopes to make their farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: As a married parent of seven children, Aida works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Aida is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business. Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en: Vergie is 39 years old and married with three children who are in school. Vergie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, eggs, noodles, etc. Vergie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Vergie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 56 years old and married with five children.

Elenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell.

Elenita has borrowed and paid back 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Elenita aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Humaira's Group

texts.en:
Humaira is 32 years old, and a very hardworking and decent lady. She lives in Rawalapindi, Pakistan, with her family. 
Her husband is a railway employer. Humaira has 3 daughters. 

For the past few years Humaira has been providing knitting services in her community. Currently she is in need of purchasing knitting materials like crochet hooks, knitting needles and wool to grow her business. But due to lack of finance she finds it difficult.

For that Humaira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her business and her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase knitting materials like crochet hooks, knitting needles, yarn, and wool for her knitting business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 66 years old and married with five children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid back 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Rosalinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsieta

texts.en:
Elsieta is a 38-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a farming business, together with her husband, for more than 10 years now. Elsieta hopes of expanding their farming business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Elsieta is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, they will be able to improve their farming business as well as their harvest.
Elsieta hopes of making their business sustainable and a success.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 43 years old and married with 2 children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell feed business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

Elvira has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell feed business for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elvira aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard is 38 years old and from Ndunyu Njeru. He has four children who are between ages one and 14 years old.

Bernard is a farmer and has been farming for the last 13 years. He has applied for his sixth loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on his farm.

He hopes to educate his children to university level in the future, and to expand his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on his farm.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 36 years old and is married, with five children who are in school. Hannah is a farmer and has been in this business for the past seven years. 

She has applied for her second loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her buy farm inputs and fertilizers for use on her farm.

She hopes to be a leading farmer in her area, and to be able to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizers for use on her farm.

loans.name: Romana's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Romana is 38 years old and a very hardworking woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her parents. 

For the past few years, she has been operating a tailoring business. She needs additional capital to grow her business and purchase tailoring materials like a sewing machine, reels of thread, and needles. Due to lack of finances, she finds it difficult.

Therefore, as member of a 5-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's Partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will help her to increase her net income and savings. 

She is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials like a sewing machine, reels of thread, and needles.

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es: Ana Deysi de 47 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos  y un nieto, los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que hace todo lo que este a su alcance para darles lo necesario. Ella se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de variedad de pan dulce y francés.  Tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y con algunos clientes fijos los cuales cada día la prefieren más. La ubicación del negocio es bastante estratégico además vale la pena mencionar que no existe mucha competencia,  razón por la cual es  una de las más preferidas de la zona en cuanto a venta de pan. Su sueño ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones a las que ella ha tenido por lo que cada día se levanta muy temprano para poder sacar los ingresos necesarios para llevar a su casa el pan de cada día y además desea mantener activo su negocio por mucho más tiempo ya que este es su principal fuente de ingresos.  En base a lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito ya que desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como:  harina, azúcar, leche, margarina, etc. Para la elaboración del delicioso  pan. Todo esto  lo hace con el objetivo de seguir manteniendo su negocio activo y dando el mejor servicio posible ya que piensa que solo de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Ana Deysi is 47 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and children and one grandchild, all of whom are studying.  For Ana Deysi, her family is the most important thing and it is for them that she does everything she can to provide them with necessities.  For a living, Ana Deysi produces and sells a variety of sweet and French breads.  She has been doing this for some years and so has a lot of experience and some regular customers who come to her every day.  She has a strategic location for the business and it is also worth mentioning that she there is not much competition.  As a result, Ana Deysi is one of the most popular sellers of bread in the area.  Her dream is for her children to have a better life than she has had.  Every day she wakes up early to earn the necessary money to bring her daily bread home and she wants to keep her business going for a long time as it is her principal source of income.  So, to do this, Ana Deysi took the decision to approach Integral for a loan as she would like to invest in her business by buying necessary supplies such as flour, sugar, milk, margarine and more in order to make her delicious bread.  She does all this with the aim of continuing to keep her business alive and to give the best possible service.  She believes that only by doing this will she manage to realise her dream of giving her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary supplies such as flour, sugar, milk, margarine and so on.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María de 34 años de edad habita en casa propia junto con sus dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. María  posee una tiendita en la cual vende diversidad de artículos tales como: arroz, frijoles, golosinas,  azúcar, aceite, detergente, etc. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación a logrado mantenerlo activo por todo este tiempo. Ella se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedor y responsable ya que las metas que se propone siempre las alcanza con mucho éxito. Su sueño es ver su negocio florecer y lograr mejorar sus ingresos con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. De acuerdo a lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeña tiendita en la compra de mercadería  como: Huevos, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, detergente, café, leche, etc. De tal forma que su tienda siempre tenga todo lo que los clientes buscan y así poder alcanzar su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Confía en Dios que así será.
texts.en: Thirty-four year old María has her own home where she lives with her two children, both of whom are studying.  María has a small shop where she sells a variety of items such as rice, beans, candy, sugar, oil, detergent and so on.  She has been doing this for some years and, thanks to God and her determination, she has managed to keep it going for all this time.  María is very hard-working and, above all, very enterprising and responsible.  She achieves all her goals.  Her dream is for her business to flourish and to increase her income, so she can improve her and her family's quality of life.  With this in mind, she has applied for a loan from Integral to invest in her small store by buying merchandise such as eggs, sugar, rice, beans, detergent, coffee, milk and more.  As long as her shop always stocks what her customers are looking for, María will be able to achieve her dream of improving her and her family's living conditions.  She trusts in God that this will happen.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as eggs, sugar, rice, beans, coffee, milk and more.

loans.name: Santos Isidra

texts.es: Santos de 53 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde ya hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tamales en la zona que reside. Santos por su gran experiencia en la elaboración de tamales cuenta con una gran y fiel clientela que siempre está a la espera de sus productos. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que tiene como sueño aportar en los ingresos de su familia para mejorar su calidad de vida ya que los de su esposo no alcanzan para satisfacer todas las necesidades de su hogar. Santos necesita invertir en la compra de más materiales para la elaboración de tamales, como son: elotes, manteca, azúcar, Peroles etc. y así incrementar su productividad y por ende sus ingresos, es por eso que se acercó a una agencia de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito que le ayude a la compra de los materiales y estar así cada vez más cerca de cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Santos is 53 years old and lives in her own house with her family.  For some years she has worked producing and selling tamales (a corn-based food) in the area where she lives.  With a lot of experience producing tamales, Santos now has a large and loyal customer base that always comes back for her products.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman, with a dream of bringing home an income to her family in order to improve their living conditions.  Her husband's income is not enough to cover household costs.  Santos needs to invest in buying more materials to make tamales, such as corn, lard, sugar, pots, etc. so as to increase her productivity and, eventually, her income.  It is for this reason that she has come to Integral.  She is applying for a loan that will help her to buy these materials and to move ever closer to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making tamales, such as corn, lard, sugar, pots, etc.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: María Ángela de 57 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con una sobrina, Ya que ella hace un tiempo se quedó viuda y le ha tocado ser una mujer fuerte desde siempre ha trabajado y ha sido responsable y emprendedora. María tiene un pequeño negocio de corte y perfección ubicada en su casa  siempre ha trabajado con lo que más le gusta y se caracteriza por ser amable con los clientes que la prefieren. María desea comprar materiales para surtir su taller de costura es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de telas, agujas, tijeras, entre otros. Espera contar con la ayuda ya que necesita comprarlo porque no posee materiales y lo poco que tiene se le está arruinando porque ya necesitan cambio.
texts.en: María Ángela is 57 years old. She lives in a home she owns with a niece. She was widowed some time ago and had to be strong. She has always worked and been responsible and enterprising. María has a small sewing business located in her house. She has always worked doing what she likes the most. She is described as friendly and  thats why her customers prefer her. María wants to buy materials to stock her sewing workshop and that is why she has asked INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fabrics, needles, scissors and more. She hopes to have your help because she needs to purchase these items because she lacks materials. What little she has is deteriorating and she needs to change them.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, needles, scissors and more.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario de 44 años de edad, vive junto a su grupo familiar su esposo y sus hijos es un hombre muy responsable honesto y sincero que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser ese hombre de hogar y le da lo mejor a sus hijos, esperando que el día de mañana ellos vean el esfuerzo realizado por su padre. Actualmente Mario vende pescado es desde hace un tiempo sale por las mañanas con su lancha a realizar la pesca es así como se gana la vida honradamente su mayor sueño es seguir satisfacción las necesidades de sus hijos es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de materiales como guacales, basculas, y detalles para arreglar su lancha así como también comprar pescado de uno que no puede obtener por su propia cuenta. Espera contar con la ayuda que necesita y agradece a Dios que jamás este lo ha dejado solo y ha estado cuando más lo necesita.
texts.en: Mario is 44 years old. He lives with his family, his wife and children. He is a very responsible, honest and sincere man who always has been described as a husband and father who gives his best to his children. He hopes that tomorrow they will see the effort their father has made. Right now, Mario sells fish. He has done this for some time. He goes out in the morning with his boat to fish and that is how he earns his living in an honorable way. His biggest dream is to keep fulfilling his children's needs. That is why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy materials such as crates, scales, and items to fix his boat as well as fish that he can't get on his own. He hopes to have your help, which he needs, and he is grateful to God, who has never left him alone and has been there when he needs it the most.

loans.use: to buy materials such as crates, scales, and items to fix his boat as well as to buy fish that he can't obtain on his own.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en:
Benedicto is a married man with 4 children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been operating a local brew business for four years. He also has cattle and he sells milk to supplement his income. He dreams of buying a lorry to help him in the transportation of brew and produce to neighboring markets.

Despite being an illiterate himself, because his parents could not afford his education, he dreams of educating his children to the University level. Inadequate capital is affecting his business growth and a major challenge Benedicto is requesting a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy  local brew to sell.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith, aged 44, is a married woman with five children aged 6 to 19, who are in school.  She owns a poultry farm in the town of Kagadi, Uganda that she started from farming proceeds.  She describes herself as hardworking and has dream of having a wholesale shop in future , educating all her children to University level and expanding her poultry farm.  Faith intends to use the loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Jasiri Group

texts.en:
Anna who is in her late 30s, is married with three daughters who go to school.  She has been running a business of selling food for two years. She works from 6.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Anna's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the food stock, pay school fees, buy a DVD player, a plot of land for agriculture (maize, sunflower), for household expenses and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy farming equipment and a fridge for the cafe drinks.  Her dream is to be able to build her own house some day.

Anna will share this loan with her loan group "Jasiri" which has 14 members, who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment and a fridge for the cafe drinks.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 48 year old married woman and a mother of three children. They live in Bohol, a province in the Philippines. Esterlita and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for more than 15 years. She is also engaged in dried fish making and vending.

Esterlita works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to catch more fish, giving them more fish to sell and dry.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fuel for the boat

loans.name: Buyuni Tazara Group

texts.en:
Sasha, a single woman in her late 20s, has a boy who goes to school. She has been running a clothes business for 4 years. She works from 8.00 am. to 6.00 pm. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Sasha's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the clothing stock for her business and cover the household expenses and has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for this second loan to further increase her clothing stock. Her dream is to became a famous business woman some day.

Sasha will share this loan with her loan group "BUYUNI", which has 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock of clothes for her business .

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en:
Zaverio is a 27 year old married man with three children aged between 4 and 8, living in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his passion for a better future, he started a produce business two years ago. He still does farming to supplement his produce business.

He dreams of educating his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification. Weather and bad roads affect his business while his dream is to own a sustainable food store that can supply his customers all year round. Zaverio intends to use the loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn is 29 years old and single. She is from Mitimos, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She has 1 child who helps her in taking care of their bananas. They have been growing bananas for 4 years and earn 3,000 a month.

In 2011, Nelyn joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase fertilizer, and for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and cover weeding costs.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia has been earning a living through her sari-sari, or variety store business, for more than twenty years.  She is requesting another loan to buy more stock to sell - like canned goods, candy, bread, snack food, soda, beverages, soap etc.  With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers and customers to her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candy, bread, snack foods, beverages and soap for sale at her store

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en:
Leopoldo is married with 3 children. He is 61 years old and lives in Sapang Dalaga. Leopoldo operates a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members. He has been doing this for 3 years and every month he earns 5,000.00 from this work.

He has requested a loan of 10,000.00 to purchase new items to expand his product offering. In 2012, Leopoldo joined GDMPC. He hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 38 year old married man with five children who are all in school.  He has been operating a produce business in Kagadi Uganda since  2011.  He began this business to generate income to help meet his family's needs.  

Simon intends to use the  loan to buy beans and cassava to sell.  Inadequate capital is a challenge and affects the growth of his business.  In future, he would like to buy a vehicle to help him transport goods to different markets.

loans.use: to buy beans and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Jim

texts.en:
Jim is married with 1 child. he is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Jim is operating a business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years, and every month he earns 8,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Jim been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Jim hopes to gain a double income from his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn's main source of income comes from providing charcoal to members of her local community. She is 32 years old, married and has five children. She is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, in the Philippines. Jocelyn been in her business for nine years and earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase coconut shells for making more charcoal. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia is a farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol, in the Philippines. She has been farming rice and vegetables for more than five years now, together with her husband. Gorgonia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, the couple will be able to improve their farm and harvest.
In the future, Gorgonia hopes to make her farming business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and for the renovation of her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe JIGUIYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39  ans,  4 enfants et qui vivent dans des  familles polygamiques à SIEKOURANI un des villages de la commune de Loulouni cercle de Kadiolo. 
Elles sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
MARIAM assise 1ère à droite fait l’achat vente des fruits et légumes entre Siekourani, Kadiolo et Loulouni dans ce groupe de femmes. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  des paniers de tomate fraiche, de choux et de bananes. Elle s’approvisionne Siékourani et dans les villages environnants auprès des producteurs. 
Elle vend aux  abords du goudron à Siékourani tous les jours et surtout le jour de foire à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The JIGUIYA group is made up of four married women. They have an average age of 39 years and an average of four children each. The women live in polygamous families in SIEKOURANI, a village in the commune of Loulouni in the cercle of Kadiolo. They are on their 22nd loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy their customers' needs. All of their previous loans were correctly repaid.

MARIAM (sitting, far right) is a member of the JIGUIYA group, and she buys and sells fruits and vegetables in Siekourani, Kadiolo, and Loulouni. She plans to use her loan to buy baskets of fresh tomatoes, cabbage, and bananas. She buys her goods from producers in Siékourani and in the surrounding villages. She sells her goods along the side of the road in Siékourani every day (and especially on the day of the fair) for cash to a clientele made up of both men and women.

She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA, part of which she will use to pay the interest on the loan and the rest of which she will save.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: For the past 3 years, Rosela has been selling baked snack food in her local community for her living. Rosela is 45 years old and married with three children. She is from Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She earns 10,000 PHP a month from her work and joined GDMPC in 2010. Rosela is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make products to sell. She plans to use the income generated from her loan to expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make products to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 47, is a business lady who earns a living by making and selling soap. She is a widow and has two children. She has been in business for the past ten years. She is very hardworking and describes her business as being very busy. Faulu Kenya has helped her become financially stable.
She dreams of expanding her business. She is requesting a loan of 42,727.50 KES to buy chemicals for making soap.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for making soap.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is married and has three children. He is 38 years old and lives in Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Richard runs a rice retailing business to earn a living. He has been doing this for 11 years and every month he earns 14,000 PHP. He has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional rice to retail. In 2011, Richard joined GDMPC. Richard hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, 42, is from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with five children who are aged between 3 and 17 years old.

Francis has been a farmer for the past 12 years. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy seeds and fertilizer to use on his farm.

He hopes to expand his business and educate his children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Lagunita Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Laguanita Poty está en su tercer ciclo, tiene once integrantes, todas ellas amigas y vecinas. Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Elva, quien se dedica a la costura.
Elva es una mujer muy trabajadora y es muy conocida en el barrio ya que hace muy buenos trabajos, tiene también muy buena clientela y está creciendo mucho gracias al esfuerzo que está haciendo. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, ya que quiere seguir trabajando y poder cumplir con pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The Laguainta Poty communal bank is in its third cycle.  It has 11 members, and they are all friends and neighbors.  Elva is one of these women, and she is a seamstress.

Elva is a very hard-working woman.  She is very well-known in the neighborhood because she does very good work.  She also has a very good clientele, and she is growing a lot thanks to the effort she is making.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fabric and thread.  She wants to continue working and to be able to complete the orders that she has.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
Saad is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and a father of two children. Saad is the only provider for the family.

Saad owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2009. He has built a good reputation among his neighbors in the area.

He is requesting a sum of $2,400 to make a display window for his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to make a display window for his grocery store.

loans.name: Rizabel

texts.en: Rizabel, 23, is married and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran together with her four children. Rizabel manages a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and she earns 3,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, and soap. She joined GDMPC last 2012. Rizabel wishes that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, and soap.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en: Lia is 47 years old. She lives with her husband in Khoni district, West Georgia. The family runs agricultural business. In particular, they have a pig and 0.4 hectares of agricultural land, where they grow maize. Besides, they sow tomatoes and cucumbers seasonally. They sell the harvested products locally in an open market at a good price. Lia is a very hard working woman and does her best to ensure in a good harvest. She requested a loan to purchase pigs. After purchasing additional pigs, she will be able to expand her livestock. This will increase the income of her family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Wathek

texts.en:
Wathek is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and a father of 3 children. Wathek is the only provider for the family.

Wathek is a barber. He established his business in 2008. He has gained much experience in his profession and has a stellar reputation in his community. 

He is requesting a loan of $1,500 to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Mary Glenn

texts.en: Mary Glenn is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran. She is 41 years old. Mary Glenn is married and has 2 children. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns about 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. Just recently, she joined GDMPC. Mary Glenn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Mercideta

texts.en: Mercideta is married and has three children. She is 33 years old and resides in Camanga, Tukuran, Philippines. Mercideta owns farm land and cultivates rice for a living. She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 25,000 PHP doing this type of business. Mercideta requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. In 2011, she joined GDMPC. In the future, Mercideta wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, 41, is from Nyahururu and is married with two children who are between 1 and 10 years old.

Francis has been operating a butchery business for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy sheep and goats to be slaughtered in the butchery. 

Francis is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.He hopes to see his business expand and create job opportunities by employing someone to help him.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very hardworking and ambitious lady. She is 34 years old and has been blessed with one child. She is in the business of selling fish and has been in business for four years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money and her business has improved.

Someday she hopes to buy a piece of land and be rich. She requires a loan of 84,442.50 to buy fish.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Fulgencio

texts.es:
El Sr. Fulgencio tiene una Despensa que también tiene Mercería, se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 15 años, según cuenta el Sr. Fulgencio tiene muy buena clientela ya que tiene todo tipo de productos y eso es lo que la gente busca hoy en día.
Él es muy emprendedor, cuenta que le gusta mucho ayudarles a las personas más necesitadas, y que su objetivo es agrandar su local y así dar fuente de trabajo a más personas.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de verduras, hortalizas, leche y demás productos para poder surtir su despensa y seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fulgencio has a general store, and he has devoted himself to this business activity for over 15 years.  According to Fulgencio, he has a very good clientele.  This is because he has all types of products, and this is what the people look for nowadays.

He is very enterprising, and he says he really likes to help the people most in need.  His objective is to enlarge his place.  This way he will be a source of work for more people.

He is requesting the loan to buy vegetables, milk, and other products.  He will do this in order to be able to stock his store and to continue offering his customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Militar, Tukuran, where she sells home use products, which she has been doing for two years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month.

Veronica is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She joined GDMPC in 2012 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 50-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has two children ages 16 and 17 years old respectively.

She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for two years. On the other hand, her husband is a motorcycle driver, but his income is not enough to finance the family's daily needs.

She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase more piglets, feeds and pig supplements to produce healthy pigs. In the future, Corazon would like to expand her business to have additional income for a sustainable livelihood and so she could be able to send her children for a college education for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and pig supplement

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Lolita is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is married with 5 children. Bernadette is 25 years old and resides in Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Bernadette manages a poultry business for their living. She's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 13,000 PHP doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase breeding livestock and feeds. Bernadette joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Bernadette hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock and feeds

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is married and has three children. She used her previous loan to buy carpets, mats and fabric for resale. She is in the business of weaving and has been in business for the past five years. She is very hard working.
 
Someday she hopes to open other outlets. She requests a loan of 63,585 KES to buy a spinning machine.

loans.use: to buy a spinning machine

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 56 years old, married, and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She earns additional income as a fish pond operator and from an electronic re-loading business. 

Ma. Fe is requesting her eleventh loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, soap, and shampoo.  Ma. Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en: Jeremias is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for several years now. Jeremias is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and buckets. With this loan, he will be able to improve his daily catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Jeremias hopes to make his fishing business grow and become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 33 years old, single, and lives with his mother and brother.  He is from Khoni district. The family is involved in the agricultural business. Zaza runs a small dairy farm. He has five milk cows, with the milk used for cheese products, which are sold at the local open market. He also has two pigs and sells piglets locally. The family grows tomatoes in the greenhouse and sells the harvested products to vegetable retailers. Zaza does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. 

Zaza is requesting a loan, which he will use to renovate his house. The existing house is old and damaged. Zaza will purchase building materials and repair it. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old. Adelina is married and has four children. To make a living, Adelina has run a general store for 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for these activities. 

Adelina is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. In 2011, Adelina joined GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is 45 years old. He lives with his mother, wife and two children in the small village of Vani district. His children go to school, and his mother is provided with a retirement pension. 

Malkhaz works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. The family also runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides the cows, they have a vineyard with 1,500 vine trees, and 1.5 hectares of agricultural land where nut trees are grown. They sell cheese, nuts, wine and vodka locally. 

Malkhaz is a very hardworking man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan to build a greenhouse. After building the greenhouse, he will sow cucumbers, tomatoes and greens. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried goods. Mary Jane is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional food to sell for her food-vending business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional food to sell.

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en: Edmar is from San Carlos, Tukuran. He is 42 years old. Edmar is married and has two children. To make a living, Edmar manages and operates a general store. Edmar has been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns 15,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Edmar joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Roselline

texts.en: Roselline is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She used her previous loan to buy onions, tomatoes, cabbages and carrots. Her business did well and she repaid her loan. She also runs a grocery shop. She has been in business for the past seven years. Faulu Kenya has helped her become financially stable. Roselline hopes to expand her business in the future. She requires a loan of 74,013 KES to buy eggs, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, bananas, tomatoes, avocados and onions.

loans.use: To buy eggs, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, bananas, onions, tomatoes and avocados.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 43 years old, and a businessman who runs a retail shop. He is married and has been in business for over five years. He describes his business as very busy. Faulu Kenya has helped him pay school fees for his children.
 
He hopes to expand his business and be prosperous. He requests a loan of 84,442 KES to buy crates of soda, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil and soaps.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil and soaps.

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo is 44 years old, married and has four children. He used his previous loan to buy maize flour, sugar and baking flour. His business did very well, and he successfully repaid his loan. He has been in business for the past three years. He is very hardworking, honest and humble. Faulu Kenya has helped him learn how to save his money and expand his business. 

Someday, he hopes to buy a piece of land and open other outlets. He requires a loan of 74,013 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy maize flour, potatoes and a cooking jiko (charcoal stove).

loans.use: To buy maize flour, potatoes and a cooking jiko (charcoal stove).

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, 34 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with 4 children. She is earning a living from her transport service business. It has been continuing for almost 2 years now and she earns 3,000 PHP a month. To improve business, she is borrowing 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit which she joined in 2011 to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken feed, basins and cereals.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en: Lucresia is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, and earns a living by operating a transport service business where she generates a monthly income of about PHP 10,000. She has been in this work for 5 years and joined GDMPC in 2009. She is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She dreams of business expansion one day.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is a 50-year-old banana wholesaler in Makupa, Mombasa. She is a married mother of four and she is the sole support of four people. She has been in this business for the last eighteen years and she has done great. 

She is requesting her second loan to purchase more green bananas and will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of bananas and to pay her loan. This being her second loan, the previous one was paid successfully. Phanice hopes to open up other branches in town.

loans.use: to purchase more green bananas.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 44 years old. He lives with his mother, his wife and 3 children in a small village in the Terjola district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. Mamuka also works as an artisan and gets a monthly income, and his mother is provided with a retirement pension. 

In particular, they have 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides that, they have one hectare of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. Mamuka is a very hardworking man and has rich experience in his business.

He requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional cow, they will be able to produce more cheese. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 28-year-old woman from Nyalenda in Kisumu, a region within the western part of Kenya. She is married to Gordon and they have three children who are 12, 10 and four years old respectively.

Susan is a tailor and has been in this business for the last three years. Her monthly income is KES 23,000. She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to boost the business by buying more materials. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur within the region.

loans.use: to buy more materials for the business.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is a 28 years old, married, and has one child.  He is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. 

Nestor is in need of additional capital for his farm and is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. He hopes to expand his farming business and explore other ventures to augment his income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita is 44 years old, married and has four children. She lives in Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past seven years Sherlita has woven nipa palm fronds into mats that are used as roofing materials. Every month she earns 6,000 PHP from this business. Sherlita became a member of GDMPC in 2011. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the materials needed to make more nipa palm roofing. She hopes to improve and expand her business with the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to make more nipa palm roofing

loans.name: Juu Kwa Juu Group

texts.en:
Wales is in his early 30s and married.  He has been selling charcoal for four months.  Previously he was employed at a company. He works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily and is able to earn a small monthly profit.

Wales is requesting his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. His dream is to own a big grocery store one day.

Wales will share this loan  with his loan group Juu kwa Juu, which has a total of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 25 years old, married and has two children. He runs an electronics shop and has been in business for the past five years. He is very hardworking. He suffered a loss when his daughter died and this made his business go down. He used all his savings from his business and needs to boost his business. Faulu Kenya has helped him pay school fees for his children. 

Someday he hopes to expand his electrical shop and have more clients. He requires a loan of 74,013.75 KES to boost his business.

loans.use: to boost his business

loans.name: Malka Jansy Group

texts.en: Malka Jansy is a group consisting of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They are requesting a loan from AMB for 80,000 YER. Safa is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She is a housewife who likes her children to feel happy. Most of her children are in school. They like to spend nice times on the weekend, so Safa has a small amount to buy a television but she doesn't have enough money. She is requesting a youth loan for 20,000 YER, which she will use to buy a television to use in her house for her children.

loans.use: to buy a television to use in her house for her children.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 29-old-gentleman. He is married to Emily and the father of two children ages five and three. He runs a motorcycle business and has been in  business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 22,000. 

He has acquired a first loan of KES 50,000, which he plans to add to his savings to purchase a motorcycle. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan as well as pay school fees for his school-going children. He hopes to have a large car-hire business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 49-year-old married woman. She is an active and very hardworking borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. Since 1992, Shehnaz has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently she is interested in purchasing one buffalo to grow her business but finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Shehnaz has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help her to grow her milk-selling business, but it will increase her net income and savings as well. She hopes to provide a quality education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo to grow her milk-selling business

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is from Khoni District. She is 47 years old, married, and lives with her husband, grown son, and retired mother. Mzia’s husband serves local people as a driver and earns a small monthly income. The family is involved in an agricultural business. Specifically, Mzia runs a small dairy farm. She has four milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese products, which are sold at the local open market. Mzia works hard to make some savings and improve living conditions for her family, but she still doesn’t have enough income to implement her plans.

She requested a loan to renovate the house. The existing house is old and damaged. Mzia will purchase building materials and repair it. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved, and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Mzia hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, meat, cooking oil and baking powder.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a twenty-nine-year-old ambitious man living in Kasese town. He has been a banker for three years and works nine hours a day. He is also involved in a car transport business, and also has rental houses so as to earn additional income. His dreams are to develop real estate in housing  despite high default rates from his customers. Richard intends to use the loan to renovate his rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Norvin

texts.es:
Norvin es originario de la ciudad de Matagalpa, su estado civil es casado y tiene cuatro hijos todos en edad escolar, este joven se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable trabajadora y honesta.

Actualmente es trabajador activo de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado  desempeñándose como operador de equipo desde hace mas de 12 años el cual ha mostrado disciplina laboral.

Norvin con su salario lo invierte en los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, tiene en proyecto personal construir su casa pero con su salario se le hace un poco difícil es por tal razón que solicito el crédito para destinarlo para complementar la compra de algunos materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento y zinc ya que el cuanta con cierta parte de materiales que ha venido comprando con sus ahorro.
texts.en:
Norvin is from the city of Matagalpa. He is married, and he has four school-aged children. This young man is known for being a responsible, hard-working and honest person. 

Currently, he is an active worker at a water and sewer service company. He has worked there as an equipment operator for more than 12 years, and he has shown himself to be a disciplined worker.  

Norvin invests his salary in his household expenses and his children's education. He has a personal goal of building a house, but with his salary it is a bit difficult for him. For this reason, he is requesting the loan so he can use it to complete the purchase of some construction materials, such as sand, cement and sheet metal. He already has a portion of the materials, which he has been able to buy gradually with his savings.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and sheet metal to continue building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 57 years old. Elsie is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Elsie manages a transportation service business. She's been engaged in this business for 8 years and earns 3,000 a month for these activities. Elsie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In 2008, Elsie joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Altantsetseg is 54 years old and lives with her husband, daughter, and granddaughter in a small house in Niseh District, Mongolia. Her husband, Rentsendorj, age 56, works with his wife in their food delivery business. Her daughter, Dariimaa works at a local company, and her granddaughter, Anujin, age 4, goes to a local kindergarten. The borrower has been working at a shoe-manufacturing company for years and started her food delivery business in 2009. She cooks lunch or dinner at home and delivers it to local companies' staff during lunchtime and dinner time. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly, smokeless, and economic stove for her house in order to stay warm during winter and burn less coal or firewood. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly, smokeless, and economic stove for her house in order to stay warm during winter and burn less coal or firewood

loans.name: Zoriada

texts.en: Zoriada, 43, is married with six children. She lives in Sumalig, Tambulig. Zoriada has harvested and sold farm-raised fish to her local community for the past 7 years. Each month she earns about 12,000 PHP doing this type of work. Zoriada became a member of GDMPC in 2011. She has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to raise. Zoriada’s goal is to save her money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.name: Sortman

texts.en:
Sortman is from Tskaltubo district. He is 47 years old, married and lives with his wife, parents and three children. The children go to to the local school. Sortman’s parents are pensioners. 

The family is involved in an agricultural business; Sortman runs a small dairy farm. He has two milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese products, which are sold at the local open market. Besides his agricultural activities Sortman works as an artisan locally, and gets a monthly income. 

He has requested a loan to renovate the house. The existing house is old and damaged; Sortman will purchase building materials and repair it. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings, after a hard working day, in a more comfortable environment. 

Sortman hopes for your help and kindness

loans.use: to renovate the house.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is 35; she is a person with values such as honesty, humility, respect, and hard work that were emphasized by her parents. These qualities have shaped who she is, and have allowed her to set an example for her four children. She has a vegetable stand in her home which she has operated for about five years.

She is requesting a loan from Yehu so that she can buy more fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, greens, onions, potatoes, etc.  Her work requires great sacrifice, yet she performs her duties with great care, since she knows that she will be able put food on the table each day.

Mgeni dreams of opening a kiosk in the future. She is confident in the work she has achieved, and will use her earnings to pay for the education of the children who are still dependent on her

loans.use: buy more fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, greens, onions, potatoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a retail shop, and has been in business for the past seven years. She also practices farming, where she grows cabbages, beans and maize. Her business is very busy. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money, and manage her business properly. 

She hopes to own a wholesale shop and become rich. She has requested a loan of 47,941.88 KES to buy sugar, rice, soda, wheat flour, and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soda, wheat flour, and maize flour for her retail shop.

loans.name: Nimia Elemena

texts.es: Nimia, tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a su esposo y uno de sus hijos. Doña nimia tiene 10 años de tener su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: productos lácteos, carnes, verduras, pan, churros, frutas, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, cosméticos, dulces, refrescos, huevos, manteca granos básicos etc. Este negocio lo estableció después de que trabajo en una empresa privada y le ha ido muy bien, tiene su clientela fija. Ella solicita un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras para surtir el negocio de más productos como lácteos, carnes, refrescos, pan, abarrotes, productos enlatados y de limpieza y útiles escolares.
texts.en:
Nimia is 50 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula with her husband and one of her children.

Doña Nimia has owned her convenience store for 10 years. She sells basic household products such as dairy goods, meats, vegetables, bread, snack foods, fruit, canned goods, cleaning supplies, cosmetics, candy, soft drinks, eggs, lard, basic grains, and other items. Nimia started this business after she left her job at a private company and it has done very well. She has an established clientele.

Nimia is requesting a loan of 20,000 HNL so that she can restock her business with more products such as dairy goods, meats, soft drinks, bread, groceries, canned goods, cleaning supplies, and school supplies.

loans.use: to buy dairy goods, meats, basic grains, vegetables, bread, canned goods, cleaning supplies, and school supplies.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 42-year-old married man with six children living in the town of Kagadi, Uganda. He has been operating a boutique business for a period of two years. He also does agriculture, from which he earns an income to supplement the business. He would like to complete his commercial house, which he has started already and is halfway through the construction process. Inadequate capital and price fluctuations affect his business plans. His dream is to modernize his business so as to attract more customers. John intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is a very hardworking and active borrower from BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with his family. His wife is a responsible housewife and all of his children are students. Since 2007 he has been running his own hotel, which is the only source of income for the family. All of his clients appreciate his delicious food.  

Currently he needs to purchase products like flour, rice, eggs and chicken for his hotel, but finds it difficult due to lack of finances. Amin has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He wishes to provide quality education for his children. He is very much thankful to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase products like flour, rice, eggs and chicken for his hotel.

loans.name: Torype Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité se encuentra en el Décimo Octavo Ciclo con 17 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas, quieren poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a sus familias.
Maximina vende cosméticos de todas clases y marcas, es muy buena en las ventas y es que por eso le está yendo muy bien. Tiene muchas clientas y es gracias a eso que está creciendo y saliendo adelante, ya que las mismas clientas las promocionan con otras personas y así esta creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de toda clase, y así seguir teniendo buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee is in its 18th cycle and has 17 members. Each one makes a living from her respective business activity. They are very united, responsible and supportive of each other. They want to be able to continue working and helping their families.

Maximina makes a living from the sale of all types and brands of cosmetics. She is a very good saleswoman and is very successful. She has many clients and because of this she is growing and getting ahead, as these clients promote her to other people and so she continues to grow.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of cosmetics, in order to continue offering a variety of products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, which she then sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread in different colors for weaving.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en: Ma. Cristina is a 44-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest child is 13, while the youngest is 4. Her husband is a laborer who earns only a meager income. She is engaged in a motorcycle transport business. She has been in business for three years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy parts for the motorcycle and pay for its maintenance, like an oil change. She works hard to earn a living and would like to invest in any business opportunities that may come up to support her family as well as to save for the education of her children, for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy parts for a motorcycle and pay for its maintenance, like an oil change

loans.name: Marika

texts.en: Marika is 30 years old. She lives with her mother and brother in the small village of Terjola. The family is involved in agricultural activities. Specifically, they have 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides that, they have a vineyard with 500 vine trees and a hectare of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested products locally.
