Marika is a very hardworking woman and has a great deal of experience in her business. She requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional cow, she will be able to produce more cheese. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander has three children and lives in the Kericho area of Kenya. He is a farmer, which he has been doing for five years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. He also runs a motorcycle transport business.

Alexander is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which will use to purchase greenhouse materials. Calf feeding is what he enjoys most about farming. His biggest challenge is milk price fluctuations. His highest monthly expense is school fees. The loan will benefit his family with sufficient food and income.

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Alexander owns the following: cow,  poultry, automobile, but does not own pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.

loans.use: to purchase greenhouse materials.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old, a born-again Christian who is very hardworking. He is in the business of constructing recreational centers. He has been in business for the past five years. He describes his business as very busy. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, Peter has improved his lifestyle. He wants a loan of 68,799 KES to buy a motorbike.

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his business and become very prosperous.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a professional spice grinder as well as expand stock.

loans.name: La Cuadrita De Mi Barrio Group

texts.es:
El comité “LA CUADRITA DE MI BARRIO” se encuentra en el décimo cuarto ciclo del programa, donde cada una pone lo suyo y se ayudan, quieren salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto.
Un ejemplo es la Sra. Mabel, quien por medio de su trabajo y sacrificio del día a día está saliendo adelante, ella es una persona muy optimista y con ganas de ir progresando y saliendo adelante. Se dedica a la venta de platería, y solicita de este crédito para la compra de distintos tipos de joyas, ya que quiere tener mayor número de prendas de joyería para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella y sus amigas del grupo agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, pues les será de mucha ayuda, no solo a ellas, sino también a sus familias.
texts.en:
The committee “La Cuadrita de mi Barrio” is in its 14th cycle of the program. Each member helps out and does her part. They want to get ahead and help their families through group work.

An example is Mrs. Mabel, who through her work and sacrifice day after day is getting ahead. She is a very optimistic person and has the desire to continue progressing and moving forward. She makes a living from the sale of silver products and is requesting this credit in order to buy different types of jewelry, as she would like to have a larger selection to offer her clients. 

Mabel and her friends in the group are thankful for the opportunity they have been given, as it will be very helpful, not only to them, but also to their families.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry, which she sells.

loans.name: Jose Damian

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por otro préstamo, porque necesita fortalecer el negocio de ganado, maíz y frijol, con los fondos prestados comprara tres terneros, pagara el arrendamiento del terreno para realizar la siembra de la temporada de maíz y frijol.
El considera que es a través de los préstamo que ha podido continuar mejorando su situación, comprando lo necesario para realizar su trabajo agrícola, ha tenido ganancias por las cosechas, pagar los prestamos, cubrir gastos de sus hijos, tambien ha realizado mejoras a la vivienda.
texts.en:
José decided to request another loan to strengthen his business of cattle-raising and cultivation of corn and beans. With the loan, he will buy three calves and will pay the lease of the land in order to carry out the seasonal sowing of corn and beans. 

He believes that with the help of the loans he has been able to improve his quality of life through buying the necessary things to carry out his agricultural work. He has made profits from the harvests, paid back the loans, paid for his children's upkeep, and made improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy three calves and to pay the lease of the land for sowing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beads,thread, embriodery frames for her embriodery business.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
La Sra. Pablina tiene 41 años está casada con el señor  Maximino, tienen dos hijos por quienes ambos luchan incansablemente para poder darles todo lo que necesitan para una mejor vida.
La señora era vendedora de calzados en una tienda durante mucho años, su marido fue chófer de colectivos, pero Pablina tuvo la idea de abrir su propio negocio y con la ayuda de pequeños préstamos consiguió dedicarse a la venta de calzados, actualmente alquila tres salones comerciales con 4 empleados, cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes. Le gustaría más adelante comprar para su propio local ya que  le va muy bien en las ventas y que sus hijos estudien en la universidad ya que ellos no pudieron por tener que trabajar desde jóvenes.
Ella solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos, zapatillas, calzados deportivos, etc, y con eso poder tener bien surtido su negocio y ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Pablina is 41 years old and married to Sr. Maximino. They have two children, so both of them work tirelessly to provide them everything they need to have a better life.

Sra. Pablina was a saleswoman at a shoe store for many years while her husband worked as a bus driver. However, she came up with the idea to open her own business. With the help of small loans, she continued to sell shoes and now rents three commercial spaces and has four employees. Pablina has several customers. Later on she would like to buy her own shop where she can generate good sales. This would enable her children to attend university since she and her husband were not able to go because they have been working from a young age.

Pablina is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of shoes, slippers, athletics shoes, and other items. As a result, her business will be well-stocked and she will be able to offer a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes, slippers, athletics shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Zulfiqar Alee

texts.en: Mr. Zulfiqar is a 40-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. Since 2005, Zulfiqar has been running his own steel shop near his house, which is a very successful business for his family. He is currently in need of some products for his steel shop including iron, rods, iron sheets, tin, etc. But, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan for 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase iron, rods, iron sheets, tin, etc. for his steel shop

loans.name: Isha

texts.en: Isha is a 40-year-old married man with six children between the ages of 12 and 1 living in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his passion for agriculture, he started a produce business seven years ago. He has been able to build rental houses to supplement his produce business and also has continued to do farming. He dreams of educating his children up to University. Weather and bad roads affect his business. His plan is to set up a food store that can sustainably supply the whole region. Isha intends to use the loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 33, is a married mother of five children. She lives with her family in a community in Msambweni, Kenya. She has worked in agriculture, growing a variety of crops such as corn and cassava, among others, for two years. She states that she decided to go into this activity because she needed to generate income to support her children.

Aiming at providing proper maintenance to her farm, she’s requested a 20,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer to nourish the crop and also farming equipment. She hopes to improve her farm’s productivity and to attain a stable source of income for her family’s benefit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to nourish the crop and also farming equipment.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es:
Mario, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, es soltero y vive con su madre, no tiene hijos, él aprendió este oficio hace 10 años, lo aprendió de sus padres y hasta la fecha no tiene problemas.
Solicita un préstamo para el pago de arrendamiento de tierras para realizar la siembra de maíz y frijoles, esto le ayudara para garantizar el terreno donde sembrara el próximo cultivo, con el fin de tener una buena cosecha y tener para la alimentación de su familia. 
Su aspiración es continuar apoyando a su familia, a través de las ganancias que obtiene de las cosechas.
texts.en:
Mario makes a living from farming corn and beans. He is single and lives with his mother. He does not have any children. He learned how to farm ten years ago from his parents and has not faced any problems so far. 

He is requesting a loan in order to pay rent for land where he can plant his corn and beans. This will help him by guaranteeing the land where he will plant his next crop, in order to have a good harvest and be able to feed his family.

His hope is to continue supporting this family through the profits he makes from his crop.

loans.use: to pay rent for land where he will plant his crops.

loans.name: Santos Aurora

texts.es:
Santos, solicita un préstamo, para darle continuidad al negocio, se comprara productos como el arroz, aceite, frijoles, jabón, para surtir la tienda, esto le permitirá que sus clientes le frecuenten más el negocio, consuman más y ella se mantenga ocupada con el negocio. 

Con el préstamo anterior Santos logro realizar una buena inversión, que le permitió fortalecer el negocio, dándole las ganancias necesarias, sus hijos han estado en sus estudios, y ella considera un avance en la situación económica.
texts.en:
Santos is applying for a loan to continue her business. She will use the loan to buy rice, oil, beans, and soap so that she can stock her store with the items her loyal customers buy most often and keep her business running. 

With her previous loan, Santos was able to make a good investment that strengthened her business and produced the earnings she needed. Her children are continuing their studies, and her financial situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, beans, and soap.

loans.name: Digno Jesus

texts.es: Digno, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive en unión libre con su esposa e hijos, reside en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Villanueva, Cortes. El señor Digno, trabajo varios años en una maquiladora y al quedar sin empleo decidió junto a su esposa poner una pulpería. El negocio lleva dos años de funcionar y vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, harina, manteca, sal, café, pan, azúcar, pastas, salsas, churros, agua en bolsa y otros abarrotes. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir su negocio, del cual va comprar carne de pollo, pan molde, salsas, mayonesa, mostaza, productos enlatados, arroz, y otros productos de consumo diario. Este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar el inventario de su negocio y a tener buena clientela. Tiene como meta obtener ingresos para darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Digno is 30 years old and has two children. He and his wife are in a common-law relationship. They reside in a neighborhood in the town of Villanueva, Cortes.

Sr. Digno worked at a factory for many years. When he lost his job, he and his wife decided to open a convenience store. This business has been in operation for two years and there he sells basic household products such as rice, flour, lard, salt, coffee, bread, sugar, pasta, sauces, snack foods, bags of water, and other grocery items.

Digno is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL so that he can restock his business. He will buy chicken, loaves of bread, sauces, mayonnaise, mustard, canned goods, rice, and other everyday products. This loan will help increase the inventory in his business so that he can maintain a good clientele. His goal is to generate additional income so that he can provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy chicken, loaves of bread, sauces, mayonnaise, mustard, canned goods, rice, sugar, and other everyday products.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband Nergui works in a local company as an operator. Her daughter Enhtsetseg, age five, and son Hosbayar, age three, go to a local kindergarten. Davaasuren has been growing organic vegetables in her plot of land since 2010 and sells to local customers at her rental counter in a local market. She has just contracted with a local school and dormitory to supply her organic vegetables. She is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to cover transportation expenses to deliver the organic vegetables to the dormitory and school and also to purchase seeds and soil for planting. She is a hardworking, welcoming and modest woman. 

The picture of the borrower is at her outdoor counter of the local market.

loans.use: to cover transportation expenses to deliver the organic vegetables to the dormitory and school and also purchase seeds and soil for planting

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 29 years old and lives in Msambweni with her husband and their two-year-old child. She is characterized as a serious, calm and correct person who likes to do things well and with care. She is very dedicated to her work and takes care of her child who is her great source of joy and motivation to work hard.

She works at a local business center selling fish. She started this business with a small amount of capital that her spouse gave her. This is the first loan she is requesting from Yehu, with which she plans to buy fish and cooking oil. In this way she can help her family with the expenses that they incur.

Her dream is to open a fish depot in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish and cooking oil

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en: Hanadi is a 22-year-old single lady. She has two sisters and one brother. Hanadi is a university student majoring in mathematics. She is applying for this loan to pay for her next semester's fees, as she wants to become a teacher after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester's fees

loans.name: Edwin José

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven originario de la linda ciudad de Matagalpa que está ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua, su estado civil es soltero convive con sus padres, este joven se caracteriza por ser una persona de muchos esfuerzo, responsable y honesto.

Actualmente es trabajador activo de la empresa de acueducto y alcantarilladlo desempeñándose como mecánico de taller de medidores con más de siete años de servicio para dicha empresa.

Su profesión en si es licenciado en contabilidad pero debido al desempleo que presenta el país es que ha tenido que trabajar como mecánico pero esto demuestra que es una persona con mucha capacidad desempeñarse en cualquier trabajo.

solicita un crédito  para la compra de pintura y para pagar la mano de obra de un repellado que le está haciendo a su casa ya que necesita darle mejor condición y presentación a la casa de sus padres.
texts.en: Edwin was born in the beautiful city of Matagalpa in northern Nicaragua. He is single and lives with his parents. He is hardworking, honest, and responsible. He has worked for a water and sewer company as a mechanic in the meter workshop for over seven years. He graduated in accounting, but given the high unemployment in his country, he has had to work as a mechanic. This does show that he is able to perform well in other jobs. He is applying for a loan to buy paint and pay for plastering so that his parents' house will be in better condition.

loans.use: to make home improvements, buy paint, and pay workers to plaster the house.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu supplies fresh juices and fried potatoes to retail shops in Kisauni, Mombasa. She is 51 years old, married and supports four children together with her husband. She has been in this business for the past five years and she has done well. 

Zainabu is requesting her first loan to purchase crates of potatoes and fresh fruits for making juice. She intends to use the anticipated profit to expand her business. She hopes to see her business grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchase crates of potatoes and fresh fruits for making juice

loans.name: Miraj

texts.en:
Mr.Miraj is a 50-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Since 1992, Miraj has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells milk in the market which comes from his small dairy farm. 

Currently he is interested in purchasing one buffalo to grow his business, but finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Therefore Miraj has requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his milk selling business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide a quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo to allow for increased milk sales.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha is 31 years old. She is married with six children. The oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is four months old. Her husband sells shoes. She has had a food stall for one year. She has requested a loan to buy more rice, sugar, beans, oil, and soap. The profits will pay for school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and beans to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is married and has 1 child. She has completed schooling through a senior high school level. Gifty is a hair dresser in Akotokyir, near Abura, and has worked as a hairdresser for 3 years now. Her husband is a factory worker. Gifty uses her income to help support her husband with their child’s school fees. Gifty will use the loan to purchase shampoos, hair extensions and other products needed for her hair dressing services. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gifty plans to grow her hair salon business to meet the needs of more of her clients.

loans.use: to purchase shampoos, hair extensions and other products needed for her hair dressing services.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is 30 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is twelve years old, and the youngest is one year old. Her husband sells matresses. 

Marceline has been in business herself for four years. She wants a loan to buy more clothes for resale. The profits will be used to grow her savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joetta

texts.en:
Joetta is 38 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 16 and 24 years. They all live in Monrovia, the capital city of Montserrado County, which is the major area for producing fish for the Liberian local market. She says that she is good at managing her home and business.

Joetta has been running her grocery shop for the past eight years in her community. She learned her way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase items to resell in her shop, like soap, vita, oil, pepper and rice. She likes her business, because her daily sales volume is high. Her plan is to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to resell in her shop, like soap, vita, oil, pepper and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter to ease the feeding of his dairy cows.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 56 years old, and a farmer who has been in business for the last twelve years. She has four children. She also owns rental houses from which she gets an additional income. She is very hard working and diligent. Faulu Kenya has enabled her pay her children's school fees.
She hopes to have a herd of dairy cows and buy a piece of land. She has requested a loan of 84,442.50 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is single and has no children. She has completed schooling through a middle school level. Charlotte sells gari (a milled cassava dough) in Akotokyir, near Abura and has done so for some time now. Charlotte uses her income to pay for her personal expenses. Charlotte will use the loan to purchase more cassava to use in the preparation of gari. With the new profits from her expanded business, Charlotte plans to improve and grow her gari making enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava to use in the preparation of gari.

loans.name: Luisa Karolina

texts.es:
Luisa Karolina es una joven de 32 años que estudió la carrera de Derecho, ya que le apasiona defender los derechos sobre todo de las personas de escasos recursos.

Es una joven muy popular que habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde todos sus pobladores la conocen por su carisma y buen corazón, se desempeña como abogada en una Institución privada donde tiene más de cinco años de laborar.

Sus sueños es seguir estudiando y preparándose acorde a su carrera para tener un mejor nivel social y académico, actualmente está realizando un curso de profesionalismo pero tiene la necesidad de un crédito para pagar el costo del mismo, ya que son caros y por los bajos salarios de Nicaragua muchos sueños no se realizan pero estos créditos vienen muchas veces a solucionar estos percances.

Por tal motivo está solicitando un crédito para pagar este curso de profesionalismo y pide el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva y Ceprodel para que le otorguen este crédito para cumplir este sueño de su vida.
texts.en:
Luisa Karolina is 32 and studying law because her passion is defending legal rights, especially those of low-income people. She is popular in her city of El Sauce, where everyone recognizes her charisma and good intentions. She has worked as an attorney for a private firm for more than five years. Her dream is to keep studying her chosen career to attain a higher social and academic level. 

She is taking a professionalism course and needs a loan to pay the fees, which are high. Since salaries are low in Nicaragua, many dreams are not realized; however, these loans can often solve the problem. She is applying for a loan to pay the professionalism course fees, and she asks Kiva y Ceprodel lenders to fund this loan so that she can her realize her dream.

loans.use: to pay for a professional course.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer humilde del páramo ecuatoriano, ella tiene 29 años con mucha fuerza para el trabajo, María se define como una persona muy reservada, alegre en los momentos que pasa con su familia, María ama mucho a su familia ella casada y tiene una hija con quien vive, ha María le encanta el campo, es por ello que desde pequeña se dedicó a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales.
El crédito solicitado a FODEMI se lo invertirá en la compra de borregos para la crianza y la venta estos animales, María comenta que el trabajo del campo es sacrificado pero lo hace con mucho amor ya que se pasa en familia y cuando se pone muchas ganas las ganancias económicas son muy buenas.
El sueño que doña María tiene es el tener una pequeña finca con muchos animales para crianza y la venta y vender en los mercados y en las comunidades aledañas donde ella vive y con estos ingresos dar una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
María is a 29-year-old woman from the Ecuadorian moorland who works hard and delights in spending time with her beloved family. She is married and has a daughter who lives with her. María loves the countryside and has farmed and raised livestock since she was a child.

She is applying to FODEMI for a loan to buy sheep to raise and sell. She says her work is difficult, but she does it lovingly because the business is a family tradition and, when one puts effort into it, the returns are great. María's dream it to have a small farm with a lot of livestock to raise and sell in the local markets. With her earnings, she will give her daughter a good education.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise, reproduce, and sell when they mature.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is undoubtedly a role model for the community of Msambweni. At age 22, she keeps on working gracefully, always with the smile she has been known for her entire life. She has one-and-a-half-year-old twin children whom she wants to slowly teach the value of work and the spiritual values that will help them become better people.

The loan that Riziki has requested from Yehu will be used to purchase products of mass consumption such as rice, sugar, flour, oils, and snacks for selling in the store she owns.
This is an opportunity for her to grow her business and get ahead so that she can help her husband afford the things their family needs.
Riziki's dream is to see that she gets a permanent store to sell from since she currently sells from a small space that is an extension of her residential house.

loans.use: to purchase products of mass consumption such as rice, sugar, flour, oils, and snacks for selling in the store she owns.

loans.name: Zafar-Ullah

texts.en: Mr. Zafar-Ullah is a 53-year-old hardworking man. He lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. Since 2007, Zafar-Ullah has been running his own general store near his house, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is currently needs to purchase some products for his store including milk packs, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap, sugar, shampoos, and candies to sell. But, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings as well. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase milk packs, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap, sugar, shampoos, and candies to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Aulghr

texts.en:
Aulghr is a business lady who operates a tailoring shop. She used her previous loan to buy fabric. Her business did well and she successfully repaid her loan. She also relies on her husband’s salary, who is a mechanic. She is very hard working and makes sure that her customers are satisfied.
She hopes to open another tailoring shop. She has requested a loan of 84,442.50 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florance is 52 years old. She is married with eight children. The oldest is 28 years old and the youngest is seven years old. Her husband is a mechanic. She has been in the fish selling business for 12 years. She wants a loan to buy more fish for sale. She plans to reinvest the profits back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Punsalmaa

texts.en: Mrs.Punsalmaa is 66 years old and a widow who lives alone in a ger in the Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son Monhjargal, aged 34 has moved out and is working at a domestic corporation as an assistant worker. Punsalmaa has been running a grocery store in the neighborhood since 2005. She has a good record on her previous loans from XacBank and she is well-known with her good service among her customers. She is now requesting a loan of 2'500'000 MNT to purchase insulation materials and a smokeless and economic stove for her son's ger. She is a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to purchase insulation materials and a smokeless and economic stove for her son's ger.

loans.name: Igimbi Agahikaine Group

texts.en: Cosma is a 32-year-old married man with seven children aged between 15 and 1 living in Kagadi,Uganda. He owns a retail shop and he received the initial capital from selling local brew, a business he has operated for twelve years. With the proceeds of both businesses he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land where he practices farming. He dreams of educating his children up to the university level and owning a wholesale shop due to the vast market. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other to access a loan. Cosma is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Jeannette.

texts.en:
Jeannette is 35 years old. She is married with four children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is 9. Her husband is a motorist. 

Jeannette has been in business for 13 years. She wants a loan to buy more fruits. The profit will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 40 years old. She is married with five children. The oldest is 14 years old and the youngest is one year old. Her husband sells machines. 

Louise has been in business for 10 years. She wants a loan to buy more cassava, banana and tomatoes. The profit will go towards her savings.

loans.use: To buy more cassava, bananas and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a forty-two-year-old married man with nine children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been in this retail business since 2006. He has side income from farming.

James is challenged by insufficient funds though he hopes to have enough capital in future. He began this business in order to supplement his income. The purpose of the loan is to buy more merchandise for the business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Maame Aba

texts.en: Maame Aba sells utensils in Akotokyir near Abura. Maame Aba has received schooling through a junior high school level. She is married and has no children. Her husband is a driver. Maame Aba has been selling utensils for the past 5 years now. She is responsible for helping to support her husband with their family's expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of bowls and utensils for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her business further.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of bowls and utensils to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 38, is a married mother living with her three children in the town of Msambweni. 

For the last two years, Grace has been selling petrol from a small store in her home. She narrates that it has been a profitable project which has given her good results.  Her main customers are motorists who have a motorcycle taxi business.

Grace is asking for a loan in the amount of 25,000 Kenyan shillings to buy gallons of petrol to sell. Her main goal is to continue working to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy gallons of petrol to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa sells 'kenkey' (a corn-based dough) in Akotokyir near Abura. Adjoa has received no formal education.  She is married and has six children. Her husband is a security guard. 

Adjoa has been selling kenkey for 10 years now. She is responsible for assisting her husband in paying the family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more maize for the preparation of kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her capital base and grow her kenkey-making business.

loans.use: to buy more maize for the preparation of 'kenkey' for sale.

loans.name: Primitive

texts.en: Primitive is 39 years old. She is single with five children. The oldest is 16 and the youngest is five years old. She has been in business for 10 years. She wants a loan to buy more fruit for sale. The profit will go towards her savings.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for sale

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a 39-year-old married man living in Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a fisherman and has been in the business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of his income.

Rogelio is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets, and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to improve his daily catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets, and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a zero grazing dairy unit

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has two children. She has received no formal education. Ekua sells plastic bowls in Akotokyir near Abura. She has done this for some time now. Her husband works in transportation. Ekua uses her income to support her husband and pay her children's school fees. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more plastic bowls for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to increase her capital base and grow her plastics shop.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls for sale.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 20-year-old single man who has four siblings. Omar is a university student majoring in psychology. He is applying for this loan to pay for his next-semester fees. After graduation he wants to work in the field to get experience and to help in supporting the family.

loans.use: to pay for next semester's fees

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomene is 48 years old, married and has five children, ages 8 to 19. Her husband is a builder. She wants a loan to buy more fruits to sell, such as yellow bananas and passion fruit. The profits from savings will be used for paying children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more yellow bananas and passion fruit for sale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 35-year-old businessman who runs a mobile phone money transaction business. He has been in business for the past four years. He also sells eggs, fish and chicken. He is very hard working and humble. Faulu Kenya has helped him be financially stable. He describes his business as very busy and he has very loyal customers. 
Someday, he hopes to expand his business and open other branches. He requires a loan of 105,300 KES to add to his stock of eggs, chicken and fish.

loans.use: to add to his stock of eggs chicken and fish.

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en: Rose Mary is a 51-year-old married woman from Loon, Bohol. She has two grown-up children. She engaged and owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like canned goods, beverages, eggs, condiments and soap to the community. Aside from her sari-sari store business, she also sells Avon products like perfume, ladies' apparel and beauty products. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more commodities to sell like rice, soft drinks and Avon products. In the future, Rose Mary would like to expand her business to have a sustainable livelihood as well as to save for old age.

loans.use: to purchase commodities to sell like rice, soft drink and Avon products.

loans.name: Dorjgotov

texts.en:
Mr. Dorjgotov is 55 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Bor, age 53, helps her husband to run his business of an Internet cafe in a rental place. 

Dorjgotov has been running his Internet cafe business in that rental place for five years.  He is popular among his customers for his good service. 

He is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase construction and insulation materials to insulate his workplace in order to provide better quality Internet service to his customers. 

Dorjgotov is a hardworking and funny person.

loans.use: to purchase construction and insulation materials to insulate his workplace in order to provide better quality Internet service to his customers.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a 51-year-old woman from Kakamega. She is married to Henry and they have three children, ages 20, 24 and 27.

Rona operates a boutique and has been in business for the last 20 years. Her monthly income is KES 40000. She is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, and will use the entire loan to buy ready-made clothes. She will use the anticipated profit to open another stall.

Her dream is to become a successful business lady and to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase ready-made clothes  for sale in her boutique.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which claims a beautiful countryside. She has one child and has been in farming for three years.  Her primary income sources are milk, crops and a job salary.

She finds dairy keeping the most enjoyable aspect of farming. Her biggest challenge is buying dairy feed and maintenance of the dairy unit.  She will use the loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds.

Hellen chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of low interest and  an easy mode of repayment. She learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session that the loan should be paid on time so the cost of the loan is reduced.

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. The loan will increase family income and improve the family's living standards.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Hellen owns a cow but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, running water, television and DVD player but does not have solar power or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: La Esperanza Ii Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “La Esperanza II” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa usada y nueva, venta de articulos plásticos, confección de cortinas, artesanía, almacén, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Katherine, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste blue jeans, polera de cuadros de color negro y blanco, chaleco de color Calipso, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto, de adorno usa aros grandes de flores y encima de su cabeza lleva lentes para el sol.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa usada, desde hace 5 años. Comenta que trabaja tres días de la semana, en feria libres, vende ropa de mujer y niños en todas las tallas y diferentes modelos para ambos.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en distribuidoras de ropa que se especializan en vender por fardos a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará fardos de ropa para la temporada de primavera.
Una de las metas de Katherine es habilitar un espacio de su casa para poner un bazar, para atender a su clientela mas cómodamente, así con esto generar mayores ingresos para optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Katherine vive junto a su marido  y dos hijos de 20 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral crecer dia a dia para darles un buen pasar a sus hijos y a nivel familiar poder viajar con su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha dado la oportunidad de invertir y surgir en su negocio. Katherine tiene muy buena relación con las socias del grupo, ya que tienen una muy buena comunicación. Respecto a los cursos impartidos ha podido integrar todos los aprendizajes de venta a su negocio.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “La Esperanza II” [Hope II] and is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different businesses, including selling used and new clothing, selling plastic items, curtain-making, handicrafts, selling groceries and other services.  They all live in the city of Talca.

Katherine is a member of the group, and she is standing in the first row of the photo, the fourth person from right to left, dressed in blue jeans, a black-and-white checked polo, a dark turquoise vest, with dark, chestnut-colored hair worn loose, large flower earrings and sunglasses on top of her head.

Katherine has been working for five years selling used clothing.  She says that she works three days per week at open-air markets, selling women’s and children’s clothing in all sizes and different styles.

She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago from clothing distributors that specialize in selling by the bundle and at low cost, which economically suits her business.

With this loan she will buy bundles of clothing for the spring season.  One of Katherine’s dreams is to renovate a space in her house to install a store and therefore wait on her customers more comfortably.  She says this would generate more income with which she could improve her quality of life.

Katherine lives with her husband and two children, ages 20 and 2.  Her dreams for her business are for it to grow day by day in order to provide for her children.  For her family, she dreams of one day being able to travel together.

She is very happy and grateful to Fondo Esperanza, since they have given her the opportunity to invest in and grow her business.  Katherine gets along very well with the members of the group because they communicate very well with each other.  As for the classes that are given, she has been able to incorporate all of the teachings relating to sales into her business.

Talca is in the Maule Region, located in the central area of the country.  It is the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region and is the most important city of the Chilean Central Valley.  There is a curious reference to Talca in the Chilean phrase “Talca, Paris and London”.  Among the many legends relating to this phrase, some say it derives from words originally spoken by a person from England, which are “Talca parece Londres” [Talca looks like London], because of the abundant mist that frequently covers the city during the winter season, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing for the spring season.

loans.name: Lim Rebeca

texts.es: Lim Rebeca tiene 26 años de edad, es casada, vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa junto a su esposo. Hace 3 años que Lim Rebeca se dedica a sus propios cultivos, produce café pergamino húmedo y lo vende en el mercado local de su comunidad. ella esta solicitando el segundo préstamo a ODEF el cual es por 22,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para comprar fertilizantes para darle asistencia al cultivo de café y mejorar la producción. Su sueño es tener un estatus mejor de vida.
texts.en: Lim Rebeca, 26, is married living in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa with her husband.  Lim Rebeca has been growing her own crops for three years; she grows damp parchment coffee that she sells in her local market.  She’s requesting her second ODEF loan for 22,000 Lempiras that she will use to buy fertilizer for her coffee crop in order to improve yields.  Her dream is to have better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee crops.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del comité La Esperanza fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Emilia, es una mujer casada, activa y promueve el fortalecimiento del comité dándoles ánimo para seguir trabajando y haciendo todo para poder ayudar a sus familias. Ella vende comestibles de todo tipo, y tiene buena clientela, ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y aceptadas por sus clientes.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras y demás, para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende. Está contenta con su grupo, ya que todas se esfuerzan mucho.
texts.en:
The members of the “La Esperanza” (Hope) committee have set each of their growth as their main goal.  They are known locally for being very hardworking women.  

Emilia’s married.  She’s active and promotes the committee’s strength by encouraging them to continue working and doing everything possible to help their families.  She sells all types of food and has a good clientele since her dishes are very delicious and well-received by her customers.

She’s asking for this loan to buy meat, condiments, vegetables and others to continue making the meals she sells.  She’s happy with her group because they all strive hard.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
En la cálida ciudad de Marcona, rodeada de hermosos atractivos turísticos, en especial playas hermosas y sobre todo hay mucha variedad de pescados con los cuales se preparan riquisimos platillos, vive Luis. Luis tiene 49 años de ead y es un hombre muy trabajador, a pesar de los adeversidaqdes Luis trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas, chicha morada, y raspadillas. Luis trabaja en su pequeño negocio alrededor de 8 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con clientes y sobre todo porque sus productos son deliciosos y tiene mucha acogida.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá seguir construyendo su vivienda y poder realizar los acabados como tarrajeo de paredes, entre otros; de esta manera podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the hot city of Marcona that’s surrounded by tourist sites, especially beautiful beaches; there is an abundance of fish varieties that are used to prepare delicious dishes.  Luis is 49-years-old and he’s a very hardworking man.  Despite adversities, Luis works in his small business selling soft-drinks, ‘chicha morada’ [beverage made from purple corn] and shaved ice.  He works in his small business around 8 hours daily and can take care of up to 15 customers daily.  He believes he does well in his business because he’s kind to his customers and above all because his products are delicious and well-received.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided him he will be able to continue building his house and do some of the finishing touches like plastering the walls, among others.  In this way, he will be able to give his family better quality of life and continue striving towards making his greatest dream reality: to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Anita Renee

texts.es:
Anita es una mujer de 57 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Anita no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Anita trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas, ella vende diversos refrescos de cebada, maracuyá, chicha y otros, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, Anita se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Anita se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos para su negocio, tales como frutas frescas, azúcar, recipientes, vasos descartables y otros; de esta manera Anita podrá brindar un mejor servicio y atenderá  a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Anita, 57, is a woman living in the city of Chiclayo in Guadalupe District with her son who she loves and is her main reason for living.  She’s a kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward because she’s always been both father and mother for her son.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to go to work, Anita was unable to study a professional career but would have liked very much to have been able to do so.  In her free time she enjoys watching television and occasionally cooks delicious noodles to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Anita works in a small business selling beverages.  She sells various drinks made from barley, passion fruit, chicha [corn-based drink], etc.  She works every day from early in the morning and can work about 8 hours daily.  Anita feels good doing her work and believes she does well because of the good way she does her work and because of the kind way she treats her customers.

Anita is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy ingredients like fresh fruit, sugar, containers, disposable glasses, etc. for her business.  In this way, Anita will be able to provide better service and tend to more customers so she can continue working and striving towards reaching her great dream of owning her own sales stand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animal feed for resale in her husband's business.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 45 years old. She is a widow with four children. The oldest is 21 and the youngest is 7. She has been in business for twenty years. She wants a loan to buy more vegetables for resale. The profits will be used to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gantomor

texts.en: Mrs. Gantomor is 42 years old, a female head of household who lives with her son in a small house in the Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar. Her son, Ganbat, age 20, is a junior at the technical engineering university. The borrower has been running her barber shop business in a rented room in a public shower place since 2003. She is well-known in the neighborhood and has regular customers. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to pay her son's university tuition fees and other school-related expenses. She is a hard-working and modest woman who says "My only goal is to raise my son to be highly educated and a well-behaved person."

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition fees and other school-related expenses.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia sells fresh fish in Akotokyir near Abura. She has received no formal education. She is a widow and has three children. Emelia has been selling fresh fish for the past thirty years. She is responsible for supporting herself and paying her family’s general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save a little and to be able to invest some additional money back into her fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Deogratias is a 22-year-old married man with one child, aged 3. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda.

Deogratias operates a retail business which he started with savings from agriculture. He began this business in order to improve on his standard of living. He would like to start a new business and even expand on the existing one, despite challenges of late payments by his customers, thus affecting the growth of the business. 

Deogratias is requesting a loan to buy sodas, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Damas Del Barrio San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del Grupo “Damas del Barrio San Antonio” son mujeres muy trabajadoras, que se esmeran por ayudar a sus familias y darles todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante.
La Sra. Lucia, presidenta del grupo, es una mujer casada, con 6 hijos, es una mujer muy activa y trabaja mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, y con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y muestra muchas ganas de crecer. Su meta es poder tener algún día un gran puesto y tener así más productos y mayores ganancias.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras y tener así buenos productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women of the group “Damas del Barrio San Antonio” (Ladies of the San Antonio Neighborhood) are hardworking individuals who do their best to help their families and provide them everything they need to move forward.

Sra. Lucia, the group president, is a married woman with six children. She is an active woman who works a great deal. Lucia sells fruits and vegetables. With great effort, she has been able to get ahead and has demonstrated her desire to keep growing. Her goal is to someday have a large vending stall where she can offer more products and generate better earnings.

Lucia is requesting assistance so that she can invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables. This will enable her to provide good products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe y desde pequeño aprendió a trabajar ya que debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlos, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Gastronomía. Roberto es  muy trabajador, sobre todo porque vive al lado de su esposa y junto a ella tiene 3 hijos de 13,14 y 2 añitos, a quienes quiere mucho y es la razón por la cual lucha cada día para poder salir adelante. 

Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Roberto logro comprar una mototaxi, en la cual trabaja como chofer, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes diariamente, asimismo Roberto tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de carbón, el cual ofrece a los restaurantes que preparan pollos a la brasa; él cree que está saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Roberto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su mototaxi, así con esta mejora podrá seguir trabajando y llevando el sustento para su familia y sobre todo luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Roberto lives in the city of Guadalupe and learned to work when still very young because due to his parents’ limited resources he had to help them out.  Because of this, he was only able to study up to fifth grade in secondary school but he would have loved to study Gastronomy.  Roberto is very hardworking above all because he lives with his wife and they have three children who are 13, 14 and 2 years old who he loves very much and are the reason why he strives daily to get ahead.

With much effort and savings, Roberto managed to buy a mototaxi that he works with as a driver.  He works about 10 hours daily and can take care of up to 25 customers per day.  Roberto also has a small charcoal business; he sells it to restaurants that prepare charcoal grilled chicken.  He believes that he’s getting ahead in his work because he’s very responsible and very much wants to get ahead.

Roberto is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they've given him he will be able to service his mototaxi.  With this improvement he will be able to continue working and supporting his family and above all make his greatest dream reality: to own a house.

loans.use: to service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Ngobi

texts.en: Ngobi is a sixty-one year old man with five children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer and is also employed as a records officer by the local government. He began the business in order to improve his household income. He has a dream of venturing into modern farming, so as to cope with the ever-changing planting seasons. Like all responsible fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the University level and to set up sustainable income-generating activities for them. Ngobi intends to use the loan proceeds to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 60 years old. She is married with five children. The oldest is 32 and the youngest is 23 years old. Her husband is her partner in business. She has been in business for ten years. 

Mariam wants a loan to buy more potatoes, bananas and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, bananas and beans for sale.

loans.name: Yajaira Veronica

texts.es:
Yajaira es una mujer de 26 años, en su juventud tuvo una vida difícil con escasos recursos económicos y falta de afecto en su hogar. No alcanzó a continuar sus estudios en la universidad y terminó la secundaria. Es madre soltera y ha tenido que salir adelante con sus 3 hijos a quienes educa para un día verlos convertidos en profesionales. Ha sido difícil para ella afrontar sola su realidad, pero sus hijos se han convertido en su inspiración para conseguir las metas que se ha propuesto. Yajaira vive con sus hijos en el cantón Pastaza ubicado en la Provincia con el mismo nombre, perteneciente a la Región Amazónica de la República del Ecuador. La cabecera cantonal es la ciudad del Puyo una ciudad ubicada en medio de la selva amazónica al occidente de la provincia de Pastaza y a 924 m. sobre el nivel del mar. Es demográficamente pequeña pero tiene una gran variedad de sitios que son los preferidos para turistas nacionales e internacionales sobre todo los de actividades ecológicas y de deportes extremos. Una ciudad que crece económicamente cada día por las actividades de comercio, ganadería, agricultura y turismo, por lo que en ella se han establecido sucursales de empresas financieras y comerciales que pretenden aprovechar la actividad económica que mantiene esta ciudad. La competencia entre microempresarios es muy grande, sin embargo cada uno ha puesto su valor agregado para ganar preferencia con los clientes. 
Yajaira al ver la necesidad en su hogar y sin ninguna puerta abierta en las empresas por su falta de educación superior, decidió abrir sus horizontes y emprender abriendo una tienda de abarrotes en el Barrio La Dolorosa, en donde existen viviendas y colegios de donde provienen sus principales clientes. Abre las puertas de su negocio desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta casi el atardecer, trabajando desde 9 hasta 12 horas cada día. Gracias a este negocio, Yajaira puede llevar a su casa el sustento para sus hijos, sin embargo, muchas veces no puede abastecer al 100% la demanda de sus clientes por la falta de variedad en algunos productos, los cuales no ha podido adquirir por la falta de capital y las dificultades para obtener el mismo. Ahora solicita un préstamo para agregar variedad a su negocio y poder incrementar sus ingresos, lo que le ayudará a invertir en una educación de excelencia para sus hijos y para salir adelante como familia. Yajaira agradece el apoyo y asesoría que Fundación Alternativa le ha brindado para cumplir su meta de hacer su negocio más grande y además por la confianza que han depositado en ella.
texts.en:
Yajaira is 26 years old. In her youth, she has had a difficult life due to limited financial resources and a lack of compassion her household. She was unable to continue her studies at the university, but she did finish secondary school. She is a single mother and had to push forward by educating her 3 children so that they can enter the professional workforce. It has been difficult for her to face these challenges alone, but her children have inspired her to reach the goals she set for herself.

Yajaira lives with her children in the Pastaza canton, in the province of the same name, which belongs to the Amazonian region of Ecuador. The most important place in this canton is Puyo city, located in the middle of the Amazon in the western Pastaza province at an altitude of 924 meters above sea level. Demographically it is a small, but it has a large variety of sites, the more salient of those being eco-tourism activities and extreme sports, preferred by national and international tourists. It is a city that grows economically day by day because of trade, livestock, farming, and tourism. It has established branches of financial and commercial enterprises that try to benefit from the economic activity present in the city. There is a lot of competition between small businesses, however each one has made their value known to obtain customers.

After seeing her home in need and closed doors to many of the city's businesses due to her lack of higher education, she decided to broaden her horizons by starting a general store in the La Dolorosa neighborhood. This area contained many houses and schools which provided her primary customers. She opens the door to her business early in the morning until it becomes late, working between 9 and 12 hours per day. 

Thanks to her business, Yajaira can support her household and her children. However, she can not meet 100 percent of her customer's demand because she lacks those products, ones she has been unable to acquire due to the lack of money and accessibility.

She is requesting a loan to obtain a greater variety of products in her store so she can increase her revenue. This will help her invest in an excellent education for her children and help the family move forward. 

Yajaira is thankful for the help, advice, and confidence that Fundación Alternativa has provided which enabled her to reach her goal of making her business larger.

loans.use: to stock up on a variety of better products for her business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel vive en casa propia está casado pero separado de la esposa, tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes, la casa está ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la Ciudad de la Paz.

Miguel es jubilado rentista, y requiere el crédito para pagar una consulta médica en  oftalmología en una clínica privada debido a que los centros de salud de la caja son muy precarios y toma tiempo conseguir una cita. Al mismo tiempo se hará un chequeo general de salud.

El sueño del Sr Miguel era ver profesionales a sus hijos lo cual ya logró.

Es la quinta vez con IMPRO  y la primera vez que es parte de KIVA,
texts.en:
Miguel lives in his own house.  He’s married but separated from his wife.  He has three children who are all independent now.  His house is located in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.

Miguel is a pensioned retiree and needs the loan to pay for ophthalmology consult in a private clinic because the health centers in the social security system are unreliable and it takes a long time to get an appointment.  He will also have a general health check-up while he’s at it.  

Miguel’s dream was to see his children become professionals and he’s already attained it.  This is his fifth time with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for an eye exam and for a general medical check-up.

loans.name: Manuelita

texts.es:
Manuelita, de 28 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de muy amable y cordial, es conviviente con Enos quien es agricultor, con quien tiene 02 hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad  a los que quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Manuelita es la venta de bebidas gaseosas y parrilladas en su propia casa, con lo cual se ahorra para seguir invirtiendo. Cada día se instala en el frontis de su casa donde ponen una mesa todos los fines de semana y venden sus parrilladas, logrando tener una buena acogida entres sus clientes. Lleva realizando estas actividades con el apoyo de su conviviente quien la ayuda en su tiempo libre desde hace 06 años.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera los ingresos económicos que necesita para pagar sus gastos de su hogar. Se inició con temor pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que su actividad era muy acogida por la gente entonces decidió continuar. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta por que han tenido momentos bajos pero eso no la desanima y desea continuar trabajando, y mantener su negocio ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones económicas y personales. Este será su  préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Se siente agradecido de contar con una línea de crédito para continuar con sus negocios. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues los considera ser un grupo solidario y unido.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas a precio por mayor de diversos sabores para tener mayores ingresos y además invertir en las parrilladas.
texts.en:
Manuelita, 28 years old, is a hard-working and persevering woman, in addition to being nice and friendly.  She lives with her partner Enos, who is a farmer, and with whom she has 2 children, 11 and 4 years, whom she loves a lot.  They live comfortably in their own house.

The business that Manuelita has is selling sodas and grilled food in her own house, from which she saves to continue investing.  Every day she sets up in front of her house, where she puts a table on weekends and sells grilled food, getting a warm reception among her customers.  She has been doing these activities with the support of her partner, who helps her in his free time, for 6 years.

She likes her business because it generates the income she needs to pay household expenses.  She started hesitatingly, but with time she realized that her activity was very welcomed by people, so she decided to continue.  On the other hand, she says she doesn't like it because they have had some low points.  However, this doesn't discourage her and she wishes to continue working and maintaining her business, since it has brought her a lot of financial and personal satisfaction.

This will be her second loan with the institution MFP.  She asks for your assistance so she can carry out her plans.  She is grateful to count on a line of credit to continue with her businesses.  In addition to feeling comfortable with her communal bank, she considers them a supportive and united group.

She will invest the requested amount of 800 nuevos soles in the purchase of various flavors of drinks at wholesale prices in order to increase her income, and also to invest in grilled food.

loans.use: to buy various flavored drinks at wholesale prices in order to increase her income and also invest in grilled food.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, por sus atractivos turísticos, su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, entre otros. Cuando Maria  tiene un tiempo libre le gusta ver películas al lado de su familia y también le gusta preparar su platillo favorito el cual son los Seco de Pollo; ella solo tuvo estudio secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Agrónoma.

Con mucho entusiasmo Maria trabaja como agricultora en su pequeña parcela, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajadora y tiene el apoyo de su esposo.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá dar mantenimiento a su cultivo como abonos, fertilizantes entre otros y poder tener una buena cosecha, con lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo y poder seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
María’s a very enthusiastic, hardworking woman.  Her house is located in the city of Camaná, a city noted for its hot climate, its tourist attractions and its agriculture, especially of rice and broad beans, among others.  When María has any free time she likes to watch movies with her family and also likes to prepare her favorite dish: “Seco de Pollo.”  She only completed secondary education but would have liked to study Agronomy.

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided her she will be able to provide crop maintenance with manure, fertilizer and others to get a good crop yield which will make it possible for her to continue growing and be able to strive daily to make her greatest dream reality: to own a house.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano es un grupo de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, que se ha unido con el objetivo de ayudar a sus familias y darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La Sra. Laura, está casada, y vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles y cuenta que gracias a que tiene muy buenas manos para las comidas le está yendo muy bien. Se define a sí misma como una persona muy talentosa, y que lucha y se esfuerza mucho.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar insumos, que quiere utilizar en la elaboración de sus alimentos, como ser carnes, condimentos, verduras y demás
texts.en: “San Cayetano” is a group from the city of San Lorenzo that has come together with the goal of helping their families and giving them everything they were unable to have themselves.  Laura is married and living in San Lorenzo.  She works selling food and relates that because she’s a very skilled cook, she’s doing very well.  She defines herself as a very talented person who strives and works hard.  She’s requesting this loan to buy ingredients like meat, condiments, vegetables, and others she wants to use to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 26 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in Kasese, Uganda.  Five years ago she opened a stationery shop with the income given to her by her husband and has since expanded the business.

Florence is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy stationery, such as paper and files boxes to sell.  High cost of rent and inadequate capital to meet the demands are her major challenges while her dreams are to expand to new areas and venture into farming.

loans.use: to purchase stationery such as paper and file boxes to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, age 45, sells petrol to earn an income. She is an admirable person who always wears a smile and she is characterized by her happiness. She is described as a patient, humble, and hard-working person. She puts a lot of trust in her work and her desire to get ahead. She loves her entire family and fights to see them always happy.

The loan she is requesting is from Yehu will be invested in the purchase of gallons of petrol to offer for sale. For Asha, this is a way to continue moving forward and to help her family; it is an opportunity for personal and familial growth. It is for this reason that Asha is very joyful in her work, since she is doing what she can to better the quality of life for her whole family.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of petrol to offer for sale

loans.name: Hakilitoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe HAKILITOYERELA sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans, et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à SIEKOURANI, un des villages de la commune de Loulouni, cercle de Kadiolo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
DJATOU assise 1ère à droite fait de la restauration dans ce groupe de femmes HAKILITOYERELA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  200kg de riz, 2 chargements de charrette  de fagots et des condiments(tomates fraiche, choux, courge, oignon, concombre).Elle s’approvisionne SIEKOURANI et dans les villages environnants. 
Elle vend ses plats alimentaires au abords du goudron à SIEKOURANI, tous les jours et surtout les jours de foire, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA  dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the Hakilitoyerela group are mainly married women, averaging 40 years of age, with five children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Siekourani, a village in the Loulouni commune, Kadiolo district, the third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their 22nd loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance, institution with  the  goal of meeting customer demand. All  prior loans have been duly repaid.

Djatou, the first one seated on the right, is a member of the Hakilitoyerela group who cooks food for sale. She plans to use her loan to buy 200 kg [440 lbs] of rice, two loads of firewood and condiments (fresh tomatoes, cabbage, gourds onions, cucumbers, etc). She stocks up in Siekourani and in the nearby villages. She sells her cooked dishes by the paved road in Siekourani, every day and especially the days of the market, to a customer base composed of both men and women, for cash. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 90,000 West African Francs, a part of which will be used to pay off her loan with interest, and the other part for her savings. Her goal is to increase her sales volume and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy rice, firewood and condiments.

loans.name: Marcus

texts.en:
Marcus lives in Gardnersville, Montserrado County, the major area of marketing, with his three children and  wife. He is 45 years old and he is a university  graduate. His children are attending school.

Marcus says he saved some money over the years before he graduated from high school to start his business. For four years now he has been running his shop in his community  where he sells  rice by the bag. A problem he is facing is the road condition to his shop and not enough income because he wants to open another shop in the market.  He says his business has brought respect and pride to him, because today his family depends on him for help since he is the most successful one in his family. 

Marcus is requesting a loan to purchase a huge quantity of rice for his business. His plan is to see his three children in university, to establish another shop, and improve some of his family's lives.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of rice for his business

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.en:
Fabiano is a fify-nine-year-old married man with 12 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been in the cocoa business for 16 years and his main clients are middlemen from town and sometimes he supplies to the factory directly. He has a dream of paying school fees for his children and venturing into other cash crops like coffee, despite challenges of price fluctuations.

Fabiano intends to use the loan to pay workers who are helping him to harvest cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to pay workers who are helping him to harvest cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Yeremiah

texts.en:
Yeremiya is a thirty-six-year-old married man with six children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer and also operates a retail shop. Price fluctuation and high license fees affect his business growth while his dream is to own a wholesale shop. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University and set up other sustainable income-generating activities for them.

Yeremiya intends to use this loan to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil, notebooks and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil, notebooks and salt to sell.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en:
Sylvie, age 31, is a tailor. She has been engaged in this venture for 12 years. She and her husband, who is also a tailor, have a one-year-old baby and a six-year-old child. 

Sylvie has requested a loan in order to buy more thread and zippers. She intends to apply the expected profits toward buying a house.

loans.use: to buy more thread and zippers for use when making clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery material such as beads and embroidery thread

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred, age 41, is a farmer in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He grows cocoa and also buys cocoa from other farmers to sell. He has operated his business for over five years. 

Like most farmers, he is challenged by inadequate capital to buy necessary farm inputs, coupled with price fluctuation. Nevertheless, his dream is to become the leading cocoa supplier in the district. 

Wilfred intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to offer for sale

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco, de 42 años es un hombre bueno, amable y emprendedor. Es separado de la madre de su hijo de 14años el cual no viven con él.  Vive alojado  en la casa de sus padres a quienes apoya económicamente. 
El trabajo de Marco consiste en el transporte, el cual lo realiza en su vehiculo trimovil llamado mototaxi. Esta actividad lo realiza buscando pasajeros por los jirones, avenidas; para llevar a sus destinos de la ciudad.
